case.state: Strip poker? Well now, someone's forwar--omigosh, that little robot is so cute!
Some strip poker, hm? Why don't I--eek! A little flying robot! It's so adorable!
Hello there, Earthlings--oh my God, what's that thing? It's like a cute little Pyoro with a tube ring!
Strip poker? Well now, someone's--holding an adorable little robo thing! Can I see it, Bunnygirl?
Strip poker? Well now, someone's forward.
Poker is a favorite pastime of our ship's quartermaster. ...Well, not strip poker.
Strip poker? Come on, doesn't this planet have better pickup lines than that?
From thousands of lightyears away, I've come here--to play strip poker. How mundane.
Jura Basil Elden has graced planet Earth with her presence. I hope you're all more friendly than Mejare.
Oh my God, Meia, you actually wore the Cupid outfit? I thought you'd throw that thing out the airlock!
And look at you, Meia, dressing up for Valentine's Day! Maybe I should let you hog the spotlight for once.
Normally I'd do my best to hog the attention, but...oh, dear, I didn't think you'd really dress up like a Cupid, Meia.
Oh, I remember reading stories as a girl about a Cupid making me find true love! And now one stands before me.
You've certainly warmed up over time, haven't you, Meia? The old you would've shot me for suggesting that costume.
Hahahaha! It seems our reputation precedes us, Meia! Miss Leopard-print thinks we're a hostile alien race!
The dealer has his information a bit backwards, honey--maybe maliciously so. We're as human as you are.
Hey now, who's calling who aliens? From our point of view, you're the strange foreign woman, Jessie.
Oh, we're not alien invaders, sweetie. But we're not afraid to get hostile if you keep spreading nasty rumors about our homeworld.
Yah! Mmm, you're surprisingly soft, Robo-dear! How's my chest feel?
Got you! Ohhh, such a lovable little face! I'm calling you Pyoro-2!
Heeheehee! You're like a little robo-baby! I should've brought Barnette here to film this!
Hey there, little robo-honey! You're like my own baby! Oh, I can't wait to have a daughter to hold!
Hm? Look, Meia, the little purple girl is already gossiping about us. I knew we'd take this planet by storm!
Haha. The little gremlin-looking girl is gossiping with ~player~ about us, Meia. Shall we introduce ourselves?
Do you see Miss Purple-Squirt over there talking about us like we can't hear, Meia? We must look so exotic.
Hey, it takes a good ear and a better eye to be a pilot, Shorty. We hear you whispering to ~player~ about us.
I don't suppose you have any clue what Four-eyes is going on about, Meia?
I think Glasses Girl is addressing us, Leader. You do the honors.
"Carl Sagan"? "SETI"? Meia, you're smart. What's the egghead talking about?
Little Miss Misery seems to be moaning about us, Leader. No, I don't know why, go ask her.
Hello, hello...now, why's the dealer telling lies about me before I even sit down? I'm as human as you are, Jessie, as are all the women of Mejare.
Hello, everyone...what is this, some kind of Earthling xenophobia greeting me as soon as I arrive? You're Jessie, right? Well, I'm human, thank you.
Hello, hello...s-strip club? What kind of nasty old hag calls me a slut the minute I get here? You're not much more modest yourself!
Jura Basil Elden, arriving on the scene...e-excuse me? And who are you, Miss Leopard-Print? That looks more like something a stripper could cast off!
What was that, Miss Bookworm? I'm busy being beautiful--it's hard to hear you up here.
Hi, everyone! I think Shrimpy's talking to me--can a smaller girl tell me what she's saying?
Speak up, Miss Glasses! I'm a big girl--and you're way down there, mumbling about my spaceship.
I don't think I like your tone of voice, Four-eyes. All I heard was the tone, since you're a lot closer to the ground than I am.
Oh? Don't be so full of yourself, Jin. There's a whole planet of men who fear my Dread, and I know a few handsome soldiers personally.
Well, now. You're quite handsome, Jin, but I'm not such an easy catch. In fact, a whole army of men has been trying to catch me.
Oho. I've put plenty of "guys" at the end of my rapier, thank you. Even onboard the Nirvana, you'd have some handsome male competition.
I know, Jin. Women have been telling me that for years...but it's nice to know my beauty bridges the gap between the sexes.
Oh? Men tend to drop dead around Mejarians for other reasons. But...it's nice to hear a man complimenting me for once.
Well, don't drop dead on me before I learn more about you, Mister Sunglasses. I'm oh-so used to women's compliments.
Ooh, someone's done her homework, hasn't she? But I confess I haven't done the same for you--what's a witch?
Hmm...well, a judge called me a witch once for expressing interest in men. But I'm not sure that's what you mean, Sayaka.
I'm so flattered you read about my homeworld, honey! But I really have no clue what you're talking about--we don't have "witches."
...Witches? Mejarians call man-sympathizers witches...but you don't mean that, right? I'm surprised you know so much about me.
Hm? Oh, no. Is this how men flirt when they know what to make of a woman? Straight to "big tits."
...You know, er--Chazz, was it? I've never had a man flirt with me. Women save phrases like "big tits" for after "hello."
Oh, don't worry, honey. It's just the Mejarian way to show off some skin.
Don't you worry about a thing, schoolgirl. There's more to my outfit than meets the eye.
Putting any more on might frustrate our opponents, darling. Just be happy with all the skin I'm showing.
"Lady in black"? My name's Jura, sweetie...what's yours? "Cinnamon Bun"?
Maybe we ought to stick together, Meia. Foreign planets can be hostile to outsiders!
This seems like a good table, Meia. You'll stick with your crewmate, won't you?
Crewmates ought to stick together, Leader. Besides, who knows what Earthlings are capable of?
Perhaps we ought to exercise the buddy system on this cold, unforgiving foreign planet, Meia.
I think explaining Mejarian culture would get a little tiresome alone, right, Meia? Let's stick together.
Ooh, Meia! Let's both play at this table. We can scope out cute girls together...and maybe learn about men.
Oh, Meia, I'm so happy you came here with me! Bringing Barnette would just make things awkward, wouldn't you agree?
I'm glad I can always count on my fearless leader to have my back in these sorts of places, Meia.
Might you be referring to me, Chicken-Girl? I hate to admit it...but I'm actually a pirate.
High-class? I appreciate the praise, Ocean-Girl, but you've got this lowly pirate all wrong.
High-class? I do try to look the part, Miss Chicken-Hat, but I'm afraid I'm just a pirate.
Oh, I might look the part, Miss Moon, but pirates aren't high-class...I can be pretty nasty, actually.
Are you sure I won't be too much for your heart to handle?
...So. Do you think you can handle an alien?
I'm warning you--I can handle myself in these kinds of places.
Let's see what Earth people are made of...and if they've got any luck.
Is this how you vulgar Earth girls pass the time? How depraved.
Oh, my heart's beating so fast from the excitement. Mejare's ancestral home planet!
I flew a long way to get to this planet, you know. You Earth people had better be interesting!
Honestly! I fly all the way to my ancestors' home planet, and the first thing I'm asked is to take my dress off!
Oh, I can't wait to learn allllll about this little blue planet. Hahahahahaha!
There's quite a few girls back home who'd like to get me out of this dress, you know!
Hello, everyone! ...Hm? Yes, I've found a table, Meia. How about you? ...Roger.
Is this where we'll be playing? Well, then--oh, excuse me. My Dread leader is calling...yes, I'm fine, Meia. Honestly, I think you're being paranoid...
Wha--get out of my way, Dealer! No, I don't want cards! Damn it--!
Wha--oh, forget the damn cards, I have a whore to slice open! Move it!
You--h-hey, what're you blocking me for, Dealer? Forget the cards--what if she casts something else?
H-hey, move it, Dealer, this is way beyond the stupid game! She's--desecrated me! Look, she's planning something else--!
I--you--!
..."Dumb bimbo"? I guess I teased a little too much.
...Hm. I guess I hit a nerve.
"Dumb bimbo"? Looks like Shrimpy's got some claws.
Hmph. Seems Pint-size has run out of room for jokes.
...OK, maybe I went a little far with that one. Bad home life?
Of course it is. Nothing better symbolizes my elegance as a pirate than my blade!
It's even deadlier than it is cool. Granted, I could practice a bit more with it...
Just be glad you didn't make me poke that camera right out with it.
I'll tease as long as my outfit holds out, Miss Streamer. If the plebeian masses can't handle that, so be it.
Haven't Earth people heard of a striptease? If anyone's body is worth waiting for, it's mine.
What? This is what instant gratification leads to--an audience of entitled perverts.
So what if I don't appeal to impatient simpletons who can't appreciate feminine beauty? Tell them to get some taste.
I'm the most beautiful woman on all of Mejare, a planet full of gorgeous women, and your chat can't appreicate a tease?
Of course it was worth it! What part of Mejare's finest woman wasn't clear?
Hmph! Anyone who doubts Jura Basil Elden's beauty shouldn't be allowed to view it...but I'm generous.
Oh, does your chat want to see me now, Streaming-chan? Was it worth it? Maybe they don't deserve it...
And why should I flaunt my body for people who weren't patient? ...Oh, I can't help myself.
Wha--heyyyy, wait! It was so cute! Don't start the game yet!
Oh, buzz off, Bunnygirl--damn it, he flew away! I liked nuzzling him--don't start yet!
Wha--the game's starting already? Couldn't I get another minute to cuddle the robot?
A-ah! Hey, watch it, Miniskirt, I was cuddling the cute robot! Who are you?
Uh--I, uh...no cards.
Eek! I-I mean, no cards, Dealer.
Omigosh! This is--it is!
A-a royal--I mean, no cards, thanks.
Hey, Dealer--eep! N-no cards!
Oh, wow, Dealer. You're hopelessly in love with me!
~cards~, please!
Oh, Dealer? ~cards~.
I'll take ~cards~, Dealer, if you don't mind.
Hit me, Dealer. ~cards~!
Over here, Dealer!
Don't you want to give me a good hand, Dealer?
~cards~ should be plenty.
~cards~ will be all I need.
Hope everyone's having a good time.
Come on, let's get the swapping over with already!
Just a silly game. Swap cards quick and get to the fun!
Come on now, don't delay things with silly strategy.
Everyone feeling comfortable in their skin?
Hit me. No, not like that, silly. Honestly.
Hey, where's my cards? Hurry up.
I'm too beautiful to have to wait this long.
Dealer, all this attention is making me blush...
Don't mind me, just a timid little girl who needs ~cards~ cards.
I always lose when I play this. Am I bad, or are my opponents good?
Should I...~cards~.
Hmm...
...~cards~. Wait...yeah, ~cards~.
I hope I'm not being too distracting.
~cards~, please...haaah. A little sleepy in here.
~cards~, Dealer...I do hope I'm not making Barnette worry.
Oh, my! All good here, Dealer.
Perfect right from the start. Like me!
Such a brilliant single color. Like my hair!
The cards just fall into my lap. No swaps here!
No need for a poker face. You've lost.
Hey, Dealer, can you count to zero?
Zero cards. You heard me, Dealer.
Thank you, Dealer! This is perfect!
I'm all good. No cards!
Keep your cards. These five are perfect.
One is enough. The whole hand is more than enough!
Looking great! Just one.
One ought to be plenty.
One. Not that I need it.
One card, thanks. And thanks for the other four!
Got a single card for me, Dealer? All I need...and not really, even.
How nice of you, Dealer! Give me one just for fun.
Oh, it's beautiful to behold. One card.
Oh, my! All good here, Dealer.
Perfect right from the start. Like me!
All fitting snugly together. Like my body in this dress.
The cards just fall into my lap. No swaps here!
No need for a poker face. You've lost.
Hey, Dealer, can you count to zero?
Zero cards. You heard me, Dealer.
Thank you, Dealer! This is perfect!
I'm all good. No cards!
Keep your cards. These five are perfect.
Ah, jeez...four.
Awful. Four, please and thank you.
I'll take four, Dealer, please.
I'll take four, Dealer.
Uh, Dealer? Four. I need them.
Four!
I need four...desperately.
Not bad. Three, please!
I'll take three. No more, no less!
Three is fine.
Hit me. No, not literally.
Three will be all, Dealer.
Oh, Dealer? I need three, thank you.
Oh, my! All good here, Dealer.
Perfect right from the start. Like me!
All in a line, and a brilliant color to match. It's so beautiful to look at!
The cards just fall into my lap. No swaps here!
No need for a poker face. You've lost.
Hey, Dealer, can you count to zero?
Zero cards. You heard me, Dealer.
Thank you, Dealer! This is perfect!
I'm all good. No cards!
Keep your cards. These five are perfect.
Oh, my! All good here, Dealer.
Perfect right from the start. Like me!
All in a line. Don't mind if I do!
The cards just fall into my lap. No swaps here!
No need for a poker face. You've lost.
Hey, Dealer, can you count to zero?
Zero cards. You heard me, Dealer.
Thank you, Dealer! This is perfect!
I'm all good. No cards!
Keep your cards. These five are perfect.
Well, well, well! Two.
That's what I like to see. Just two, Dealer.
Dealer? Two. And could you make them a pair, please?
Oh, Dealer? Two cards.
Two is all I require, Dealer.
Two. Yes, that's all!
One is enough.
Looking good! Just one.
One ought to be plenty.
One. And really, it's a token move on my part.
One card, thanks.
Got a single card for me, Dealer? All I need.
One, and make it a great one.
Yeah, yeah, whatever.
Just deal anything. Get it over with.
Come on, come on, come on already. I'm bored.
Bo-ring. Let's just strip already.
Just take these. I'm not even looking.
You want a swap? Here. Whatever.
Meh. I'm not interested in the cards anymore.
Hey, we're long past the whole card-game part of the night, aren't we?
What a beauty. I'm a little jealous.
A few pairs to match mine.
Three of a kind...or something like it.
Hey, Meia...this hand's on Gascogne's level. Yeah, I said it.
What a wonderful little hand. Hey, Leader, you think anyone else would play this with us? Certainly not B.C.
As beautiful as this is, Dealer, couldn't you have given me something a little better?
What a Luxury Night this is turning out to be. That was the name I suggested for the Nirvana--hey, Meia, wasn't yours "The Sonnet"?
We have a winner, girls. And her name is Jura.
What a marvelously beautiful hand--and it was basically dumb luck, too.
The cards are just falling into my lap at this point. My beautiful, smooth, gorgeous lap.
This is great! Any good piloting metaphors, Meia? You've always got a few ready to go.
Hey, Meia, I'm about 99% sure my hand's better than yours. I'm 100% sure my breasts are, of course.
Great hand, but I'm still a little bummed the big reveal is over...
Hey, Dealer, do you just hate me--o-oh. Wait. This is actually nice...
This is just the sort of hand I needed to keep my thong up. My hips are pushing it down, after all.
What a lovely little hand...which affords me some time to fix this thing. It's a bit tight for a girl my size...
There's a spring in my step now! You might as well forfeit.
Despite my frame, I'm lithe and light on my feet. Watch out!
Happy? My exquisite outfit is now incomplete.
If you think I'm lively now, you ought to see me in a dogfight. I've got a killer instinct!
Hey, not bad.
You're so sweet to me, Dealer.
Better enjoy me fully clothed, because I'm not losing this round.
Lucky for you, my outfit is skimpy enough to begin with.
Hey, got a real knockout hand? You still won't get anything good off me.
Beautiful body and a beautiful hand? This just simply isn't fair.
Oh, good. I was about to draw my sword, Dealer.
Wait, is this...good? I think so...God, it's been a little while.
*Yawn*...Sometimes it's boring being this good.
Perfect. Like me.
This is the best hand I've seen since...whatever Earth's hand colony is. Probably exists.
You know when the enemy's dead-center in your sights? That's this hand.
Normally I only see this sort of beauty in a mirror.
This was definitely a better idea than trying to tinker around with my Dread all evening.
I hope no one was super excited to see what I'll take off this round.
What a beauty. I'm a little jealous.
A few pairs to match mine.
Three of a kind...or something like it.
Forget Meia. This hand's on Gascogne's level.
What a wonderful little hand. I can't believe I got Meia to come here...B.C wouldn't, for obvious reasons.
As beautiful as this is, Dealer, couldn't you have given me something a little better?
What a Luxury Night this is turning out to be. That was the name I suggested for the Nirvana.
Even better than I'd hoped, and I hope big.
Absolute trash...oh wait, it's actually magnificent!
I've only seen better hands on...Earth has a hand colony, right? Got to.
Looks even better than the sleeves I lost.
I think you need to propose to me already and get it over with, Dealer.
Come now, Dealer, spread the love around a bit! I'm beautiful enough on my own, and now I'm hogging up the gorgeous hands.
T-this is...I didn't expect you to really help me like this, Dealer.
Now this is a winner. Just like me!
Mmm...just perfect.
Like that glowing feeling after repelling a Harvest attack...and knowing your girlfriend's cooking is waiting for you.
Being smart and beautiful is just unfair to everyone else.
If I lose the dress on this hand, truly the heavens have sided with you all.
I'm out of stuff, right? I think so...eh, whatever, this hand is great.
Now's a good time to place bets on my underwear, because I'm not showing it this round.
Oh, this is magnificent. It's like the tingly feeling I get all over when my Vandread forms.
We have a winner, girls. And her name is Jura.
What a marvelously beautiful hand--and it was basically dumb luck, too.
The cards are just falling into my lap at this point. My beautiful, smooth, gorgeous lap.
I wonder what piloting metaphor Meia would have for this, because it's great.
This is just the sort of hand I needed to keep my thong up. My hips are pushing it down, after all.
Meia's a little touchy about how I have bigger breasts, but this hand would definitely impress her.
Great hand, but I'm still a little bummed the big reveal is over...
Hey, Dealer, do you just hate me--o-oh. Wait. This is actually nice...
What do you think, hm? Maybe I should roll this little thong off ahead of time...no, you haven't earned it.
What a lovely little hand...which affords me some time to fix this thing. It's a bit tight for a girl my size...
My body's the only thing I'm prouder of than this hand. Well, no, Barnette too. And my Dread.
Yes, yes. Perfect as usual.
Not even trying, and the luck just falls into my lap.
Orgasmic.
Fully nude for strange aliens, and still I press on and dominate! I'm such a bold, brave fighter pilot!
Such a good hand that I think my hair's getting a little frizzly from all the excitement. I need another trip to the spa.
Oh, it's like a triumphant orchestral score swelling for my heroic comeback! I always hear those in my head when I pilot.
Pretty good. Wonder if you can handle it, though.
So, you Earth people any good at poker? I'm a bit of a savant.
Hmmm...not that sure of a shot, to be honest.
In piloting terms, this hand is...OK.
What's the deal with the markings on these cards? Where's "Imperial soldier"?
My, this place is absolutely packed with girls! Maybe men aren't the lecherous beasts I thought they were.
Oh, damn it...I'm so rusty with poker. Is this any good?
When's the last time we played cards together, anyway? And by that, I mean you forcing me into it.
Just a nifty little pair. Or two, who knows?
I just feel so unsafe with middling hands like these. Good thing I have my sword as backup.
Yeah, yeah, I guess this is OK.
Not quite enough to inspire confidence in my dress staying on.
"Standard protocol," as a certain squadron leader I know might put it.
Expecting some witty comment out of me? I understand, but this hand isn't worthy of it.
Thoroughly, impossibly mediocre. Maybe you plain Earth girls are used to this, but I demand the best.
I'm hanging tough with this. Is there a fierce enough girl in attendance to pry my dress off anyway?
Such an uncertain little hand. Of course, I've always emerged victorious in situations like these.
...When is the last time I did a maintenance check on my Dread, anyway?
Oh, Barnette would be so mad if I brought a girl home...but there's so many cute ones running around this place!
Did you have to leave Barnette in charge, Meia? She has a lot of my fan mail to get through!
Sometimes I like to just wrap myself in my wonderful golden locks...and stay warm.
Feeling relaxed, feeling good. This game is a blast!
This game is tons of fun. Let's face it, though, my boss is gonna be sourpuss all the same, right?
At boring times like this, my mind drifts to cute little Barnette...waiting for me back home on the ship.
Oh, I hope Duero's not busy when I get back. My heart is beating so fast from the excitement!
All these unworthy Earth people ogling Mejarian beauty...it's like serving steak to a man.
Am I still beautiful and alluring? I know the big reveal is over with...
I know I go on and on about men, but they're just new and exotic to me. I'm still open to any advances, ladies!
Oh, this thong is such a flimsy little thing! Look at the way it rolls off my hips with the slightest touch!
How much can I tease with just this little thong? I suppose I can roll it down a bit, letting it sit underneath my butt...
Stay up, would you? This damn thing...am I gaining weight, or have my hips just stretched it too much?
Oh, would this thing behave? It keeps sliding down, and I have to tug it up into my butt just for a moment's peace...
There's a spring in my step now! You might as well forfeit.
Despite my frame, I'm lithe and light on my feet. Watch out!
Happy? My exquisite outfit is now incomplete.
If you think I'm lively now, you ought to see me in a dogfight. I've got a killer instinct!
OK, OK. This gives me time to think about what to strip next.
So average I can't even make fun. Bleh.
Nothing fun about mediocrity...jeez.
Just sort of OK. That's no fun...I can't be sure which way to tease.
Yeah, can't expect much more than this sort of thing. But what a bore.
I hope Barnette's not worried about me. I should've spun her a little white lie instead of just rushing off.
Oh, I can picture it now. These nasty Earth people strip me down, and then Barnette comes to my rescue before they ravish me!
So many cute women in this place. I mean, not at this table, but I can always enjoy a woman's company.
Not quite up to my standards, but they can't all be.
Not quite good enough to tease you with any confidence.
This really puts the meh in Mejarian.
This hand's gonna put me to sleep, it's so boring. Nobody try anything funny, now!
Speaking of hands, aren't mine slender and elegant? I keep them pristine, even in my life as a pirate.
Nobody get all aggressive on me, now. I've got a pirate ship behind me that wouldn't be happy with that.
Serves me right for thinking I'd get any excitement here. I mean, my daily life is full of daring and adventure already.
Surprisingly few women at this table. Don't get me wrong, men are exciting--but I love the female form.
Pretty good. Wonder if you can handle it, though.
So, you Earth people any good at poker? I'm a bit of a savant.
Hmmm...not that sure of a shot, to be honest.
In piloting terms, this hand is...OK.
What's the deal with the markings on these cards? Where's "Imperial Soldier"?
My, this place is absolutely packed with girls! Maybe men aren't the lecherous beasts I thought they were.
Oh, damn it...I'm so rusty with poker. Is this any good?
When's the last time I played poker, anyway? Meia hasn't made me do it in a while.
Just a nifty little pair. Or two, who knows?
I just feel so unsafe with middling hands like these. Good thing I have my sword as backup.
Pretty good, Dealer, but you could have given me something better.
Doesn't a woman this beautiful deserve more than mediocre?
It's OK, but...I'm not an OK kind of girl.
Ah, the titillating rush of uncertainty.
How very, very boring. If only my sweet Barnette were here to keep me company.
Don't think I'm vulnerable without my sword. I'm a big girl, and I'll use my height if I have to!
Is this really what you think of me, Dealer? Painfully average?
OK. I think...yeah, I think all my poker skills are coming back to me.
Gascogne likes playing five-card draw, too. There's also Texas Hold 'Em...what is Texas, anyway?
OK, OK. This gives me time to think about what to strip next.
So average I can't even make fun. Bleh.
Nothing fun about mediocrity...jeez.
Just sort of OK. That's no fun...I can't be sure which way to tease.
Yeah, can't expect much more than this sort of thing. But what a bore.
I hope Barnette's not worried about me. I should've spun her a little white lie instead of just rushing off.
Oh, I can picture it now. These nasty Earth people strip me down, and then Barnette comes to my rescue before they ravish me!
There's many cute women in this place. Men may be fascinating, but I'm sure any one of you can win me over with your curves.
I know there's girls who seem to be turned on by the delicate feet of a woman. I don't really understand it myself, but my feet are as beautiful as the rest of me.
This isn't quite up to my standards, but they can't all be.
This isn't quite good enough to tease you with any confidence.
This really puts the meh in Mejarian.

So tell me, are you as cute as Earth girls get? I want to meet a woman so gorgeous I have to avert my eyes and think of Barnette.
Yeah, yeah, I guess this is OK.
Not quite enough to inspire confidence in my dress staying on.

Expecting some witty comment out of me? I understand, but this hand isn't worthy of it.

Feeling relaxed, feeling good. This game is a blast!

Oh, I let my heart get away from me! Ren-sou-hou-chan was so cute, I just snapped him up without seeing if he had a chaperone!
Oh, you must be that huggable little robot's bodyguard, huh? Sorry if I was holding him out of reach.
Hahahahaha! That's the story Meia will spin you, but she's just curious about those dangling male tubes like I am!
Oh, is that the official recon report you'll be telling the captain? Can't you just say this is a "male anatomy expedition study"?
I have a very happy relationship with Barnette, Miss Jessie, and only Barnette. Meia and I are just a little curious about men, that's all.
Trying to invite Barnette here would've been so awkward. Meia won't tell the crew--plus, she wants to see a nude man, too.
I can always count on my fearless leader to protect me--and keep it quiet, too. But don't let her tell you she's not interested in men.
...W-what? Hey, what's with the attitude? R-remember who's armed here, honey!
...What's your name again? Oh, Juri. But it's cute how we have similar names!
W-what's wrong with that? I thought it was cute! Don't get all snippy with me!
Jeez, I just got here! What's your problem, short stuff? You're getting all mad over a vowel?
Oh, I've seen men before, honey. Don't get a big head. You're cute, but I happen to know a doctor who's just as handsome.
How characteristic of men to think they're the hottest stuff around. I've seen men before, darling--in fact, I've killed my fair share.
My, aren't we presumptuous? Mister Jacket-and-Pants here thinks I've never seen a man before because Mejare is all women. I've fought men.
I have seen men before, Mister Jin, and you're a cute one. The real question is whether you can handle a Mejarian.
Ky...kyoo-bee? No...Mejare doesn't have many animals. Why do you look so scared?
Oh, Sayaka, dear, there aren't many animals running around on Mejare. No white cat things for me...why?
Strange question--but I love how interested you are in my planet, honey! There aren't many cats there in the first place--or any animals.
...Cat-things? Sorry, honey, I haven't--Mejare barely has any animals wandering around. You ask some odd questions, you know that?
I'd like to think I look like the love of most people's lives, Chazz. But I must admit I'm not used to getting men's attention.
She must be quite the jewel, then, Chazz--and that fits what I've heard about Earth girls' conservative dress. It's good to know men appreciate my looks just as much.
Alexis Rhodes must be the talk of every runway on Earth, then, Chazz. How lucky you are to have her--and how lucky am I to be beautiful to both sexes.
...Tack-o? What's that? I just carry my rapier around for intimidation--and fashion.
...I didn't really get any of that, Aella, sorry. I'm a pilot first and a swordswoman second, so the dueling terms are lost on me.
Oh, this thing, Miss Meterstick? You've caught me in a bit of a lie--I have it to scare people! I'm not familiar with the technical terms.
I'm glad you noticed my lovely rapier, Armor Girl! I admit I'm not sure what you're talking about, though--it's mostly a fashion statement on my part.
Almost jealous? Looks like I need to doll myself up a little better. Oh, the tortured life of a pirate!
Why, thank you, Elizabeth! You're a cutie yourself, even if you're too shy to make use of it.
Ohhh, thank you, Elizabeth! I get a lot of admirers, but few just come out and call me beautiful. You're so sweet!
Don't be jealous, dear! You're quite the looker yourself--better than I expected from Earth women. I guess you haven't let men mangle you.
Well, well, well! Look at that, Meia, a gender ratio we're used to. Let's see what this lone man has in store for us, shall we?
Just one little man playing? Watch out, handsome--we're Mejarians. We know how to handle you.
A lone man representing his sex? Well, Meia...this makes me wonder how our prisoners would do in that situation.
Ooh, a single man playing. What do you think, Meia? Does this one look like his seed is any good?
Just one man? Watch out--Meia and I aren't your average women. Hell, we're not your average Mejarians, either.
Just one man? Hey, Meia, what do you think his tube looks like? Should be easy enough to find out.
Now this is why we came here--to see a man naked. Mejare is all women, you know.
Hi there, handsome! I'm Jura, and this is Meia--and we've never seen a man nude. So you'll give us a good show, right?
Let's hope this one Earth man is more accommodating than the Tarakkians we know, eh, Meia?
Ohhh, just perfect! Girls to talk to, and one little man to focus on! Meia and I are from a planet full of women, you know...
Well, hi there. Jura Basil Elden, home planet Mejare. Sourpuss over there is my boss, Meia Gisborn. Try not to let her ruin the fun.
Hello there! I'm Jura, and the cutie in the bodysuit is Meia. We're just your average Mejarian citizens--that is to say, pirates.
Hi there! Jura Basil Elden. Blue hair is Meia Gisborn--she's a little miserable, but she's really a sweetheart once you get to know her.
Earthlings, I figure? I'm Jura, and over there is Meia. We're from Mejare, the planet of women--so don't think we can't handle ourselves!
Earthlings, are you? Watch out--Meia and I are fighter pilots, and we've dealt with you hostile Earth types.
Hi there! I'm Jura, and bundle-of-sunshine over there is Meia. Watch yourself--she's my boss, and she's no pushover!
Hi there! Jura Basil Elden. That blue-haired bombshell is Meia, my squadron leader--I kind of dragged her here, so be nice.
Hi there! I'm Jura, and blue-hair-bodysuit-scowl is Meia. We're from Mejare...and she's a little shyer than I am.
Hello, Planet Earth! I'm Jura Basil Elden, and Sourface over here is Meia Gisborn. We're friends, but she won't admit it.
Mejarian beauties, taking center stage! Sorry to make you all feel inadequate, but it's our claim to fame.
Oh my God, Natsuki! Look at how teeny-tiny you are! I just want to give you a big hug and a lollipop!
Ohhhh, Natsuki, you're so adorable! You barely come up to my shoulder, you little thing!
What are you doing here, darling? You're as teeny-weeny as Paiway, our little child nurse!
Oh my God! Natsuki, you're like a pint-sized mini-woman! It's the cutest thing!
Hi, there! Jura Basil Elden, of planet Mejare. I'm more beautiful than ever today--August 31st is my birthday!
Jura Basil Elden, planet Mejare's homegrown crown jewel and daring ace pilot for the Magno Family. And, today, the birthday girl.
The beautiful ace pilot and ruthless pirate of Mejare, Jura Basil Elden, makes her first Earth appearance! And what better day than her own birthday?
Did you know that August 31st is a very special day? Yes, it's your first time seeing Jura Basil Elden's beauty, but it's also my birthday!
Planet Mejare's very own Jura Basil Elden, notorious pirate, takes center stage! And on August 31st, my birthday--does Earth still use "August"?
I hope you Earthlings don't keep me too long. August 31st happens to be my birthday, and I do have a girlfriend I need to share that with!
Aren't you ever going to get me out of this thing? It's starting to ride up...hey now, Elf-girl, why are you pitting me against my crewmate?
Do you think a look at my backside might distract you? ...Oh, I admit I don't do as many squats as Meia does.
I'm still not even naked. This is a bit sad...oh, don't put my butt up against Meia's, French-fry. Her breasts are modest, but she works out!
Every angle of my beauty should be displayed, don't you think? ...Oh, I'll admit my butt doesn't have Meia's tone, Potato-girl.
So, how do I look from this angle? And this one? ...Are you trying to make crewmates fight, Pointy-ears? Shame on you.
I don't know why it bothers girls so much when they're seen. I have nothing to hide! ...Oh, thank you, Lucina. I'm glad I could inspire a girl who wouldn't show her face before...
And how does this angle look? Hahahaha! ...Well, why wouldn't I be confident, Lucina? Do you see a flaw or a blemish?
I'm feeling so adventurous, standing here in the nude! My beauty admired from every angle...oh, she definitely would mind, Sayaka, but just don't touch.
Hahaha! I always say I don't mind being seen, but now I have to put it to the test, as a bunch of foreigners gaze at my supple behind. ...That means you, Sayaka. Barnette's pretty jealous!
...We aren't fighting, Megumin. Besides, I'd just feel dirty drawing my sword against a girl who barely reaches my chest.
...I don't know if you noticed, Megumin, but this is a poker game. I guess everything feels like a fight to survive when you're such a little pipsqueak.
Oh, boy. You short girls always have something to prove, don't you? We're not fighting here, honey. And if we were, I'd just hold my arm out and let you flail against it.
Perhaps you should train your pilot's eye, Megumin. You could see from the very beginning that they weren't attached.
A fighting witch girl should be able to notice things like detachable pieces from the enemy. I suppose we're not all blessed with an eye for such details the way pilots are.
Feeling any looser, Meia? Isn't this fun?
Don't try to sneak away, Meia. You're gonna learn how to be fun here one way or another.
Short blue hair, bodysuit, icy stare. Isn't my boss ravishing?
Good thing we stuck together, right, Meia? Pilots shouldn't go it alone.
Gotta be careful with those things. Too tight, and your fingers will get all tingly--bad in a firefight.
I admit--I'm a slave to fashion. You're always going on and on about practicality, Meia.
All about the practicality in your outfits, right, Meia? Apparently that means showing your butt off 24/7.
What would Barnette think of me, playing a game like this with strangers? ...Probably wouldn't expect any different, honestly.
Aren't you always saying my dress could get in the way during combat? At least it covers up my butt.
For all your talk of function over form, you sure have your form on display all the time, Meia.
Now what's the best way to make my dress all fall off at once?
Am I actually out of accessories? Damn it, I think so.
Heehee! I feel so daring tonight! ...Oh, pipe down, Daria. This is a human woman's butt.
How's my rear? I feel so adventurous! ...Listen, honey, this sort of butt is only alien to you.
...Is this what you do, dear? See a butt you don't have the measurements for, and declare it alien? Take a good look?
Are you sure about that, Four-eyes? How's the texture? The bounciness? Seems human to me, honey.
It seems I've been backed into a corner. If this were a dogfight, maybe I'd care.
Whatever. The game's basically over now.
I know, I know, avert your eyes. My beauty tends to burn like sunlight.
I'm feeling a bit checked out...all my big reveals are over with. Short of spreading my legs, I suppose...
It's a shame Paiway's too young to be here. Her camera would love this place.
...Jessie, are men really such simple animals? It's not like my outfit is modest, you know--what should I be doing, bending over and spreading?
...Hey, Jessie. Are you serious that men just need some nudity, and they'll fly into a lust? I'm not exactly covered up--do I just throw my dress off and dance?
What? ...Y-you didn't seriously get a royal flush? This has got to be some kind of trick--!
What now, Neptune? ...What, you actually got a royal flush? Dealer, did you just screw me over to make a joke?
You're not here to answer personal questions? Oh, but you're willing to show very personal areas? Earthlings.
I don't think any appeals to your privacy work in a game where we spread ourselves out for a crowd, Korra.
Oh, please. I might respect your privacy in a game of hopscotch, Korra, but this is Get Your Boobs Out: The Game.
Did everyone hear Miss Korra? She's fine with spreading her legs for us, but god forbid you try to make it social.
...Hey, Jojo-girl, why are men so scared of impregnating me? That's all I want one for!
...Hey, Jolyne, what do you mean, I can't tell men I want their seed? That's why I'm trying to seduce one in the first place! What's the big deal?
...Why are men so scared of making me pregnant, Jolyne? Is it painful for them? You sound like you've tried and failed at this yourself.
I see you're still mulling things over, Laevatein. Surely you've heard that sort of thing before--or has you entire life been lived on a code of honor?
...Oh, I'm--sorry. Your sister... you mean, she died, or...?
You can't get a man to like you, either, Cynthia? Ugh. Do they just not like blondes or something? Or do they consider black outfits a sign of evil?
...If you can't seduce a man, either, Cynthia, then maybe there's a pattern here. Could black and yellow colors trigger some kind of fear response in men's brains?
...You too, Cynthia? Even an Earth woman who looks just like me can't get men's attention...maybe men just hate our look. The same way orange traffic cones mean "danger."
"Hugging them tightly" and "hand-holding," huh, Cynthia? I guess you're not that different from Mejarian girls. Barnette just melts when I hold her, too.
...Apparently women are the same no matter what planet we're from, Cynthia. I do plenty of "hand-holding" and "hugging" with Barnette.
...Hey, Miss Copycat. Don't think I didn't hear that little jab you made before. Where do you get the nerve, calling me old? I happen to be 20.
...Just so you know, Cynthia, I heard you try to drag me into your midlife crisis earlier, and I don't appreciate it. I am not pushing 30--I'm 20!
...By the way, I heard that little comment you threw in for the Birthday Girl, Miss Champion. The next time you call a girl who's just turned 20 an old hag, look in the mirror first.
Um...did I bring up a sensitive topic for you earlier, Arash? You seem like you've got potent seed. I've heard Earthlings have had trouble reproducing.
...Oh. I'm sorry, Arash, are children a touchy issue? I remember hearing that reproduction got more difficult on this planet over time, to the point that even cloning failed.
...Why can't you have kids, Arash? You look handsome and healthy to me. Wait--is this about the reproduction problems I heard Earth had, where DNA started to fall apart?
...I appreciate your enthusiasm, Megumin, but I don't think blowing things up gets men's attention. I do that every battle, sometimes with a man in the cockpit.
...Megumin, do you think I'm some kind of civilian? I'm on the front lines causing explosions in my Dread whenever we scramble, and the men haven't fallen for me.
...I should remind you that I am a fighter pilot, Megumin. My Dread has plenty of explosive power, and the men aren't budging. Are you saying I focus too much on defense?
...You really think that's why I can't coax seed out of a man, Megumin? I've destroyed plenty of enemy forces in my Dread--I just tend to pick a defensive loadout, that's all.
So, I'm about as old as your daughter, Jessie? What a coincidence--you look old enough to be my Fama! Now, you had this baby with a man, didn't you?
All joking aside, you don't look so bad if you're old enough to be my Fama, Jessie. And as I understand, you had your daughter with a man's seed, right?
How do you think my home planet works, Jessie? All you have to do is fuse eggs together for two women to have a daughter.
I am standing here before you, aren't I, Jessie? My parents were both women, just like all my crewmates. It just takes a little science.
Women can have daughters together, Jessie--you can thank Mejare's technology for that. The Oma donates an egg for the Fama to carry.
You're so naive, Jessie. Do you really think you can only have children with a man? Mejarians splice eggs together all the time--oh, I'd love for Barnette to get me pregnant!

So, I'm supposed to cook for a man, Miss Elfie? I suppose you've been trying the dishes yourself. But it can't just be the food--Barnette's cooking hasn't won one over for me, but they love what our trainee makes.
Hah...of course it comes down to food with you, Erufuda, even in seduction. I noticed men love food, but Barnette cooking for them hasn't been enough to bend them to my will.
...So, Elf-food, keep men eating until they eat out of my hand? If only it were that simple. Why do they ignore my girlfriend's cooking but eat whatever our trainee serves?
...Miko, did you seriously tell me to arrange my marriage? We hardly have any parents left to do that for us. Is that a common practice on Earth?
"Arranged marriages," Miko? I see men are such bad lovers that Earth women are forced to wed them. No, thank you.
...I'm not sure you understood what I asked, Miko. "Chastity" and "seduction" don't really go in the same sentence.
...Miko, I think "seduce" might mean something different on my world. You know, flirting and caressing, not chastity and poetry.
I'm not sure your little body could handle a pregnancy, Miko. Those tufts on your head are wider than your hips.
I suppose the political class has evolved beyond the need to dirty themselves with pregnancy, Miko. You're not much bigger than a baby yourself.
Perhaps you've just wasted away on your throne, Miko, but you're right, motherhood seems like a poor fit. You'd need breasts and hips for that.
I appreciate the advice, Biker-Girl, but we've been intimidating men into submission for a long time. It's made them quite afraid that we'll eat their livers.
Oh, you don't have a fraction of the man-scaring experience I do, Saki. Men only seem to respond to intimidation by, well, being intimidated.
As far as I can tell, Saki, men's little rod-organs shrivel up when they're frightened. Otherwise we'd have seen one poking out in a raid by now.
I've been "showing men who's boss" for as long as I've been a pirate, Biker-Girl. All that's taught them is to flee from me in terror.
I think you and I may have similar experiences, Saki. Men see a big, tall, imposing woman, and they go knock-kneed. In your case, you just yell a lot.
Well, I don't consider myself the streetfighting type, Saki, but I hold my own in a world of rough-and-tumble pirates. Barnette didn't like me until I showed some grit in a crash.
"Kicking ass" is a good way to impress girls in a pirate gang, too, Saki. My girlfriend's more of the hard-boiled gunslinging type.
So Earth girls aren't that different from Mejarians, then, Saki. I showed Barnette I "got guts" after a decoy explosion trap, and now look at us--madly in love.
I'm actually more delicate than you'd expect a pirate to be, Biker-Girl. I never got picked on much since a had a dozen centimeters on the others, but Barnette... she wasn't impressed at first.
...What's wrong with me having a baby, Erufuda? I'm "responsible" enough to keep my waistline in check!
You're one to make implications about responsibility, Elf-girl. You don't even take responsibility for your own beauty, let alone a baby!
Our communications officer looks as thin as she always has now that her daughter's born, Erufuda. Maybe you'll gain weight if you use your pregnancy as an excuse to wolf down French fries.
I'm fairly confident I can keep the baby fat at bay, Elf-girl. If you got pregnant, I'm not sure you'd even notice.
"Loud noises," hm, Galatea? That's an interesting idea--I might believe it, except the men I've met have fallen for girls who yell a lot more than I do.
...Are you calling me a loudmouth, Galatea? Anyway, your theory has some holes--we have a trainee who's always yelling about UFOs, and she's got a man in love with her.
Whispering is a nice thought, Galatea, but I think you're just supposed to be quiet in art galleries. Besides, I'm far from our ship's biggest chatterbox, and I still get passed over.
Oh, I've tried the seductive whisper in their ears, Galatea. It works so well on girls, but meanwhile, our childish trainee cries out just from seeing her man, and he's hooked.
Thank you, Chazz. Sometimes I'm overwhelmed myself just by looking in a mirror.
You aren't the first to say so, Chazz. There are full-body mirrors in our shower room, and stepping in front of one even makes my heart flutter.
Oh, I feel the same way, Chazz! I have to reason with myself that I'm not really so gorgeous, but then I see my reflection.
I've met some men before, Chazz--muscular ones, at that. We took some prisoner on our ship, which tends to happen when you fight the male soldiers of Tarak long enough.
Met? I fight men for a living, Chazz. A few have wound up in our brig because of that, so don't get so full of yourself.
"Chasing"? I thought she was the love of your life, Chazz. Well, I don't plan on making Earth my permanent home, so I suggest you settle for her.
The mere thought of my "tits" is going to have to sate you, Chazz. Otherwise, keep chasing Alexis. This is just a little Earth vacation.
What...? I'm sorry, Chazz, but you're just a little too obvious. I know men like that, but they're at least daring when it counts.
...Oh, Chazz, you can happily enjoy my body from afar. You've just got no elegance to the way you talk, and I haven't seen any gumption to make up for it.
...You didn't seem ready for parenthood anyway, Chazz. Or do all men hate babies for not being tough enough?
...You seem pretty childish for someone who hates babies, Chazz. Can't men appreciate them for being cute, or are you obsessed with usefulness?
...Have you considered feeding your nephew something healthy for a change, Chazz? It's true that babies can make disgusting messes of themselves, though.
...Ew, Chazz, your nephew is always vomiting? What are you feeding the poor thing? Of course, they can certainly be gross sometimes without puking...
You like feeling superior to an infant, Chazz? Men really do have fragile egos. You should be making the baby laugh!
...Jeez, what kind of bullies can men be, making fun of babies? Why don't you play peekaboo with them next time, Chazz, and make them laugh?
...Who's Atticus Rhodes? That didn't sound like seduction, Chazz, that sounded like drugging a girl.
...I'd "zone out" around him, Chazz? It sounds like your friend just takes advantage of girls. You shouldn't be bragging about it for him.
...Card games, Chazz? I see you men don't like to part with your seed for just anyone. But still, I'm not just anyone.
Oh, you're putting me through a test, Chazz? A card game, no less. I'll never understand how men think--I would've thought I'm the ideal female specimen.
...Don't patronize me, Chazz. If "blonde and big tits" were enough to get men's attention, our prisoners would be eating out of my hand. But they're just annoyed with me!
...Very funny, Chazz, but you've only described my looks. I know I'm beautiful, but the men on our crew still pass me by! What am I doing wrong?
If you want to see me as a seduction expert, Chazz, just look at the way girls turn their heads when I walk by. It's men I can't figure out.
Oh, I can seduce just fine, Chazz, if the seductee is a woman. Men just don't seem to pick up on the same signals.
...So, Deimos, men like women's legs? My dress is actually quite conservative there compared to some crew members--but their legs aren't quite as long as mine.
Women's legs...they're definitely an important part of our figures, Deimos. Most girls I know actually show a lot more leg--but I have a lot more leg to show.
If most men are like you, Deimos, then my height should actually prove quite advantageous. I have a lot of leg, after all...and yet I hide it beneath my dress.
...Deimos, you've never--seen a baby? My God. Those stories about men reproducing in factories must be true--and Nevada must be another Tarak.
...Apparently the men of planet Nevada make their babies in factories, just like Tarak does. How have you never seen a baby, Deimos?
It's called fashion, Mr. Wolfpack. I know men dress themselves up in rags, but a woman's appearance is her soul!
Hey now, Dust, image matters to a woman--even nasty pirates like us. We can't all wear the same thing!
Hahahaha! Oh, Meia, it's so cute when men try to understand fashion. A woman's clothes are her statement to the world!
And why exactly should we dress the same, Dusty? Meia has her look, and I have mine--a billowing black dress to show my elegance.
...Don't men like their girls to have a bit of sass to them, "Suction Cup Man"? Though I'm flattered I got a compliment from such a sourpuss.
...Oh, and I suppose men don't expect any backtalk from a woman on this planet, Mister Suction Cup? At least you called me attractive.
...Hmph. Maybe Earth girls are afraid to make fun of a man, Suction Cup, but Mejarians are a tougher breed. And prettier, as you noticed.
Production line? Ugh, everything you say makes you sound creepier. I thought being made in factories was how men had children.
...What? Production line? I thought it was Tarakkian men that were born in factories! Just what is going on on this planet?
"Mid-life crisis"? How jealous do you have to be to call me old? ...Jealous enough to hide your little gremlin body in a box, I suppose.
We still measure time in Earth years, Myriam. That puts me at the ripe old age of twenty. How do I look?
And you sound like an envious little gremlin who's too ashamed to show her face. I look like the twenty years old that I am, and you know it.
Oh, please, Myriam. The ugly will always find a way to tear down the beautiful, won't they? My twenty years of gorgeousness are the envy of our entire crew.
Hoh...this is the curse of being beautiful. I have to deal with box-scuttling imps calling me an old lady to make themselves feel better. I'm twenty years old, but you knew that.
Hm? Oh, don't be so paranoid, Cynthia. I was just talking to my squadron leader--she worries about her pilots, after all, stuck on a foreign planet.
...Oh, you mean the comm line, Cynthia? That was Meia, our chief pilot. We've gotten separated, so we're checking in on each other like good crewmates should.
Well, Miss Maye, I come from a more advanced era. We've had space travel for centuries--in fact, I'm not really an Earth girl anymore, even if I'm descended from some.
Oh, I'm not an Earth girl, Miss Maye--just a descendant of some. Besides, I think this era might be before the great colonization boom centuries ago.
Oh, it's very flexible material, Jessie. It's really just a belt to hang my sword on, but I had to pick something that highlighted my dress.
The straps bend just fine, Jessie. I wouldn't wear something that digs into my skin, especially since it has to support my sword's weight--and it meshes so well with my dress!
Oh, Jessie, I could talk all day about my hair! These looping golden locks are my pride and joy. It all comes down to the fundamentals--brushing, shampooing, moisturizing.
Jessie. Maintaining brilliant blonde hair like mine is all about time and effort--no tricks, just brushing and bathing. It's made me the envy of our crew.
...What? We came here together and then separated inside, Cynthia. She's at another table.
...Do you understand what I said, Cynthia? Meia and I separated to head to different tables. I'm not scouring the planet looking for her.
...We separated inside the building, Cynthia. I didn't lose her in a magnetic storm. Jeez, what an airhead.
(Shhh! What if she hears us, Cynthia? And what greater crime could there be besides disfiguring a beautiful woman?)
(Keep your voice down, Cynthia! And you don't know what other spells she might be planning! She's a menace to feminine beauty everywhere!)
(Shhh--Cynthia! I can't think of anyone worse than a girl who'd mangle a beautiful woman out of envy! If she broke my leg and then set it, would that be OK?)
What? Oh, you've got it all wrong, Jessie. That was our squadron leader Meia on the comm link, checking in on me. My girlfriend's an ensign pilot like me.
Oh, that was our chief pilot Meia, Jessie, not my girlfriend. I hope it didn't sound too flirty--I do have an actual girlfriend on the team.
Oh, my girlfriend's on the Dread team, Jessie, but she's not here with me. I was talking to Meia, the leader--she's worried we'll run into trouble.
Oh? I was hoping to have a bit of a selection, actually. Or can an experienced Earth woman like you judge a man as soon as you meet him?
I've just met him, Jessie. I'd hoped there'd be a few men to compare him to so I could choose who has the best seed.
Oh...? I know he's the only man here, Jessie, but he's not the only one on the planet. Choosing this sperm is a big decision.
Pft. The only two men you see, Jessie, and you immediately dive for them? I expected Earth girls to have some standards.
I see you're not the discerning type, Jessie. These aren't awful specimens, but I'd still like to shop around first before choosing a man.
Er...that's OK, Jessie. I came here to learn more about men, not take sperm from the first few I met.
Oh, please. I'm sure Meia has a healthy respect for my beauty, but she's not one for romance. She's just a workaholic.
Meia's just obsessive about her work, Jessie. She'd ask for status reports from any one of us, just like she does on patrol or during flight sims.
Pfft. Meia's not social enough to be my lover--but we make pretty good friends, being so different. Really, though, I could be our newest trainee, and she'd still call in.
Oh, I'd love to know more about the history of this planet! When I was in school, they just skimmed over it--"Earth was the planet our ancestors came from, moving on."
Hey, I think you take your history for granted, Jessie. Mejare is only around a hundred years old, and everything before that is vague. Earth is my ancestral homeland!
