Are you still on about that? My sword skills are quite respected in the Magno Family, and I've made sure the Mejarian army respects them, too. I'm not dueling a child.
Why are you still bothering me about swordfighting? I'm not going to duel a little kid playing goddess in the schoolyard. My blade has drawn blood from actual soldiers.
Eugh. I didn't take up swordfighting so some twerp with plus-signs in her hair could pester me. Our crew trusts me enough to wield that thing in raids against armed imperial soldiers.
I see you, Komi. What is it? ...Oh, you have a handsome male friend? I'm glad he understands how important it is to look good...can you describe him for me?
I see you, Komi..."Naruse"? Well, I can't say I'm not curious how beauty manifests in an Earth man. I'm all too familiar with the ideal female form.
Komi...? How does such a shy girl have so many men in her little circle, anyway? Well, what does a beautiful Earth man look like? Is he tall? Blond? Sharp-eyed?
...No, Komi, you can't have her. But seriously, am I already starting to convert Earth girls to our lifestyle?
Yes, Komi? Oh, I see you're already getting curious about the woman's touch. Ask away.
...Sorry, Komi-san-- Barnette has eyes only for me. But if you'd like to find a girl to call your own, I can help.
Yes, Komi? ...What do you mean, sleep with others? I'm just flirting. I didn't know Earth was a planet of prudes.
Komi? I...Komi, what's that supposed to mean? I can't flirt around a little without being accused of cheating on her?
I see you, Komi...hey, who said anything about sleeping around? I can't compliment another girl's figure, or ask a man for his seed?
...Well, I don't brave the vacuum of space in this dress, Cynthia. We have suits for that. There's such a thing as casual clothing when we're on the ship.
...Being a "space traveler" doesn't mean I'm constantly in a raid suit, Cynthia. Why would I wear that on the ship, or when we've docked on a planet?
Well, I'm best known for being a high-ranking Dread pilot, Galatea. My sword is more of a personal sidearm for ground missions.
Oh, I wouldn't call myself a swordswoman, Galatea. It's really a side skill to my work as a fighter pilot on a Dread team.
My--anatomy? Unless you Earthlings have done a bad job stitching organs together, Jessie, my body should be like yours. Except better.
Er...Mejare wasn't colonized that long ago, Jessie. I have the same female body you do, except, you know, younger and more beautiful.
...Well, there's not a whole lot of room for that, is there, Jessie? I couldn't stuff one of those men's rods into this thing.
What could I even be hiding, Jessie? This thing is a few strips of fabric stretched against my hips. I know men have those bulges in their underwear.
Do you see anything extra peeking out, Jessie? I don't suppose you subscribe to the Tarakkian theory that a tentacle will slither out of me.
My hobbies, Neptune? God, we have to fly out so often these days, it's hard to get lost in anything else. I mostly hang out with Barnette, brushing my hair while she cooks.
I hardly have time for hobbies these days, Neptune. We could be called to scramble at any moment! And the rest of my time is with my darling Barnette...
Countries? A small girl like you has to think a lot bigger than that, Megumin. Mejare is a beautiful little blue planet settled by Earth women.
Mejare isn't a country, Megumin. Don't tell me Earth is still carved up into little pieces like that--we've got whole planets as colonies now, just like my homeworld.
Oh, you flatter me, honey. No, I'm not a princess. I'm just a lowly pirate, though one who has climbed through the ranks of the Magno Family outfit.
A princess. You're giving me too much credit just for looking nice, Megumin. I'm an outlaw-- a pilot for the Magno Family pirates, in fact.
Hmph. Pirates are girls just like you, Megumin-- we've just got nowhere else to go. I don't let that stop me from looking my best.
Girls don't become pirates for fun, you know. Anyone with no home to go back to can fall into it--that could be you one day, Pipsqueak, and you'd still want to brush your hair.
Well, I do fight on the front lines, Megumin, thank you very much. In fact, I've assumed command of our Dread team in several emergencies.
How surprised you would be, then, to see my brilliant red fighter leading the charge of our assault team. I answer only to our squadron leader, Explosion-Girl.
Oh, well, thank you, Jim. I always try to look my best--and that includes when I'm naked.
I don't think it's a shame at all, Mr. Raynor. You'll find that a dress is only as good as the body that fills it.
Oh, Jim, I wouldn't be very beautiful if it were all in the dress. As I like to say, you don't lose anything by being seen.
Strip poker is certainly not my usual thing, Mr. Raynor. I spend most of my time fighting in deep space these days.
I'm glad you think I'm too refined for a game like this, Jim, but I'm not some socialite. I'm a pirate defending her crew as we traverse the galaxy.
I suppose you think ballroom fundraisers are my usual "thing," Mr. Raynor? A young pirate in a strip bar makes sense--but I actually spend my time defending our ship.
Oh, I wear this all the time, Mr. Raynor--it's a combat dress. It's unfortunate, but I don't have too many others like it.
Well, try as I might to find better clothes on a raid, Jim, this dress just hasn't been topped in elegance or combat performance. Of course I'd wear it to strip poker.
Shouldn't I look my best for my grand debut on planet Earth, Mr. Raynor? Besides, I haven't found much else--I wear it to breakfast, and I wear it to battle.
Well, excuse me for being a pirate, Mr. Raynor. I don't have a wardrobe full of casual wear. Do you know how hard it is to steal clothes that fit me?
Clothes are just clothes, Jessie. Imagine having to power the things just to wear them properly.
Not everything needs to be high-tech, Jessie. People perfected clothes before space travel--now we just make it look good.
I've always been more concerned with the figure underneath a dress, Jessie. Why would you wear something that could electrocute you?
Ehehe...are you sure about that, Jessie? A pirate never reveals herself until she has the advantage.
Mhmhmhm. Do you know what a pirate's goal is in any conflict, Jessie? To deceive.
Oh, I'm feeling quite comfortable, Old Lady. In fact, I only need to lighten my load a bit further.
My, Jessie, aren't we projecting? I'm used to this dress, and to the spotlight. I think I'll just drop another little thing.
What do I have to be insecure about, Jessie? I'm sure you remember being young and unwrinkled.
Maybe if I had sagging breasts like yours, Jessie, I'd feel shy about revealing them. As it stands...
Having a daughter must make women read too deep into everything girls do. I'm just having fun, Jessie! Don't you remember that, along with being young?

condition.saying: signed up for strip poker, Blondie

case.state: You're quite the seductress, aren't you, Biker-Girl? I've been getting "tits and ass" praise since puberty, so you'd better have more creative compliments.
Speeding along in your biker gang doesn't leave you much time to put my "big tits and ass" a little more romantically, does it, Saki?
I'm glad to have filled the quota for this table's beauty, Saki. We'll see if you're who I wanted to play with, since you're a little coarse with your words.
I'm an alien in the technical sense, Chazz. I wasn't born here, but I'm as human as you. Assuming, of course, that men and women really are the same species.
...Well, I can't strike big butt off that list, Chazz, but I'm not an alien. I'm just a simple, beautiful human girl, born on another world. Not that I really know if men are humans.

condition.saying: I only just learned of space travel.

case.state: It is easy, Galatea! How do you think I flew here? Humans colonized my homeworld by pioneering easy space travel.
Well, that's because it is easy, Galatea. I know you struggled to put satellites in the sky centuries ago, but Mejare only exists because reaching orbit is like waking up in the morning now.
Don't you like my dress, Yuri? I think it's quite sophisticated while remaining combat-practical.
Why, yes, Yuri, this my favorite outfit. In what else can I look so elegant, yet still wield a sword and dash to the hangar?
Oh, yes, Yuri, I'm almost always dressed like this. It just screams elegance and dynamism, don't you think?
..."Nevada," Deimos? I can't say I've ever heard of the place. I do know a planet where there aren't any girls--it's right next to my home--but I thought it was the only one.
Ah, are you a foreigner, too, Deimos? Maybe Mejare's sister planet Tarak isn't the only colony with a no-females policy. I'm sure you're happy to be off planet "Nevada."
Unlike you, Perona, I need a ship to fly. So my dress is tailored for combat purposes, in addition to hugging my body quite nicely.
Even without the luxury of levitation, Perona, I don't need my dress weighing me down and restricting my legs in the middle of battle. Its elegance is a nice bonus.
Hm? No, I'm not a model, Amy, though I agree I have the credentials. I'm just the galaxy's most beautiful pirate.
Oh, modeling might have been my career path in another life, Amy. As it stands, I'm stuck making a life of piracy as elegant as I can.
...Yes, I like girls too, Amy. You might say I started that way, and that men are a curious new element.
...I'd say girls are nice to have around, Amy. Men have made my life quite a bit more complicated as of late.
I suppose if I say yes, then it won't be unsolicited. I just hope you can get the entire thought out before you see a spider crawl by.
I don't see how it could hurt. Now, try to concentrate, Amy, or I might just learn some spider facts.
What you said earlier about not being confident in my own appearance, Amy? I can hold a crowd's attention just fine fully dressed.
I'm sure that modest mentality gets a girl like you very far, Amy. I don't even need to strip to draw all eyes in a room, thank you.

condition.saying: up to the task or not

case.state:
Oh, I guess I finally have to put my body where my mouth is.
...Yeah, yeah, Amy, don't get too excited before the big reveal.
Oh, I'm glad I could finally get Miss Eight-Eyes's attention. I wasn't wearing an overcoat here, you know.
Ahem. I think you might be projecting a bit, Amy. This is hardly the sort of thing that'd make me...sweat.
I've kept my head straight in times far worse than standing nude at a poker table, Amy. You might be getting all worked up at the sight of me.
Why, thank you, Miss Li. As for all the skin I'm showing...well, my girlfriend Barnette is even worse with that.
Oh, thank you, Chun-Li! You're in great shape yourself. And if you think this is revealing, you should see my girlfriend.
You call this revealing? It's draped over me and hides some of my curves! You want revealing, you should meet my girlfriend.
Oh, please, Miss Martial Artist. My girlfriend Barnette walks around in a leotard and stockings--don't call me scantily-clad.
It's called flirting, you big lug. I know men lack all subtlety, but having a man's baby will make me famous on Mejare!
Oh, do I have to spell it out, Mister Muscles? Having a man's baby on Mejare will make me a superstar!
I'm a smarter girl than I look, Mister Jojo. It's not just the tubes I want to play with--I want the seed, so I'll be famous back on Mejare!
Well, Mister Mountain-Man, I'm tired of being only known as a criminal back home. Once Mejare warms up to men, I'll be the first to have a man's baby--I'll be famous.
You're just jealous mine comes first alphabetically, copycat. Earth girls think they're the center of the universe.
Hey, who's copying who? I didn't know Earth girls were so presumptuous.
Oh, give me a break. I'm already well aware of you xenophobic Earth girls believe you've done everything first.
Who says I'm the copycat? Yet another example of Earthlings thinking they're the only ones who matter.
What's the matter, little boy? Am I not what you expected?
Why, yes, I am...and a Mejarian one, at that. But don't worry. Mejarians don't eat the livers of every man they meet.
I am a space pirate, but there's nothing to be afraid of, honey. I'm just here to learn about your lovely little blue planet, and maybe the men on it.
I'm not just any space pirate, sweetheart. I'm a Mejarian...and we're not afraid of little men like you.
Plasma, huh? Well, I'd say my beauty is just as warm...
My, my, yes, I do, Miss Rarity. Thanks for noticing--would your newer self agree, too?
Oh, really? What strikes you in particular--my fabulous black dress? My studded boots? My jewelry? Tastes can change offline, right?
Heehee! Well, it's nice to hear that from Miss Fashionista herself--even the old version of her.
You're looking rather spiffy yourself, darling, even if you take fair skin a little far. But I can excuse that when you've been replaced.
Really, now? I would say there's two types of people in general...beautiful and not.
You could say that about the whole universe...either you're gorgeous, or you're not Mejarian.
I'm listening, Sei, darling...my two types are "beautiful" and "ugly."
Pretty and...not pretty? That's the two types of women we all fall into...
I've won many a dogfight in the harsh magnetic storms and asteroid fields of space, so yes, this should be a cinch. How's the offline storm?
I certainly hope I can handle a silly card game, Miss Rarity. I'm still online, you know.
Hey, Pearly-White, you think I lollygag in front of mirrors all day? I'm a fighter pilot--this little card game is easy, and so is staying online.
You're right, Miss Fashionette--I should stick to darting around supernovas and leave card-playing to the smart girls. Smart offline girls.
Well, Sei, since your first one really got my heart beating faster...
I'm listening, dearie. Earth is being such a generous, exciting host planet, after all.
Ooh, I'm always up for expanding my vocabulary. Besides, knowing you, it'll be devilish...
All I know of Earth expressions is that you call anything besides Earth "space." But go on, Sei...I trust your fiery sexual energy.
Come on, darling, you don't want me to spoil the surprise, do you? Surely a fashionista can figure it out...even an offline one.
Haven't you taken my outfit apart with your eyes yet, Miss Fashion Designer? Come on, guess. Or I'll ask EG Rarity!
Good question, Miss Rarity...hm, I think I've got it. But why don't you put your fashion skills to the test and guess? We've got plenty of time offline.
Oh, I don't know, Miss Fashionette, maybe you should tell me! Where's that once-online spirit, huh?
What are you so worried about, honey? I don't lose anything by being seen...in fact, I think I gain more fans.
Sei, darling, don't worry about me! Rule number one on Mejare: you're beautiful, and be proud of your body.
Oh, don't gaze at me with those big worried puppy-dog eyes, darling. I love the way I look!
I'm sure if anything happens, the cutie soldier will find it in her heart to protect the lovely pirate. Besides...Mejarians don't see shame in our figures.
Come on, Pale-white, don't make me say it. Overlooking things is why you got replaced.
Oh, I'm not done teasing quite yet, Fashion Girl. Do you see anything left? Look closely, Oldie.
Well, Rarity, I'd say I'm hiding one last accessory from you...but it's not really hidden, is it? You have a lot of time to search these days.
Now, now, Old-Rarity, there's something you get taught when you become a fighter pilot--hiding in plain sight. And surviving.
Use your sharp medic's eye and predict it for yourself, Policegirl.
Come on, I don't have to spell it out for a medic who's seen it all, do I?
A medic like you must know all about ripping people's clothes off. Surely you can see what's next.
Little too much to drink, Sei, darling? I would think a medic would know already...as you study my anatomy.
And how do you know so much about my outfit, Pint-size? Have you been staring at me?
After all my accessories, you're convinced I've only got my dress and underwear left? Somebody's been studying me closely.
Hey, Small-fry, how do you know so much about my very Mejarian outfit? Are you watching me out of jealousy or lust?
What's wrong with wearing no bra? And who gave you the inside scoop on my layering, anyway--have you been staring?
Oh, I agree. But I live a life of crime, don't I? As long as I get it back afterwards, I'll manage...it's tough out there! You know.
Well, normally I'd be complaining, but losing here just means I get to show off! You don't get those opportunities anymore...
If it means I can show off my glorious Mejarian body in full--and I get my dress back at some point--then I can manage. We all have to make do...
Well, I do live a life of crime, so occasionally the criminal becomes the victim. Just don't steal it...or steal your place back online.
Hey, who's to say I don't have another trinket? Or is your sharp medic's eye finally over the double vision?
I guess you finally got your police training up and running, because you're right...it's just my dress left.
Don't be so presumptuous, Miss Police. I might have another accessory...well, OK, I don't.
Don't be so sure, honey! I know you've got police detective skills, but...oh, damn it, I think I am out...
I know, Rarity! What a poor picture this paints of Mejare...but at least losing here isn't so bad.
Oh, and I'd be throwing such a fit if I were losing any other game! Still, as Rarity points out, I'm forced to show my body...
Oh, it's not so bad, Miss Rarity. Barnette will tell you how huffy I get when things don't go my way--but losing is fine here.
Clearly I was in over my head, Pearly-White. But losing this game doesn't seem to have the worst consequences...
It's OK, Sei, darling...you don't come from the planet of beautiful women like I do. Just stand back and let me wow you...
That's the spirit, Sei. Don't try to compete...just let overwhelming Mejarian beauty wash over you.
At least Miss Policegirl understands her place. It's not a bad thing...try to see yourself as the audience to my gorgeous, exotic figure.
Finally. Sei here understands she doesn't need to compete...Mejare is home to the galaxy's finest women.
Oh, Sei, it's OK you're not as beautiful--you're not Mejarian! It's hard being the gold standard, so just enjoy being the audience.
My, my, yes, I do, Miss Rarity. Thanks for noticing--is it my dress or some of my smaller decorations?
Oh, really? What strikes you in particular--my fabulous black dress? My studded boots? My jewelry?
Heehee! Well, it's nice to hear that from Miss Fashionista herself. What on my outfit has caught your eye?
You're looking rather spiffy yourself, darling, even if you take fair skin a little far. What's the fanciest thing about my outfit, hm?
I've won many a dogfight in the harsh magnetic storms and asteroid fields of space, so yes, this should be a cinch.
I certainly hope I can handle a silly card game, Miss Rarity. After all, I wouldn't call it as hard as navigating an asteroid field.
Hey, Pearly-White, you think I lollygag in front of mirrors all day? I'm a fighter pilot--this little card game is easy.
You're right, Miss Fashionette--I should stick to darting around supernovas and leave card-playing to the smart girls.
Come on, darling, you don't want me to spoil the surprise, do you? Surely a fashionista can figure it out.
Haven't you taken my outfit apart with your eyes yet, Miss Fashion Designer? Come on, guess.
Good question, Miss Rarity...hm, I think I've got it. But why don't you put your fashion skills to the test and guess?
Oh, I don't know, Miss Fashionette, maybe you should tell me! Could my whole dress be coming off already?
Come on, Pale-white, don't make me say it. I think there's a big glittering accessory you're overlooking.
Oh, I'm not done teasing quite yet, Fashion Girl. Do you see anything left? You should.
Well, Rarity, I'd say I'm hiding one last accessory from you...but it's not really hidden, is it?
Now, now, Miss Fashion, there's something you get taught when you become a fighter pilot--hiding in plain sight.
Oh, I agree. But I live a life of crime, don't I? As long as I get it back afterwards, I'll manage...
Well, normally I'd be complaining, but losing here just means I get to show off! Besides, I get my dress back after, right?
If it means I can show off my glorious Mejarian body in full--and I get my dress back at some point--then I can manage.
Well, I do live a life of crime, so occasionally the criminal becomes the victim. Just don't steal it, OK?
Ouch. Two pair lost? This is going to be a tough one...
I lost with two pair? You're a tough crowd...luckily, I look just as good naked.
Oh, come on--that lost? Ugh...
You Earth people really are tough, beating me with two pair...better get creative.
Jeez, two pair lost? I better be a little more seductive...
Wow. If two pair is losing, you might be the types I need my sword for.
You must be pretty proud of yourself, beating me with a hand like this...too bad it won't afford you much.
Wow, and I even had two pair. I wonder what set of two I could take to match it?
I really thought that hand was going to take me somewhere, too...I'll have to even things out by not taking this anywhere.
Ouch. Meia always tells me not to be overconfident...there's the proof.
Ugh, really? If two pair isn't going to win a round, I don't even know what to believe anymore.
Oh, come on! I had two pair...this is ridiculous.
Two pair! I had two pair, and I lost...well, you've earned this, that's for sure.
Even two pair couldn't save my dress...it would seem fate has smiled upon all of you.
There's only one thing I was prouder of than that hand--good thing it happens to be my body.
Even with two pair, I lost...guess I've got to show you my one pair now.
You went past two pair to remove my silly little thong? Talk about overkill.
Jeez...I had two pair. My teasing really made you mad, didn't it?
You're beating two pair now? I'm on a table full of Gascognes.
Well, jeez. Right away? At least I'm most the clothed here.
Right out of the hangar, as Meia might say. At least I've got the most on to start with.
Oh, you think you're cute, beating me the first round? I'm more clothed than I look, dearie.
Damn, right away. And how am I actually wearing the most?
I've built myself up a sizable lead already. This is just too easy.
Come on, people. I don't even mind stripping!
Jeez, took you long enough. I think Hibiki is more at your skill levels.
Would you look at that? An early lead. And it'll just keep getting bigger!
Again? You Earth girls must be annoyed at all the little trinkets you see on me.
Tagged me again, but let's remember who's winning.
Do I smell a comeback? Can't be...that would mean I'd lose.
That's the spirit, ladies. Claw your way back, so I can claw at myself later.
Guess counting my rapier didn't miff you, because you haven't been putting up much of a fight.
Quite the streak I had there. Maybe I'm better when that sword isn't weighing me down.
Lucky streak and I'm still winning? Tonight's my night...or wait, every night is my night.
Here I am, still so clothed, and so skilled. Surrounded by Earthlings struggling to tread water...or keep their clothes on.
Right after my boots? Well, since I'm winning...
Guess the cold ground jolted me into a stupor.
Damn. Really blowing this lead of mine in a hurry.
Proud of yourself? Maybe you should re-check the clothes tally.
Congratulations. You managed to break my long streak...when I was all flustered from losing my cute boots.
I had a streak and I'm still winning. Losing my boots has made me lighter than ever!
...Oh, did I lose? I kinda forgot I was in this game, just casually beating you all.
Still a comfortable lead...and I'm still comfortable in this dress, don't you worry.
You really are catching up to me. Good thing I have more accessories!
Still winning! And my dress is still safe.
You're really making me sweat here. But I've still got more Mejarian fashion to show you!
The heat of this thrilling game is just melting my lead away...what a shame.
Nice job, everyone. You might get me out of my dress yet!
So did you all conspire to finally beat me there?
I hope you're proud of yourselves, conspiring to finally put another dent in me. Earthlings are nothing without their skullduggery.
I hope there's no foul play going on to break my streak. As a pirate, I'm an expert on the subject.
My lead has dissolved in a hurry...and now, so will my outfit.
It's all just coming undone...my outfit, that is.
You know when the enemy's in your sights, and then they just vanish? Probably not, but...yeah.
So much for my lead. Did I get too complacent with all those accessories?
I'm still winning after that, too. I've really made you earn this!
The time has come at last. Just remember--I'm still winning!
Well, I've still got a lead. But after this next strip, I really couldn't care less about it.
Still winning, and that was quite a streak. Luckily, this next strip will make you feel better about your situation!
Well, I was winning, but you've pushed me to the brink along with you in a hurry.
Guess we're all in the same boat now. Got sloppy those last two rounds.
I guess I shouldn't have expected this little old thong to protect me for long.
You've got a good eye and swift instinct. My breasts didn't distract you at all!
I really got a lot of mileage out of this little thong, didn't I? I'm so talented.
Well, I held you off for a good while, but it's time to bare it all.
Well, that streak gave me a lead, but there wasn't much wiggle room for me to hold it.
Good effort breaking that streak. And I'm losing interest, so you'll probably beat me after this...the horror.
Well, I'm still winning, from the looks of it. So whatever!
I'm used to being in the lead, so don't expect me to choke.
Do I have a lead? Well, Meia does make me play this all the time. "Sharpening your tactical skills," she says.
Wait till I tell Meia I was winning for a while. Even that she won't believe.
Oh, have I secured a lead? Maybe it doesn't look like it, but I can stretch this very Mejarian-style outfit for a while.
Oh, my. Did I lose again? Well, I still have a lead.
Well, well, well. I'm still winning, but you've finally gotten some actual clothes off of me.
Am I joining the fray? Is it time to actually take something off?
Well, since you're finally clawing your way out of the hole I dug you, sure, I'll take something off.
Again? Well, it's only fair. I've been leaving you all in the dust.
Do I have to strip? I came in here showing more than anybody!
Still winning, darlings! Better work a little harder or I'll never be naked.
Hate to break it to you, but my dress isn't coming off yet.
If you had the sharp eyes of a pilot like me, you'd realize I've got a few trinkets left to save my dress.
Still winning, dearie!
Still ahead, which is all I could ask for when I'm up against such intellectual titans.
It's OK. Cute girlfriend, loyal crewmates, beautiful ship--I'm used to winning.
Forced to remove another accessory, when I still have a lead? The horror!
The last of my small things...I didn't think I'd need them all to hold a lead. ...Damn it, I just said that out loud.
I'm winning, but you're about to be the real winners.
Considering the established dress code, sure, I'll take off the dress.
Do you feel accomplished? Because you're still losing.
Remember who's winning the game! That's my Meia impression. Any good?
Time to join the club. And it's looking like a fun membership.
Well, there goes the whole thing. But I sure kept up the act for a while.
Took you jokers long enough. Didn't you want to see me nude?
Well, I had a lead, but it looks like we're just about even.
You Earth people really are tough, beating me with two pair...better get creative.
Jeez, two pair lost? I better be a little more seductive...
Wow. If two pair is losing, you might be the types I need my sword for.
Ugh. What a bad start.
Inexcusable. Where's your focus? That's how Meia talks.
Like boosting yourself straight into a minefield.
Aw, really? I wanted to have a little fun before starting the whole stripping thing.
After that run, I'm not even winning? You Earth girls are so overdressed.
Welllll, I had a good run. Now the fun begins!
Made you earn it, didn't I? Well, this first one isn't gonna wow you.
Long streak right out of the hangar. You Earthlings really know how to make a woman sweat.
Again? You Earthlings are tough cookies.
Earthlings are tough cookies, apparently...guess the Harvest taught us that already.
Yeah, yeah, I guess the rapier shouldn't have counted. Maybe I deserve this.
Ugh, really? This is going downhill faster than Mejare's living conditions.
Looks like I didn't need that sword anyway. You can barely keep up with my cards.
Good of you all to remember I'm here. I was feeling left out of the nudie-party.
I really didn't think I was that great at cards. But here you all are, struggling to beat me.
All that time, but I still haven't thought of what to strip next...
I just keep on losing. Can't you take it easy on me?
Please stop beating me. I'm too beautiful to lose!
Was it something I said, dealer? Don't think I need your help to win.
I'd offer a peek at my breasts if you forfeit, but...you're on the road there this way, too.
Losing those boots really turned this around for me. I'm feeling great!
I'm hanging tough, thanks to that lucky streak. I think I've got some more in me still.
