Well, I groom myself everywhere else, Megumin. Why wouldn't I shave clean? And that string I call underwear--imagine the hair that would spill out the sides.
That's a comforting thought, but I still see them hanging out with other girls on the ship. Maybe I'm just too tall for men's liking.
I'd like to just chalk it up to that, but I see them with other crew members. Hibiki has Dita and Misty chasing after him, Parfet keeps flirting with Duero...even Bart has a thing for the commander.
Maybe I could believe that if they were still shrieking about us eating their livers, but they all pass me by in favor of competition. You should hear the excuses Parfet makes to visit the infirmary.
Ah, but you see, they've been with us for a while now, and they have their favorites. Perhaps they hate girls who are too self-assured--Meia doesn't seem to get much attention, either.
I see. So men are more romantic than I gave them credit for. When I first mentioned the idea to Barnette, she wanted to be the Oma--we should get married soon ourselves.
Are men really so protective of their seed, even when the baby won't be their responsibility? I guess I should tie the knot with Barnette myself already.

One won't simply donate those sperm cells of his to me? You'd think he's the one getting pregnant with that kind of loyalty. Speaking of which, I should put Barnette at ease and just marry her already.
Hey, now, he'd be the one intruding on a relationship-- Barnette's not thrilled about the idea. I should really pop the question so she doesn't worry I'll run off.
It's just donating some seed, not a marriage. I'd donate an egg to a friend, and my hand in marriage belongs to Barnette! She'll be an Oma for the second girl.
I shouldn't really have to explain that, should I? Well, you're still in school--I guess you haven't had those experiences, male or female. Your feelings are the paint, and her body the canvas.
Ah. I guess I should have figured the girl who can't speak her mind is a virgin. All those feelings you have for her--imagine being able to express them for real, physically. That's all it is.
Ah--zero experience. Well, you know what romantic tension feels like, don't you? The anxiety, the cautious glances--you just let it all spill over in a wave of catharsis.
...You haven't slept with a man, either, have you? Well, think about all the uncertainty you feel. "Does she really love me?" Once it moves to your bodies, you finally know.
Oh, Duero doesn't pay me much mind, unfortunately. He's smitten with our chief engineer Parfet, even if he's too stoic to admit it.
Duero's not quite talkative enough for my tastes. All he does is give me painkillers and send me on my way with a stoic frown--he's more into geeks than daring pilots.
Well, he dutifully treats my wounds and such, but he's just not the social type. Besides, I think he has more of a thing our chief engineer--the two can geek out with each other.
Duero's what you might call the strong, silent type. Tall, handsome, intelligent--but good luck prying him away from his work if you can't speak geek.
I don't know that many, you know. I think it just comes down to exoticism. A reversal of everything feminine, yet still somehow human--so I guess the "handsome" types?
You ask such good questions for a girl who can't speak! Men almost seem like inverted women, you know? So stiff and angular--it's exotic. But I like some refinement.
I'm not quite sure--all men just seem new and intriguing. Maybe with time I'll fall into the same patterns you Earth girls do, but right now I enjoy some handsome charm.
Well, I've only seen our three prisoners up close for long, and they're each pretty different. I know some men get pretty dirty or ugly--I like handsomeness, cleanliness.
Why, thank you. Barnette impresses all by herself--she's just a lot smaller and angrier. In any case, we're quite happy together.
Yes, she's very happy with me, and I with her. She's not quite as statuesque as I am, but she's got a thinner waist--she's a tight little bundle of fury.
This might be the first time I've left a girl speechless in the written form. Barnette has a nice figure herself, but she's shorter and cuter--not to mention tougher.
If only she were here to compare with me! She's like my little gunslinging bodyguard--smaller bust, thinner waist, shorter hair, tougher beauty.
That sounds awfully messy. The throes of passion don't seem like the ideal time for family planning, either. Are you just making fun of me?
So, the "natural" couple combines the clinical with the passionate? I suppose you set the family budget while you're making love, as well. Men...
Is that how you're supposed to get their seed? I figured you worked the tube with your hands or something. You must pick your men carefully before heading to bed!
Is that why they're called "sex cells"? So men and women can have children without the aid of a machine. Sex doesn't always coincide with good decisions, you know.
Would you like me to put on one of our raid suits, then? I can survive in the vacuum of space with that on, but it makes me look like a chubby demon.
A simple little combat dress doesn't need tech. Don't get me wrong, we have some-- but bulky spacesuits and masks aren't what you'd call elegant.
Now you're coming to understand my world's fashion sense. Practical without sacrificing elegance! And my legs are so comfortable.
It's really the ultimate combination, don't you think? Snug, supportive, and comfortable--yet refined, elegant, and deadly.
Is that still a style on this planet? With all your extreme seasons, I was worried you'd all have fur where your womanhood is supposed to be.
Oh, did shaving get its start on Earth, even with those nasty winters I hear about? As far as I'm concerned, hair just gets in the way sometimes.
Oh, I'm not offended. You know, it sounds like there's a girl back home you have on your mind, and you're looking for some validation.
Perhaps you use childish teasing to project your own feelings. Is there a computer game-loving girl on Planeptune I should know about?
..."Les slang"? I was talking about my home planet. I traveled a long way here to visit where my ancestors came from.
The combination of stunning beauty and mortal terror is absolutely divine, don't you thi--hm? I wasn't using slang. What are you talking about?
It's not cloning, it's a combination! You see, the Oma donates an egg for half the DNA, and the Fama is impregnated, providing the other half. Marvelous, isn't it?
I think I heard that cloning was all they could manage in the early days, but now, we combine the genes of two eggs. We don't all look the same!
No, no, no, you're thinking too hard about all this! It's DNA from both mothers--we're not grown in some dingy test tube, like the men are.

condition.saying: The Chazz is one of the greatest men around

case.state: I see. I hope you'll show me how much fun the men of this planet can be, because I haven't had good first impressions of Earth.
Is that so? Earth has proven to be quite nasty to the Mejarian people in the past, but maybe you'll help me overlook that.

condition.saying: I have pictures I can show you

case.state: No, that's alright. Barnette tells me she won some marksmanship trophies as a girl, but I'm swept off my feet when I see her in action.
Don't worry about it--I prefer seeing action. My Barnette is much more breathtaking with a gun on a mission than at the target range.

condition.saying: you had better learn Duel Monsters

case.state: I haven't seen anyone else with one of those things, so I think you're lying to me. I don't intend to stay on this planet, anyway.
You know, it's really very rude to try to take advantage of the foreign girl by lying to her. Why are you the only one I've seen with a Duel Disk if it's so popular?
See, that's more like it! I love getting compliments. That said, my current job as a Dread pilot is probably more exciting.
I seem to excel at everything I try, all the way up to piloting an advanced Dread fighter. I'm sure I could be a good duelist, as well--thanks for saying so.

condition.saying: Why keep those tits on your home planet

case.state: I'm not a stripper, you know, even if I'm currently stripping. Any trashy girl can spread her legs onstage--I should be modeling as the perfect female form.
I'd like to do a little better for myself than just a showgirl for lecherous Earth men. You know, like modeling--something more elegant and befitting my beauty.

condition.saying: I could be your tag duel partner if you wanted

case.state: I'll pass. I already have a partner to engage in any nudism with if the mood strikes us.
I already have a Dread partner. Nudism is optional, but we do take that option quite a bit.
It's good to know my attitude stands out even among men. I wouldn't have thought you had any sense of modesty a year ago.
So my cavalier attitude strikes you as much as it does women, does it? I always pictured men as hairy naked beasts, and here you are, worried about covering up.
It's funny how most Mejarians shriek and cover themselves when they barely wear any clothes to begin with. I never thought men might do the same.
Oh, we don't deal in money too much. Our captain seems like she's against it...but the Mejarian ships we capture are often quite well-furnished.
Maybe it's the old priestess in her, but our captain seems to shy away from money. A lot of those fancy things were already on ships we captured.
Hey, even Imperials are just girls who want to be pampered. We got our jacuzzi from a Mejarian Border Guard ship--better that than paying for it, our captain says.
Are you going to be flattering me all game? Maybe all I needed to get this treatment from men was zip myself up back into one of those things.
Well, I did wear them early on as a recruit, and the stares I got...kind of like yours. Maybe that's why I haven't gotten men's attention--my dress is too conservative.
Oh, does the mental image of me in a flightsuit suddenly inspire flattery? Maybe I'll dig my rookie one out of storage and finally catch our prisoners' eyes.
On my homeworld, men are very much that. Have I not introduced myself loud enough for you to hear?
My home planet would tell you they're an exotic species of subhumans, and filled with bacteria. You're not taking me seriously, are you?
Mhmhmhm. That's what I hear from new recruits.
I know. Perhaps you're normally less scatterbrained.
Well, I wouldn't want to lure in someone without the patience to wait for a good thing, now would I?
Bait and switches. As if there isn't plenty enough of me on display already. Anyone worth my time knows to be patient for what awaits.
"Blueball"? That must be an Earth saying, since it is one. Then again, so is Mejare.
Now what does "blueball" mean? You happen to live on a little blue ball, you know.
Well, thank you very much. I was starting to think I wouldn't garner any praise from you unless I grew another six legs.
So you've come around on me. I know I'm not about to lay any eggs, but this is a game about gorgeous grace, not creepy crawling things.

condition.saying: a few tricks of my own

case.state: You might want to start playing them, then. Unless you don't mind me hogging the spotlight.
And are you just going to sing about them? Take your glasses off--that's a good first trick.
You're no fun, Policewoman. I wasn't really going to stab anyone!
Oh, give me a break, High-Kicks. Is it just a policewoman's nature to be anti-fun?
Oh, sure, I was really going to stab people. You stuffy authority types always expect the worst from people.
If you're wondering why I'm a pirate, it's because boring authority figures like Chun here want all the weapons for themselves.
Oh, but the police girl wouldn't check her weapons, I bet. No, confiscation is for the criminal scum.
Oh, I wish I was as good with my rapier as I am in a cockpit. But really, this just sounds like jealousy. Who says I can't pilot?
Ooh, insulting my piloting skills, are you? By all means, present your evidence. Oh wait, you're just trying to put me down because I'm beautiful.
You can't fault my appearance, so you move on to questioning my piloting skills. You're so predictable, Daria...you're not the first jealous girl I've met.
Other way around, dear--I'm a better pilot than a swordswoman. But really, I could claim to be anything, and you'd try to denigrate me out of envy.
Why, yes, it is...one of many pirate weapons. I'm glad you can appreciate the intricacies of my outfit.
Well, I mostly carry it for fashion...I'm more likely to use a Mejarian laser ring when things get dicey.
Technically my Dread is my pirate weapon. And what an elegant ship it is!
My Vandread is the ultimate pirate weapon, actually. It can shield a whole planet, it's so powerful!
...O-oh. Well, I might want to recommend something bigger...or a gun.
Don't you have...oh, I don't know, laser rings? Even those clunky men's guns are better than a sword.
Eep. If I were in a labyrinth, I'd want my laser ring...or my Dread. Or even those men's guns Barnette collects.
...Are you serious? What are you doing in a labyrinth? Especially with a sword--use a gun, woman!
Ohhh, come on, why don't you like me? Do men not like tall women? How can I get handsome men to give me some seed?
...You're breaking my heart, Jotaro. Women love me--do men not like big, tall girls? I can't help it!
Ohhh, don't just leave me like that! At least say why you don't like me! Is it because I'm too tall? Men like short girls?
...Am I too tall? Women love how big I am--do men feel the opposite? Come on, Mister Muscles, give me something to work with here!
Oh, you're so frustrating! Maybe you think I'm some slut, but I haven't managed to get a single man to fall for me. ...Do men hate tall girls?
It's called fashion, honey, not slutty. There's no need to insult my home planet's traditional dress.
You're one to talk, Miss Rags-and-Tatters. I'll have you know Mejarian dress is revealing because we're all beautiful.
It's called a tease, Juri. Mejarians simply dress like this to show off our gorgeous bodies without being indecent.
Who're you calling slutty? You insult my cultural tradition of revealing dresses--it's a celebration of womanhood!
From your Hyrule planet, right? It's good to know Mejare has sisters in this big universe of ours.
It would seem even Planet Hyrule has seen the beauty of the Mejarian lifestyle, then.
What planet are you from again, dear? Hyrule? Good to see you've realized men are extraneous.
Do tell, Navi, darling. You're from planet Hyrule, right? Mejare's influence seems to be expanding.
Oh? And who are the fabulous Earth women to pass your professional inspection, hm? Would I pass new Rarity's inspection?
Well, being from a planet of gorgeous women, I certainly ought to pass. Plus, you're old.
I'm so happy you like my exotic Mejarian dress, honey! I need to see what your EG self thinks.
But I surely passed with flying colors, yes? And somehow I'm stuck here, offline, with you.
Heeheehee! Sounds like you're disarming me with flattery.
Now you're thinking, dearie! I'm too beautiful to kill--say, aren't you just buttering me up?
I bet you think you're being clever by paying me compliments. Well, I love flattery...and plenty of girls do it in earnest.
Have I officially made a fan out of you, Sei, darling? You're a cutie yourself...and you get cuter when you praise me.
Pervert? Hey, we both signed up to play strip poker, didn't we? What a rude little girl.
Hmph. You're as nasty as your assassin title implies--what makes me a pervert and you wholesome, huh?
Is someone putting a gun to your little assassin head to be here, honey? You're every bit the pervert I am.
P-pervert? Hey, look who's talking, you little shrimp! Is someone forcing you to be here?
You have all-girl schools? I guess the drive to separate the sexes runs deep even back on Earth.
...I suppose? I didn't even know those existed on Earth. I though you and men were all over each other all the time.
An all-girls school? I went to one, obviously, but I didn't know they existed on Earth, too! I thought men were everywhere!
Your school is nothing but girls? And here I thought Earth constantly swarmed you with men. Good for you!
And you're too complimentary, especially for a goddess. I thought I'd have to work to win your heart!
I would figure a goddess such as yourself would be above praising mere mortal women, but fair enough.
Do I have a new fan? Knowing I can woo even goddesses is certainly an ego stroke!
Oh, thank you, dear. You're much more forward than I expected from a goddess--and easier to please, too.
What's MTV, some kind of television channel? ...I didn't think you'd be in the media business, but that would be nice.
Ooh, you have some clout in Earth television? You've got to show me! I can be shown across the galaxy!
With all the Harvest ships I've taken down, I think Earthlings should know my face already. But I'd be happy with a TV appearance!
...MTV? Oh, a television channel! I'm sorry I made fun of you! Please get me a spot on TV if you can!
...You're not serious? MTV is an Earth TV channel, right? Ooh, Barnette has plenty of footage of me to send in!
You alright there, honey? You just sort of clammed up and turned away.
So sheepish! Hey, I answered your question, honey! And I asked another.
Is something wrong? You look a little pale now. And you keep going off in your own little world.
You poor thing. A fun-sized little girl, and you can barely string two sentences together before getting all embarrassed.
Do you think I could maybe have some, honey? Please don't make me do anything drastic...like take you offline. Oh, wait.
Oh, dear. I'd ask for some, but you should know I've grown accustomed to not paying for anything. Like server space.
Perhaps I could model them for you, dear? Maybe...take them for myself? Don't make me pirate them...Miss Offline.
Ooh, I like the sound of trying on some new outfits. I just hope you're OK with me...taking them. Like your spot was taken.
Is that a twinge of jealousy I hear, darling? I guess I'd be jealous of an exotic alien woman twice my height...and bust.
Sei, Sei, Sei. You act so coy and cool, but you're a little jealous of the big, busty alien girl, aren't you?
Yes, indeed. A simple little Earth girl...very cute, but she can't hope to compete with the Mejarian's curvaceous frame.
What was that, honey? Is the big, bad Mejarian pirate making you jealous? My magnificent breasts, my flowing blonde hair, my height?
Hey, I live in the shadows! ...That is, if low-orbit piracy counts as hiding away. But you can do it!
Hey, honey, I'm a pirate, and I make it work. Our base is in an asteroid belt--how's that for shadows?
Hey, the Magno Family pirate gang hangs out in an asteroid field--the shadows of space. It's doable.
What, you think pirates spend their time out in the open? I got this fashion in the "shadows" of low orbit!
What? Of course it is! Mejare might be corrupt, but even there we understand that people want to be loved!
What have they been feeding you where you'd even ask that question? Is Earth really such a pent-up asexual place?
What? And I thought Mejare indoctrinated women. Apparently on Earth you might not be allowed to have sexual fantasies.
If having sexual fantasies isn't allowed, honey, life isn't worth living. They don't teach you that's bad on Earth, do they?
Hahahaha! Don't tell anyone, but I'm thinking of popping the question soon!
You never had a chance, honey. Barnette is so wonderful I think I'm going to ask her to marry me!
Goddess or not, dear, my heart is set on her. She's the rock to my roiling sea! The Oma to my children!
Don't feel too bad about it, Zizou. You never stood a chance--I want Barnette to be my wife one day!
Our recent encounters with the Harvest have left me thinking about the future, so I'll probably pop the question soon.
That's right, I am me. Trust me, it's wonderful being this buxom...it'd be so rude of me to steal ~player~ from you.
And it is wonderful being me, Natsuki, darling. Hey, ~player~, should we break Miss Schoolgirl's heart?
Oh, look how she's clamming up again! She's so desperate for you, ~player~...but it's hard to look away from me, isn't it?
I can only imagine how humiliating this must be, Natsuki...being compared to a flawless figure like mine. ~player~ doesn't even notice you, I bet...
I'm not dragging this out as much as you think, actually. No need to jump to conclusions...or insult people you just met.
Do you see any reason why that ego might be unfounded? Because I've never entered a room without turning heads.
Call me vain if you want, but it seems awfully justified to me. Intelligent, talented, highly-ranked, and beautiful!
Your words hurt me, you nasty little thing, you. Now I need to go back to my lovely ship and cry into my equally beautiful girlfriend's chest until it's all better.
Hey, I heard that. By all means, point out a flaw in my body--my girlfriend would beg to differ with every one of them.
Something wrong, honey? Are my strips not stimulating enough for you? Well, maybe you should win next time!
..."Spring"? Oh, right, I heard the seasons can get pretty drastic on this planet...can you let EG Rarity know?
Oh, you'd do that for me, Miss Rarity? Am I going to get any credit for bringing the design to this planet? Do you have business ties to EG Rarity?
Omigosh, I'd love to produce some kind of fashion line! Can you call it the Elden? Or the "Offline."
Oooooh, I'd want nothing more than to be the namesake of some famous Earth dress! Even on an outdated label.
Ohh, you're still cute, dear! A little on the short side, but dresses aren't for everyone. That armor looks pretty nice!
Don't be so hard on yourself, Sei, honey. Work with the body you have--I'm built for dresses, and you for adorable armor.
Hey now, you're as cute as a button, dearie! You make armor look adorable--who cares if you can't wear a dress?
Are there really no dresses in pint-size? You make clunky armor look kind of cute, so there's definitely hope for a pretty face like you.
You can, dear! You're a cute little cinnamon roll of a girl! You can't put yourself down all the time!
Well, you never will be with that attitude. Women love confidence, and you need to show it even if it's fake!
Not doing a good job with the confidence right now, I see. Stop beating yourself up and let the allure shine out of you!
You might not be quite as beautiful, but putting on a smile and striking a pose does wonders for any woman's looks! Be proud!
Yeah, that's the spirit! Lay down a little spice with the sugar. I'm just a lowly mortal to you, right?
Finally we see your praise crack a little. Going to smite me for being so bitchy?
I'm not apologizing for how I act. I'm beautiful, and no mere goddess can take that away from me!
"Bitchy," am I? I think our teeny-weeny friend here is just jealous a human woman is better-looking than she is.
Would you prefer I be all no-nonsense like you? Must be a shorty thing.
Well, excuse me for having a little fun. Is this jealousy over how you only come up to my shoulder?
Honestly! You wouldn't think a blonde girl would be such a killjoy--I guess you've got something to prove, being so short.
You know what I think? You're trying to ruin my fun because you can't pull off my dress, Short Stuff.
..."Football"? Sounds like some kind of male activity unsuited for a woman...I think Tarakkians like to run into each other and grunt a lot.
...What's football? I know men like doing weird physical sport stuff, but...why would I try to butt in there?
...Football sounds like some weird male fighting festival. A delicate girl like me would get caught in the crossfire.
"Football"? I think our prisoners mentioned some male grunting thing like that on Tarak...a woman would get knocked around.
Well, not to spoil anything, Shortstack, but you might be in for a treat if I lose again.
Don't make any more threats. I was out of small things anyway, you know! See?
Oh, I don't have any more silly accessories, honey! I was just playing around...I think.
...OK, Same-name. That was the last of it...I was just trying to tease you, is all.
Never, Natsuki? I suppose that fits my impression of Earth girls--so woefully overdressed!
Earth women seem very afraid of their bodies and sexuality in general, so I figured as much.
Mejarians like displaying their beautiful bodies, Natsuki! Look at my adorable belly--I don't know why Earth is so conservative.
It seems this is your first taste of Mejarian fashion, then. We're not exactly shy--I guess Earth is cold or something.
Oh, thank you, dear, but a pirate only has so much to pick from anyway. It's like the offline selection...
Oh, I feel so exposed, down to just the bare dress like this. A bare-bones version of myself...hmhmhm.
Much as I'd like to boast about my tastes, darling, I only get to choose from whatever we manage to steal. Life is so fleeting, you know...
Mm...that thing really digs into me. But thanks for the compliments--I hope new-Rarity likes me, too.
Oh? Happy to help, but which Earth girl has the pleasure of getting a Sei striptease?
If you'd like to practice your stripteases, dearie, I'd love to watch your adorable little frame swing around. Do you have a girlfriend?
Hahaha! I should've known you'd be the type to do stripteases, Miss Boozeball! Who's the lucky lady that gets to see them?
I'm glad I, a simple alien pirate, could teach Earth girls how to be sexier. Still, I'm curious...is there a girlfriend watching these stripteases?
Eww, don't even say that! This is the best dress I have--really, the only good one.
Hey, I may be beautiful, but I don't have any money. If I tore apart my dress, I'd have to steal another one!
It's important for pilots to know when to retreat, Sheena--besides, I'd never tear up my only good dress.
Ugh! Don't even put the thought of my dress getting damaged in my mind. It's the best thing I own!
You don't lose anything by being seen naked, Miss Sheena. I wouldn't dream of destroying my one good dress.
Oh, there you go reminding me of my lovely Barnette! She's such a blessing...really, dear, all you lack is confidence.
There you go beating yourself up again! Listen, Miss Magic, play up your cuteness and just approach a girl!
You're so damn sheepish. All you need to do is crank up the adorable factor and ask out a girl you like!
I don't know what to tell you, dear. I think you've got all the cuteness you need--that's how Barnette won me over!
I assure you, dear, my humble breasts are like any other woman's! Just, you know, superior. To yours in particular.
Well, my flat-chested friend, you might see them sooner than you...wait, do I have anything left?
Well, clearly they're not the sort of thing you could see in a mirror.
I figured you'd be the type who gets excited about any sort of breasts at all, actually. Since...well, you know.
It's my understanding that men, with their flat chests, love breasts. I'm starting to see why you're so curious.
Why wear an uncomfortable old bra when my dress can do all the work--and look better doing it?
Bras aren't that popular on Mejare, given our love of suits and leotards. Still, I'd just rather my dress do the heavy lifting.
You're so mean, Short Stuff! And people call me condescending--you can't even tolerate the way my dress holds my breasts up.
I'm never going to please you, am I, Four-eyes? My dress holds my breasts up...and gives them some space to breathe.
Hey, I'm swinging around a lot of size on my chest. Bras are too restrictive--my dress does the work and lets them bounce.
And you doubted me! The nerve of it all...I am Mejare's finest woman, Jolyne!
I might be a nasty pirate, but that doesn't mean I can't be beautiful. I can't believe you doubted me, Jolyne.
Hmph! Little Miss Prisoner sounds like she doubted the beauty of my nude body. Me, the crown jewel of Mejare!
Tch. Jolyne is acting all surprised, as if she couldn't tell how shapely my body was with the dress on.
...Really, Jotaro? You don't like the look of me even a little bit? Women always drool over me...
Awww...I really thought Mister Muscles would crack a little with my breasts. Women always do...
...You're ruining my fun, Mister Buff-chains. I've never met a woman who didn't think I was beautiful.
Oh, I don't get men at all! Not even my breasts make you excited, Jotaro? My girlfriend loves them--all women love them!
I swear, no one ever believes that I'm actually going to deliver. Does no one on Earth think breasts really get this big?
See, Juri? I would never disappoint a girl who's practically named after me--I guess you couldn't believe breasts could be so big.
Oh, Juri, why'd you make me bare my healthy, full breasts? Were you just skeptical a woman could get so big?
Are breasts my size just not a thing on Earth, Juri? Why so doubtful that I'd satisfy you?
Ah, there we are. Everything you hoped for, right? I think so.
You don't have to apologize, sweetheart. I'm glad to show off Mejarian beauty to naive little Earth boys!
I don't think I'll accept your apology. Maybe I'll just cover them up, since you thought I'd never show them!
You're such a young little thing, Pit. Have you ever seen a woman's breasts before? How early do they start pairing you up with girls where you're from?
Come now, I wouldn't lie to someone I just met! I'd just mislead them a little, that's all.
It's OK. Meia doubts me all the time, too, but I've never let her down! Well, maybe once or twice.
I don't think I'll accept your apology. Maybe I'll just turn this way, since you thought I'd never show them!
La-la! How's my rear? ...Oh, I don't know, honey, gems already weigh down my boots! Does EG Rarity love gems?
Diamonds and emeralds? Hmm, I don't know...Meia already yells at me for the dress being impractical. Should I take advice from offliners?
Where am I supposed to get gems, huh? Well...maybe if new-Rarity says the same thing.
Not a bad idea in theory, but I don't like the sound of all that extra weight swinging around as I scramble...what does EG Rarity think?
Why wear a bra when I could adorn a fabulous dress for my chest support? Your bindings aren't my style, Rinkah, dear.
Does that upset you, Rinkah, darling? I know you're the type to just bind them and call that a bra.
Would you have me simply bind them up like you do, Rinkah? I prefer style and grace--like my gorgeous dress.
Did my absolute cleavage give it away, Rinkah? Bras just aren't my thing--I could never bind them up like you do.
Bras aren't my style, Rinkah, nor are your bindings. My big, healthy breasts should always be just beneath the surface.
And is Stella the girl you striptease for? I wouldn't call myself a small space, either...
Small space? I'm a big girl, Sei...but I guess that's true for most women next to you.
Stella must be a cute little shortstack like you, dearie. I, meanwhile, am a tall Mejarian goddess...not a small space.
You really think so? I've always considered myself to have quite a bit of volume...in all the right places, of course.
Such constant flattery. You're not feeling attracted to me, are you? Shame on you, Homewrecker.
Heeheehee! They're a little hefty, but their shapeliness sells them. You're so smitten that I should remind you I'm taken.
Hey, watch it, Homewrecker. I know you have magic, but my girlfriend Barnette has guns.
Oh, stop embarrassing me! I've got a girlfriend, you know! Keep your little fantasies in your head where they can't hurt anyone.
...You're kidding, right? What breasts?
...Wait, you have breasts? But...I don't see any. Did you just magic them away as a joke?
...Are you serious, honey? Come on, you're just playing around. I mean, you don't have breasts.
...Whatever you say, darling. I guess goddesses don't have any children to feed, so breasts are irrelevant.
Coming from you, Beatrix, I'm not sure if that's a compliment. And my Fama carried me perfectly naturally...
What do you mean, artificial? I had parents, you know--my Fama carried me.
Are you just making fun of me again, Miss Syringe? I'm not artificial--my Fama carried me like any other girl!
Hey, I know we splice eggs together, but don't go calling me artificial. I had a sweet, loving Fama who carried me to term!
Blah, blah blah, Jura's an alien and stupid because I'm an ugly jealous short girl. God, give it a rest already.
I get it, Daria. You're a human genius and I, because I'm lovely, must be a stupid alien. It's getting old.
You know, honey, have you considered being pleasant? Instead of calling me a stupid alien to make yourself feel better?
If I'm just a stupid alien, Daria, I invite you to pilot my Dread next dogfight. Oh, wait, you're just moaning as usual.
Yeah, yeah, I'm a dumb blonde bimbo, Daria, I get it. Here's my advice: try improving yourself instead of dragging everyone else down.
However little it may be blocking, Miss Clown, it'd be such a tragedy if my hair deprived you all of the view you've earned.
Figures a girl obsessed with comedy wouldn't appreciate such a dramatic move as this flourish.
Not that in the way? Nonsense, Miss Clown--you couldn't ogle the perfect curvature of my breasts!
Come on, Joey, surely a performing woman such as yourself understands the need for a little showiness!
What? Oh, right, Earth girls dye their hair sometimes, right? On Mejare, we simply engineer our babies with gorgeous hair colors!
As if I would need to dye my hair like you silly Earth girls. My parents wanted me blonde, so I was engineered as such.
Ah, yes, hair dyeing is a thing on Earth. Is blonde really in demand here? On Mejare, it's a bit plain-looking.
Oh, please. Blonde is far too average-looking to dye for. Besides, no one on Mejare dyes her hair--we're born with beautiful colors!
How about I make this extra special, just for you, sweetie? I've never met such a meek little man!
Just to show how much I care, I'll brush my hair back so you can get a full view. You're too shy to demand it yourself.
Oh, but you were, weren't you? It's OK--I love the idea of men finding me attractive. I'm so used to women already...
It's alright...I don't mind the exotic, hungry gaze of a man. Here, let me help you with that...
I just can't resist giving those adorable eyes the full view they deserve. You're so innocent and sweet for a man!
Now, let's get this pesky hair out of the way...men are so cute when they stammer. Keep on doing it.
Why don't I deliver the full experience and move my hair aside? ...Well, I've got the medic's vote.
Shall I move this pesky hair aside? ...It seems I have the White Knights' approval.
My hair was blocking the view, don't you think? ...Well, Sei does, and she's a cutie. Good enough for me.
I wasn't really hiding my groin...shall I spice things up another way? ...Alright, Sei, honey, calm down...
You little tease. I was all ready to invade Earth and free you from the tyranny of the underwear police, but it turns out you're just a homewrecker.
And here I wanted to comfort you over the underwear inspections. Instead you're just trying to ruin my relationship!
Honey, you're fun to flirt with, but I have a relationship to maintain! Barnette is the future Oma of my children.
I can't just sleep with any random stranger, dear. I need to be the Fama for Barnette's daughters!
You don't sound happy, Spooky. If I can make a ghost envious, then I'm more beautiful than I realized...
Jealous, Spooky? I like the sound of living forever, so I guess that makes us even.
It seems envy doesn't fade in death, judging by Miss Spirit's tone. Or is that envy why you're a ghost in the first place?
Well, then--I think we know why our ghostly friend is still chained to the land of the living. She's got a little boob-envy problem.
Speaking of things you'd better do with your mouth, try shutting it when Barnette's around.
You'd better shut your mouth unless you want Barnette to put bullets in both of us.
Zizou, I'm a soon-to-be-married woman! Unless you goddesses just don't see the legitimacy of human relationships.
I think you're better off finding a single goddess your height, Miss Magic. I need to start a family with my dear Barnette.
Oh? And who are the fabulous Earth women to pass your professional inspection, hm?
Well, being from a planet of gorgeous women, I certainly ought to pass. Who on Earth matches my fashion sense?
I'm so happy you like my exotic Mejarian dress, honey! Are there any girls on Earth who've attracted your eye, as well?
But I surely passed with flying colors, yes? I mean, if there's some simple Earth girls who did so...who are they?
Do you think I could maybe have some, honey? Please don't make me do anything drastic...the way a pirate can.
Oh, dear. I'd ask for some, but you should know I've grown accustomed to not paying for anything.
Perhaps I could model them for you, dear? Maybe...take them for myself? Don't make me pirate them.
Ooh, I like the sound of trying on some new outfits. I just hope you're OK with me...taking them.
..."Spring"? Oh, right, I heard the seasons can get pretty drastic on this planet...credit me for the design, OK?
Oh, you'd do that for me, Miss Rarity? Am I going to get any credit for bringing the design to this planet?
Omigosh, I'd love to produce some kind of fashion line! Can you call it the Elden? Oh, please credit me!
Oooooh, I'd want nothing more than to be the namesake of some famous Earth dress! My beauty will be known throughout the galaxy!
Oh, thank you, dear, but a pirate only has so much to pick from anyway. Say, how's my dress look bare-bones like this?
Oh, I feel so exposed, down to just the bare dress like this. And thank you--I try to pick the best jewelry from our hostages.
Much as I'd like to boast about my tastes, darling, I only get to choose from whatever we manage to steal.
Mm...that thing really digs into me. But thanks for the compliments--it's the best piece I saw from our haul.
La-la! How's my rear? ...Oh, I don't know, honey, gems already weigh down my boots!
Diamonds and emeralds? Hmm, I don't know...Meia already yells at me for the dress being impractical.
Where am I supposed to get gems, huh? They sound heavy anyway--I'd have to work out to lug those around!
Not a bad idea in theory, but I don't like the sound of all that extra weight swinging around as I scramble, honey...
Oh, I'm a coward, am I? I'm sure you'll be satisfied with your fists once a laser burns a hole through them.
What are you, a man? "Cammy punch machine, ooga booga."
Hey, a pirate's not about to use her fists with a weapon available. There's no honor in dying--and no beauty, either.
Mm-hm. You keep on kicking sandbags around, and I'll keep on using my Vandread to shield entire planets.
Women are smart, Miss Leotard. We use technology. If you'd like to fistfight in the mud, try the men of Tarak.
Don't mind me. Let's get a move on, and maybe I'll actually remove some clothes!
Beat me again, and I'll actually take off some clothes!
I'm a pirate, you know. Let's just say I got that sword at quite the discount!
I wonder what I should actually take off first...
Believe you me, I know how to use that thing. Ask any Mejarian soldier!
I hope I didn't make anyone mad with that. This is my first day on Earth.
If anyone would like to send me fan mail, there's a letterbox by the door to my quarters.
Now, if I were really rude, I would count the sword and scabbard separately.
Ground's cold. How exciting.
I'm warning you. I love those boots, so I'm not going easy on you anymore.
The ground is cold, which really gets me in the fighting spirit.

Do you know how expensive those boots were?
...That's right, they're stolen!
You know, I stole those boots from a Mejarian soldier at swordpoint. I'm so daring.
Nothing beats one of Barnette's foot massages after a long day in those clunky spacesuits we wear.
Ooh, it's a little chilly on my bare feet. Maybe one of you can hold me up instead.
Heeheeheehee! So sorry!
Have you met Meia? She might look more covered than me, but she doesn't wear all that much. Such a tease!
Dear, dear. Maybe next time you'll finally get me out of this dress.
Keep trying, and maybe my dress is on the horizon. You're closer than you think.
Oh, dear. How long can I keep this up?
