Watch out, ladies, we've got a full-blown magician on our hands. On Mejare you get called a witch for saying men aren't the worst thing ever.
A witch, eh? Forgive my doubts...that jealous old hag of a judge called me a witch just for having that anatomy book!
Awww! She even brought a little magic wand to complete the costume! You're so cute, Miss Witch.
Between you and that time I got called a witch for showing interest in men, witches are just irresistible these days.
So what are these "ninjas" all about, huh? Disappearing into the night doesn't sound useful in a game like this.
Don't tell me you're going to use those ninja skills to hide your body, now.
Certainly an impressive profile, Miss Ninja. Think you could show us just how impressive?
Does "ninja" just mean you wear a headband? Sounds like a lofty title for my Barnette to accidentally fall under.
I know I'm a foreign woman, honey, but can't you be more friendly? What's your real name?
Going by just a code name, are we? You must find the alien woman pretty scary--or you're just miserable.
You're too stoic for your own good, Miss Machine--just like my squadron leader. But even Meia uses her real name.
What kind of woman just gives "HK416" for her name? My Barnette is a sour little muffin, too, and she loves guns like you do.
Hey, dearie, no reason to come out knives-swinging. I've got my rapier sheathed like a civilized woman.
Settle down there, honey. There's something awfully scary about wearing a smile with a knife out.
I know I brought a sword, sweetheart, but that was just for fashion. Don't turn this place into a bloodbath.
Well, hi there, cutie--er, uh, knife-wielding cutie. Yeah. Carry on.
Are you sure you're all there, cutie? Dealer, maybe we should take a five-minute break so Ini can count to ten.
Oh, dear. I know I make jokes about simple-minded Earth girls, but...talk about a walking stereotype.
Oh, my. I was about to tell you about my marvelous home planet of Mejare, dearie, but I'm not sure you know which planet you're currently on.
So much for finding any potential recruits. One day with you on the ship, and we'd careen into an asteroid.
What's up, sourpuss? You look even more miserable than a certain squadron leader I know.
Hey, lighten up, girlie. I didn't come all the way to Earth to find what I could get from Meia's strategy lectures.
Yawn...are you really going to be a miserable bore this whole time? Would having my breasts make you feel better?
Looks like it's Little Miss Sunshine's turn to strip. Good thing Meia's not here, or this table would just freeze over.
Oh my gosh, Jenetta! You're such a cheerful little cinnamon roll! You've even got squinty eyes like my crewmate Ezra!
Is that Ezra I see across the table? I'm just kidding, honey, but you're so cute and squinty, just like her!
Hey, Bunnyhop, can you see through that squint? Don't get me wrong, it's adorable--my crewmate Ezra does the same thing!
Green hair like my Barnette, and an adorable squinty smile like Ezra! You're bringing me right back to my ship, cutie!
So what's with the rabbit-ear hat, honey? I mean, it's cute and all, but this isn't Halloween.
So that cute rabbit-ear hat is going last, right? Just going to wear it naked like the naughty little thing you are?
By the way, that hat looks great, Jenetta! It almost looks like you really have rabbit ears on, with how fuzzy and cute it is.
Hey, Bunnyhop, those rabbit ears on your hat are so cute and lifelike! Could I maybe have one, too?
What's with all the makeup? Someone said you're a...clown, whatever that means?
...So does clown mean "makeup advertiser"? Because you're modeling too many products at once.
...Earth makeup is something else. Apparently there's whole classes of women called clowns who just cake it on!
So if I wore as much makeup as you do, would that make me a "clown"? Where's the lower limit? This is all new to me.
Oh, my! That's a complicated look, Miss Blue-and-Yellow! But you look tough, so I guess you just beat girls up if they make fun.
You've got a fierce look in your eyes, Jolyne, but your outfit is just so silly-looking! It's OK, you can make fun of mine.
Suspenders, yellow lipstick, hair buns--Earth girls have strange fashion. But you look sort of mean, so I think I'll stop there.
You've got the eyes of a girl who's been through a lot, Jolyne. But your outfit tells a more bubbly story, so I don't know what to think.
So, uh, I didn't want to be rude at first, but what's with the gizmo behind you? Or is that a man in a suit?
Mejarian technology can get pretty fancy, but how exactly you're summoning that robot behind you is beyond even me. What is that?
Why do you keep calling out "Stone Free"? Is that the model of the machine that keeps appearing behind you? What's its deal, anyway?
...Are we not supposed to acknowledge how Miss Tattoo here keeps summoning a big robot helper? I mean, she keeps ignoring it.
Well, aren't you a little fireball, Miss Mutant? You look pretty human to me, and this is a girl who thought men were aliens.
Hey, honey, men are mutant people, as far as I'm concerned. And they're still cute, so don't be so hard on yourself.
How many people have to tell you you're ugly for you to introduce yourself as a mutant? You poor, rundown thing.
You look pretty mundane for a mutant, darling. Although you've certainly got an inhuman fire in you.
Oooh! Even ~player~ realizes how beautiful I am--enough to add a clone! You're so adorable.
Hey, what's this all about, ~player~? Did I keep on winning, and you wanted to see me naked that badly?
Would you look at that? My beauty was so enticing that ~player~ figured out the offline version just to add more of me.
Earth's cloning technology is well underway! And ~player~ picked the perfect specimen, I must say.
I never thought ~player~ could manage to flatter me, and then they go and pick two of me! Good show.
My, my, ~player~. You really like the look of me.
Oh my God, is that what I look like? I'm even more beautiful from afar than I am in a mirror.
Hey there, Miss Street Fighter. We almost have the same name! It's like we're soulmates.
I didn't think Planet Korea could give its girls such Mejarian-sounding names! We're nearly called the same thing, Juri.
Well, hi there, almost-me! I guess "Juri" sounds more upbeat and friendly, but "Jura" is so much more womanly and refined.
"Juri"? Well, everyone, try not to get the two of us confused! Luckily, she's a bit on the short side.
So, Same-Name, what's with the scant outfit? If you were trying to copy me, you don't have the measurements for it.
I appreciate the flattery in dressing as skimpy as me, Juri, but it doesn't quite look like you can fill it up.
You've got some swaying hips, dear, but you might want bigger breasts if you're trying to match my revealing costume.
Figures you'd want to strip quickly. I'm doing the whole skimpy-costume look better--and I've got the chest to round it out.
Your dress is so scant, and yet you're hiding your lackluster legs with baggy pants. Next time make sure you've got the dimensions to copy my style.
Seriously now, Same-Name, what's with the attitude? Is this just a short-girl thing? Break up with your girlfriend?
Why are you so mean, anyway? I mean, I thought it was just an act at first, but this is getting unpleasant.
Oh look, it's Not-Jura's turn again. Going to make more threats? I get enough of those from soldiers--I don't know what your deal is.
Are you just pent-up from being too short to reach things? Mad because you can't afford a shirt? What's got you fired up?
What do we have here? A woman on the older side? You've still got looks compared to our ancient captain.
Oh, don't worry about being over-the-hill, Kali, honey. Our captain's a craggly old woman...wouldn't want her stripping, though.
On the older side, are we? Don't feel bad--you're a spring rose next to our century-old relic of a captain.
Well, I didn't expect to find a woman here with some wrinkles! But it's OK--you haven't caught up to our wizened old captain Magno just yet.
Ooh, nice and simple fashion is always a treat to see. I have a crewmate who bares her stomach just like you do!
Hey, girlie. I hope your stomach isn't feeling too vulnerable, all exposed next to the alien lady's rapier.
Feeling confident, dear? With a name like Pissible and a belly that vulnerable, you must.
Save the world, huh? Well, dearie, you and your little midriff should know I'm not from this world.
Hey, so, uh, normally I'd tease you or something, but what was with that big lightshow from you earlier?
Wait, weren't you wearing pink a little while ago? Like, a full suit? Was that lightshow back there you?
Hey, who's the new girl? And where'd that pink-suit-wearing woman go after she flashed away? Wait, was that you?
Hey, aren't you the one who half-blinded us all a little bit ago? Where'd your suit go? I thought it was cool, so start talking.
Ohhh, Kizuna, honey, you're so adorable! Those little bunny-ears--and your naive expression! ...Hey, are you listening?
Omigosh, Kizuna, I just want to squeeze those little ears right off your head, you're so cute! I--I...hello? Miss Kizuna?
Hey, honey, are you on the same planet as the rest of us? I think you're cute and all, but you're giving me the cold shoulder here.
And who's this naive little wide-eyed bunny-girl? She's got plenty of comments on us! Just...not really directed at us. You there, honey?
Talk about thinking out loud--this Kizuna girl doesn't seem to notice we can hear all of her little comments. Hey, Mejare to Kizuna--you're adorable!
Ooh! Ooh! You're the one who's with a woman, right? Are you some kind of Mejarian envoy to Earth?
You're with a woman, isn't that right? Maybe Mejare was just aping what Earthlings came up with first...
So, you're the one showing these poor Earth girls the Mejarian way, right? That they don't need men to be happy? Good job.
Finally, an Earth woman who's realized how much better other women's bodies are. We should gossip about our girlfriends later.
So, Miss Mejarian-style, are you going to be the Fama, or is your ladyfriend? My Barnette's far too cute to carry babies herself.
Hey there, short stuff! Seems all your height went into your chest--those things are even bigger than mine!
You hogging all the nutrients on this planet, Miss Vampire? You're the only Earth girl I've seen that outdoes my breasts.
Even through that schoolgirl's outfit, I can tell your breasts are superior to mine. Hopefully Barnette loves me for other reasons.
Is it true you suck blood, Miss Vampire? If so...well, we certainly know where it all goes.
Hey, Chatterbox, feel free to live a little. You're as bad as Meia...good thing she ended up somewhere else.
And here I thought I was sparing this table the boredom of having Meia around. Enter her Earth doppelganger.
Pale, dead-serious, somehow convinced there's strategy in cards. I didn't know they synthesized Meia's brand of boredom on Earth.
Please, Chatterbox, you're talking our ears off. And your smiles are just so radiant! A woman after Meia's own black heart.
What's with the wings, Miss Pixie? You some kind of sex-fairy sent to wake up our libidos?
And what do we have here? A tender little love fairy to help us all along in our sexual adventures?
A love fairy, eh? You listen here, Miss Pixie--I'm in a happy relationship. So no touching!
Little Miss Pixie's got quite the filthy mouth for being so frilly-pink with love. I guess sex is a part of love, but still...
I can't shake the feeling you and ~player~ might be a little closer than the rest of us, Miss Pixie. Do share the details.
Oh, are you and ~player~ an item, darling? You're always delivering the gossip to that side of the table...do share.
I consider myself a bit of a matchmaker, but it looks like Miss Fairytale and ~player~ have already shacked up with each other.
Interesting choice of woman, ~player~...a girl dressed as a fairy who drags you to strip poker. I would never do that to Barnette.
Raiding tombs, you said? Why would you ever want to be all dirty and dusty?
You won't find me in catacombs like you explore. It'd ruin my dress...and my face.
So what's in these tombs, anyway? We conduct raids on the living and able--so watch out!
Raiding those who can't defend themselves doesn't sound too impressive, honey. Or do monsters live in those tombs of yours?
Uh...you want to calm down there, sweetheart? Maybe put that men's gun down? Take a nap?
Jeez, we knew you meant business by the gun. No need to shout...must be men's influence.
Can you pipe down? Way to confirm the image of Earth girls as nasty little gun-toting balls of violence.
Uh...why are you carrying that giant men's gun? I'd show it to Barnette, but you, uh, don't seem too friendly.
That's a huge gun, Miss Moxie...men's mechanical weapons are so noisy and inefficient. Don't tell Barnette I said that.
So, uh, besides being blue, what's your deal? You're all sweet and polite now.
Can't say I prefer blue hair, but you're certainly a lot sweeter now, honey. What happened?
Normally I like blondes, but at least you're not waving a gun around and cursing anymore. Nice tradeoff.
Blue hair is more exotic, but blonde is far more beautiful. Still, I'll take this polite version of you over the alternative.
This is so freaky to me, and I've dealt with the Paksis's weird energy. Do you just swtich all the time?
Are you really bouncing back and forth like this all the time? Like, do you have any friends?
Must be hard getting to know anyone when you keep losing your memory. How do you deal with always switching?
I can't believe you have split personalities. Where does the other one go? How do you make friends?
Bless you--oh no.
Who sneezed--eep! N-not Launch!
Ack! Why'd you have to sneeze again?
Eek! N-not again! My heart can't take this!
...You're not from Earth either, are you? ...Or human. Or cute.
Say, Miss, I couldn't help but notice your...eye. What planet are you from, exactly?
And here I thought I'd be seeing some Earth women in this place...or that I'd be the most exotic one.
Always nice to look a woman in the eye. Singular.
I guess they don't value depth perception on whatever planet you're from. You must be a real steal.
Magno Vivan's pirates accept all women...but with depth perception like yours, you wouldn't make it as a pilot.
Planet Pandora, was it? What a lovely name! I might have to retire there with my darling Barnette when we're older.
Pandora sounds like such a gorgeous name. I think I'll call my first daughter that--surely Barnette won't mind.
Barnette and I are always discussing baby names. Pandora sounds positively wonderful!
A hunter, eh? And what do hunters hunt on lovely little Pandora--a cute name, by the way.
Hey there, Little Miss Witchy-watch. What's a nervous bookworm like you doing here in your Halloween costume?
Don't ask me how a nerdy schoolgirl ended up in this seedy place, but I bet those glasses are going to fog up even more. What's with the witch costume?
Hey, Four-eyes, why'd you wear your witch costume to a game where you have to take your clothes off anyway?
Can you even see the cards behind those thick lenses of yours, Miss Magic? Why are you all dressed up in a witch costume, anyway?
Ohhh, what a cute little egghead! You look like our ship's engineer--except she doesn't dress up as a witch.
A covert agent, eh? I guess if an alien woman knows that, you've already failed at your job.
So what are you so covert about, Miss Agent? We pirates just charge in and gun the place down before they know what hit them!
What kind of covert agent fights with light? You know, the thing that makes your position clearer?
Oho--we've got an agent on our hands. Wouldn't be the first we had on our ship--and we made her come around to our side.
Ooh, an Earth woman with green hair! My girlfriend Barnette has green hair...and she is the cutest thing!
Ooh, I didn't know Earth women could have green hair! I've always considered it the most cutely exotic thing about Barnette.
A sword and lovely green hair? You must be a sign that Barnette and I are ready for children, sweetie.
Ooh, green hair on a woman never fails to get me going. But don't worry, my verdantly-colored girlfriend can handle the rest.
Hel-looo, camera! Over here, sweetie--get whatever angle you like best.
Omigosh, you brought a camera? A sign from the heavens! Now all of Earth will get to see my beautiful naked body!
Looking to get some photographs of the exotic alien woman, were you? But now you've got a whole different reason to capture me.
Go right ahead with that camera, dearie. It's always been shameful how I've been in the media for piracy instead of beauty.
Judging by that sword, you're not from Earth either, Miss Crystal. Where can I get one of those?
Don't ask me why that thing is drawn, but damn if it isn't more impressive than my silly little rapier. Got any extras?
Ooh, I like the look of that glowing sword! Even Mejare hasn't though to put its lasers in blades yet.
I could do for an upgrade on this rapier--would you please refer me to the planet where they make those glowing swords?
...Is someone playing a Halloween prank on me? Where are your eyes? How are you floating? Earth...
Don't get me wrong, Mejare has Halloween just like Earth...but we just dress up. That doesn't look like a costume.
...OK, it's hard to comment on what's weird about you when there's so much to choose from. Do I start with your floating or your eyes?
...Is this Earth? Did I get the right planet? Because you like even more alien that I do, with that skin...and no eyes.
Well, hi there, Miss Accent! That is just the cutest polka-dot bodysuit you have on!
Omigosh, your funny accent is so cute! It matches your goofy polka-dotted suit.
Well, aren't you the most adorable thing! All dolled up in polka dots, stumbling over your words! I could just gobble you up!
That's a pretty darling suit, sweetie, with all the polka dots. And the way you trip over your words just makes me melt!
Hey, what were those noises you made before? Didn't sound like the common language...
...What's the name of that language you keep slipping into, anyway? Some sort of Earth code-talk? I only speak the common one...
Bilingualism is so impressive, Marinette! I only speak the common language...I don't even know Mejarians' codespeak.
So you speak the common language, but also this other one? What's it called? Because it sounds so cute!
Forget the common language, Marinette, your "French" sounds like the most romantic thing! You've got to say some more.
Oooh, Marinette! Can you say some more "French"? My heart beats faster every time your tongue slips!
You should say some more French, Marinette! It's got the silkiest sound to it--it makes my heart go wild!
Oooh, Marinette, since it's your turn, can you throw out some more of this "French"? It sounds like a lover's language.
Don't stop now, honey! I hope I'm not imposing...but I'd love to hear some more French!
Your language is the absolute coolest, darling! Say some more for me, if you don't mind...I hope I'm not being a burden.
I'm not demanding too much of you, am I, Marinette? I just love your language...and this should take your mind off stripping.
Normally I'm interested in women's tongues for other reasons...but with you, I can't get over how cool your language is!
I think I'm jealous, Marinette! Not only are you the cutest little blueberry muffin of a girl, but your language is to die for!
Oh, I dressed as a vampire once for Halloween! Barnette even says I have fangs when I get sneaky.
Red and black is such a daring combination! My dress is the same way. "Sexy Vampire" is my favorite Halloween outfit!
Oh, does Earth celebrate Halloween on a different date? I like going as a vampire, too--with Barnette as my servant.
Oh my gosh, Mavis, those fake fangs are adorable! I dressed up as a vampire one Halloween--women call me a vamp.
What'd you say you did? Train in poker? Well, it didn't save you that hand...unless they're animals or something.
So, you're all about poker-mon, was it? Well, seems you've been training all your life for this game...
These pokuhmon things just sound like more trouble than they're worth. Animals in Mejarian zoos are so dirty!
You're an animal trainer, isn't that right? Or was it poker...mons? Not following the Earth slang here.
What's with the hat, honey? Take it off and let your hair run wild, like any woman's should!
Matting your lovely hair under a hat like that...even if you do run all the time, I just can't understand.
A killer, you said? The only killer here is what that hat's doing to your hair.
Check out Miss Exercise over here. There's no running from this game...so drop the hat and let your hair breathe a while.
...Yeah, we're gonna be here a while. This girl's dressed for the vacuum of space.
Does it really get that cold on Earth? Or anywhere, for that matter?
You're from Planet China, is that right? Must be one big snowball if that's in vogue over there.
I understand why you must be so cold. Your name is pretty close to Meia, after all.
I didn't think you'd be the first to lose between us, Meia. Maybe I'll win this whole thing!
Oh, wow. If you're taking the first shot, I might actually beat you.
Would you look at that, Meia? First blood between us. You getting sloppy?
Overconfident, Meia? Or just some bad luck?
Again? Meia, are you OK? You didn't have to take off your eyepiece, seriously.
Another? Meia...you're all flushed. Just calm down...
Meia, you're blushing. You're a wreck...
Meia, this is getting embarrassing. You're a better poker player than this!
Gascogne would be so ashamed of you, Meia. Where's all that poker skill?
Still haven't lost. What would Gascogne say?
Again? Come on, Meia, you're better than this.
Really? I shouldn't be beating you at all, Meia.
Hate to throw this back at you, but where's your focus?
Yeesh. Did I pick the worst day of your life to drag you here or what?
What's got you so distracted, Meia, honestly? The tantalizing thought of male nudity?
It's a good thing you're a better officer than strip poker player, because this is just sad.
Talk about off days. You should be beating me senseless as usual.
...Honestly, I don't know what to say. You always beat me!
The stripping must really have been getting to you. I've never beaten you before!
Never in a million years would I have predicted this kind of gap between us. Sorry.
You'd be running out of excuses right about now...if you ever made excuses.
Ooh, a lady doctor! The Nirvana's only doctor is a man--I wonder if he'd lose his cool with you gunning for his spot.
Honestly, I'm torn! You're a cute woman doctor--and blonde! But our ship's doctor is a man with rather nice hair himself.
Ooh, a doctor from Earth! I bet that makes you an expert on male sexuality, doesn't it?
Ooh, a woman doctor is just what I've been looking for! Think you could help me and Barnette get pregnant?
Female and blonde...if only Duero were blond, then he'd be the perfect doctor for me. So handsome...
Hey, Miss Medicine. Since you're from Earth, I might have a few questions about men's tubes tonight.
Well, aren't you a snobby little girl? I guess they don't raise women to have manners on planet Britain.
What planet did you say you were from, darling? Britain? Well, I like your accent, but your personality is just nasty.
Witch this, muggle that. Don't they teach you any manners on planet Britain, honey? Honestly.
My, my. You're an arrogant little squirt, aren't you? Remind me to tell the crew to never visit planet Britain.
My, my! You work in the law? This old pirate better be careful around you.
So you do something with the law, huh? Think you could defend my murderous pirate self in a courtroom?
So what's a "lawyer" do all day? Pushing papers around sounds dreadfully boring when you're a daredevil star pilot.
I see you're quite well-endowed there, Miss Magistrate. Is that how you win people over in your legal arguments?
My, what a decorated young woman! The things politics can buy for you...and a pirate can take.
Well, well, well. A political woman? This pirate doesn't like that...don't let my similarly fancy dress deceive you.
Well, aren't you an adorably ornate little specimen! I guess with no height, you need trinkets to stand out in politics...don't mind the big, buxom pirate.
A politician? Women don't get much more boring than that. Why not turn to piracy...where the girls are tall and curvy.
Omigosh, omigosh, wait! You and Tojiko are married? It's so cool to see women in love besides Mejarians!
Wait, you're a couple? You're married? Oh, I have a girlfriend, too! I thought Mejarians were alone in the universe with this sort of thing!
Ohh, it's so nice to see married women outside Mejare! I was thinking about proposing to my girlfriend soon!
Wherever planet Japan is, I'm glad women get married there! Mejare seems so alone in recognizing womanly love...
You seem pretty harmless for a girl claiming to be a warlord, dearie. Have you ever seen space combat?
On and on you go about how you're some kind of fearsome warlord. I'd like to see how all four feet of you do in the modern era--with spaceships.
Forgive me for not being terrified by your stature, Miss Warlord. You seem more like an airhead--one who doesn't know the deadly space pilot she's dealing with.
How many wars have you fought, Pint-size? Not enough to be scary--but then, I've braved so many space battles with my glorious Vandread.
...OK, no one here has any right to call me skimpily-dressed with Bandages here running around.
What kind of sex-crazed planet considers that street clothes? And here I thought Earth was conservative.
...Seems I've walked into a game that is well in progress. Poor thing has been losing so badly!
Jeez. I'm a pirate, and I can afford more clothing than you. Too bad there's no money involved here.
Hey, cutie! You look like you've got some kind of rank to your name, with that beret--care to share any details?
Ooh, you're not a bad looker, Earth-girl! I like that exotic purple hair. What is it you do, exactly?
Tell me more about your exciting "NERV" job, Miss Military. I want to know all about Earth!
Ohoho--a military woman. Well, indulge this filthy pirate scum and share what it is you do all day.
Gorgeous purple hair--and a slender figure! Misato, I think I'm falling for you a little...want to come aboard the Nirvana and meet Barnette?
That purple hair is almost Mejarian in vibrance--and you're in good shape! Come aboard the Nirvana, Misato--tell me about men, and meet my girlfriend!
You know, Misato...the Nirvana always has room for another beautiful woman. Why don't you digest that beer with me and Barnette?
Misatoooo, my purple-haired skinny little darling...are you curious about a woman's touch? The Nirvana has room, and Barnette is waiting for us...
Ooh, I know a girl named Misty! She's this cute little thing from Pluto--barely has any breasts at all! Must be cold there.
Why, the Nirvana has a young girl named Misty aboard! Being from Pluto, she knew her way around men better than any of us.
You're not the first Misty I've come to know, actually. A teenie-weenie Plutonian girl we have is called the same thing!
I don't think they have your poker-mon things on Pluto...but they do have girls named Misty.
Hey there, Miss Star-Student! That's a school uniform, right? What do they teach you on Earth?
Check out the uniformed student type! I was never good in school--but what is it they teach you on Earth, huh?
Mejare's schools are nothing but men this, violence that, with a little math. How does your fancy Earth education compare?
A student, huh? Do they teach you anything interesting on Earth? I was never a brainiac, but I still rose to be a pilot!
Ooh, an Earth girl still in school! Have they taught you anything about men? What do they teach you in general?
Hey, honey, am I not attractive enough for you? You seem awfully dead-set on ~player~.
So, Miss Schoolgirl, do you have a crush on ~player~? You're always addressing them.
I wasn't aware I was intruding upon a budding romance. You're really gunning for ~player~'s heart, aren't you?
Hey, Miss Tie-and-Blazer, I'm a little offended by your lack of interest. I doubt ~player~ likes being chased, anyway.
What's up, Ocean Girl? You seem awfully eager. Does being around men tend to hypersexualize a woman?
Jeez, it didn't take a loss for you to start piping up about stripping. You don't need a game to do that, you know.
And here we have Miss Eager-Beaver. You don't look like you have the assets to be all excited about stripping, sweetheart.
At least you're confident about nudity. But are you seriously just losing on purpose? Earth girls...
What's next, Ocean Girl? Your shir--I was kidding!
I imagine the shirt is ne--wait, no, I was just joking!
...You're not serious? I'm telling you, you have to tease a little!
...Ocean Girl's a total idiot. Just stripping nude right off the bat...way to miss the point.
Honey, you'd be better off putting some meat on your bones than trying desperately to show them off.
Sweetie, you're a twig. This is just unhealthy...as unhealthy as you look.
Are you suffering from this "anorexia" I keep reading about? Eating disorders? Do men do this to you?
Talk about needing a girlfriend. See what happens when you're never validated?
Is there a doctor in the building? One specializing in mental health?
...This isn't funny anymore. Now I'm just worried about you.
...This is getting old. I'm getting old listening to this.
What a surprise. Intentionally throwing the game tends to make you lose.
...Maybe I should stop hitting on men. Look what it does to you...
Is this really what Earth women are like? She's an outlier, right?
Seems running the Harvest has a tendency to scramble Earth women's brains...and make them want to play poker.
...At least she's losing quickly. Easy to do when you barely check the cards.
Oh God, she's finally doing it. Be very afraid...unless you Earth people are used to this sort of thing.
Please don't. I've learned my lesson. I'll stay on Mejare.
I'm really appreciating Mejare right now. Maybe I'll straighten up and get a normal job.
This is the last time I come to Earth. Even among Mejarian pirate scum, none of us act like this.
The storm is almost over...or maybe this is just the calm before it.
I think I'd prefer the Harvest's company at this point.
Oh, you're still here. Why not just strip more than one thing at a time? Well, too late.
I still don't know who made you wait this long to show what you wanted.
And I thought I was trying to be seductive! Here comes Miss Succubus, decked out in her Halloween costume.
Don't think you're slipping that past me, honey. We have Halloween on Mejare...and I've dressed as a succubus before, yes.
Nice costume, Miss Seductress. Looks like I have competition for all my man-hunting tonight.
Mejare has stories of succubi, too...they really know how to tire a woman out. I guess you must have a lot of fun with men here.
...OK, Mr. Ping, do you think you're fooling the woman from a planet of women? What's it like having a tube between your legs?
Oh, you're a man, are you, Mr. China? Well, then, please explain to this Mejarian how men's tubes work...in excruciating detail.

Ping of Planet China, yes? I wasn't aware women imitated men there...if you're the real deal, give me a rundown of this "penis" business.
Oh my God. You are just the cutest little thing, Nagisa! You're practically a little girl--who forced you to be here?
Ohhhh, you're the most adorable little cinnamon roll of a girl, Nagisa. Who rolled you in sugar before forcing you to come here?
You're such a sweet little thing, Nagisa. My heart melts every time you stammer. Did you lose a bet to be here?
How'd this sugary-sweet cutie in a school uniform end up in this seedy place? I just want to squeeze you, not strip you.
And I thought Earth girls were cold-blooded organ harvesters. You couldn't harvest a plant, sweetheart. How'd you get here?
So, Natsuki, darling, what's with your little crush on ~player~? Trying to strip your teeny-weeny little body for them?
You realize you're not fooling anyone with your affections, least of all ~player~, right? It's clear you invited them here to strip for them.
You know, Pint-size, if you wanted to strip your eensy-weensy little body for ~player~, you didn't need to play poker to do it.
Does ~player~ appreciate you dragging them out to this seedy place just to strip for them, dear? Clearly you have a crush...
...Yeah, I can see why you'd be comfortable here. We'd need a computer scan to find your vagina.
You know, I tease Earth girls about growing up all small, but wow. Now I just feel bad.
At least you've got those wings to buzz around to our height. Inferiority complex, sweetie?
Well, there goes any chance of getting a good look at what Earth girls have got. You are from Earth, right?
Well, hi there, Miss Lullaby! That flowing blue hair is to die for! Got any romantic songs on that harp?
There's a few ways to get on my good side. Gorgeous long blue hair is one of them--and playing sweet melodies is another!
Nayru, was it? What a delicate, refined name for a sleepy girl wrapped in flowing blue hair! Play a love song on that harp, why don't you?
Oh, Nayru, look at all that magnificent blue hair! It's so exotic--so's that harp! Play a song, honey!
Just when I get smug about my gorgeous blonde hair, Miss Bluenette one-ups me with a much less boring color. And she plays an instrument, too!
Omigosh, Nayru! You're an Oracle? Ooh, I was thinking of proposing to my girlfriend--can you see our future together?
Flowing blue hair, a harp, and you can predict things? Nayru, you're a steal! Tell me about me and my girlfriend's future together!
Could you maybe predict if I should get married, Miss Oracle? Barnette and I have been going steady for a long time now...
Wait, you can see the future? Nayru, you keep getting cuter! Can you predict if Barnette and I should get married?
My, you Earth girls have so much on your minds! And it's apparently content to stay there.
So, Miss Motormouth, how's life? Or the weather? Or your family? Or anything?
I guess you're too tiny to fit a voice box in the model. Don't feel bad--you're quite expressive, dear.
I guess I'm doing enough talking for the both of us. And hey--that adorable two-toned hair is a statement unto itself!
Way to come in a full outfit, Miss Maid. And you're still speaking just as politely as when you're on the job!
Whoever is your house's owner must really crack the whip, Miss Maid. Even now you're using those silly honorifics.
"Jura-chan" sounds like the most adorable nickname! I've got to get Barnette to start calling me that...Barnette-chan.
You don't have to keep speaking all polite, Miss Maid. You're in the company of a brutal pirate now--feel free to join the crew.
...Are you OK there, Miss Fireball? Are you on the same planet as the rest of us?
I may be an alien...but you're certainly acting like one. Ugh...
Four arms looks useful, but I really can't get over the constant shouting. Can't you pipe down?
Hey, Earth-girl. Or wherever you're from. There's this thing called an indoor voice.
Well, well, well. We've got a goddess here, ladies...besides me, of course.
A goddess, eh? I guess that makes two at this table, then.
Just look at that shimmering green hair--and that ornamentation! But I think I'm every bit the goddess you are, hot stuff.
Just look at that--two goddesses, near-opposite color schemes. I guess I'm the evil, nasty one.
Omigosh, Palutena, that gorgeous green hair is even longer than mine! My girlfriend has green hair, you know.

You know who else has beautiful green hair, Miss Goddess? My girlfriend, Barnette. That sweet little thing is back on the ship!
So is that lovely green hair just the goddess's right? My girlfriend got hers from standard Mejarian genetic trickery.
An engineer, huh? Sounds like you and Parfet might get along--and good thing, too, because she's getting close to a man.
Is there room for another egghead woman in your life, Miss Engineer? Our current one is fooling around with our male doctor at present.
Are you really an engineer? Our ship's main mechanic is Parfet, and she looks the part a lot more. Oh, and she's dating a man, I think...
Is it true engineers will go for almost anyone? Nerdy types are like that, right? Our engineer Parfet might be dating a man...
Nice sensible little outfit you've got there. The glasses sell the sexy-and-smart look!
Working for an old woman, eh? I know the feeling. Those glasses must have convinced her you knew what you were doing.
A woman with glasses, eh? I certainly couldn't pull off the look...I guess I don't look very smart.
I know an engineering egghead with glasses--Parfet's her name. And she seems to attract what few smart men I know.
My sympathies about the premature white hair, honey. You look a lot older than you should.
You might want to rethink those facial markings, dear. With that white hair, they look an awful lot like wrinkles.
Couples can choose their babies' hair color on Mejare thanks to genetic engineering...there's a reason white isn't very popular.
You poor thing. Our captain's ancient, but even she still has color in her hair.
I've never been a fan of royalty, but a blonde woman in charge? Suddenly it doesn't seem so bad.
At least you've got the hair color to match your presumptuous title, Miss Princess. This pirate still might rob you later.
You damn princesses and your unearned jewelry and dresses. I stole everything I have, you know! But at least you're blonde.
So from one blonde to another, Miss Princess, how much is that crown worth? ...Just a pirate's curiosity.
Shame you're not an actual pearl. I could go for one of those...Mejare hardly has any.
No animals on Mejare means no pearls. If only you were one of those beauties...
All stretched-out like that...you're not shaped like a pearl at all! Shame, because I love those things.
Oh, to hold a real pearl in my hands! I've only seen pictures in Earth history books.
It looks like we've found an Earth girl who's just decided to embrace the whole "boring conservatism" stereotype. At least your hair is a fiery red.
That fiery red hair contrasts your rather plain outfit. But it's not a bad look overall!
Finally, a normal-looking Earth girl. I need a measuring stick to compare all these superpowered weirdos to...all you've got is that red hair.
Good, a civilian girl. So many people at this bar are such colorful characters--oh, but your hair is pretty vibrant, I guess.
Here's an interesting specimen! Most women are only pink on the inside...and you seem eager to show your insides anyway.
Hey there, Miss Ponygirl, what's with the very rosy complexion? I mean, you seem pretty excited to show us more and more of it.
...Well, let's address the elephant in the room...or horse. What's up with the pink skin? On top of being some weird exhibitionist.
Are you some kind of test subject, dear? Whatever they injected you with to make your skin pink is making you bounce off the walls and out of your clothes.
Hey there, Miss Meterstick. Thanks for not letting my ego get too big when it came to height.
Every woman I know says I'm tall. Do you turn heads when you enter a room, too?
Oh, good, a woman who understands what it's like towering over people. The intimidation can be kind of fun, no?
Men seem to be taller than women. I guess I wouldn't turn as many heads on Earth, then...but you'd do it no matter what.
Hey there, Miss Mind-Your-Manners. You talk the talk, but that cleavage tells me you've got a wild side.
You're awfully polite for a woman perverted enough to come here in the first place. Just trying to throw us off, cutie?
Yeah, yeah, I don't buy the whole polite-and-formal act from a girl willing to strip nude in public. Just waiting for the good stuff?
You talk pretty prim-and-proper, dear...and yet here you are, stripping nude for us. Do you have a dirty side, or did you lose a bet?
Blonde, scantily-clad, loves attention? Honey, you're a woman after my own heart.
I like the energy you're bringing, Miss Wrestler! The scant layering doesn't hurt, either.
See, you're my kind of woman! These other Earth girls are so dreadfully boring, always covering up the good stuff.
Barely wearing anything? You should know my girlfriend is the same way, cutie...only she's not blonde.
You're looking a little pale, honey. Well, actually, a lot pale. I guess there's not much sun in the basement of offline!
Ouch. Does this Equestria planet not have any sun, dear? Or rather...the offline depths.
Er...Mejare sings the praises of pale skin, honey, but you're taking it a little far. Don't they let you offliners see the sun?

Omigosh, Rarity! Are you really a fashion designer? I mean, you're pale-white, which is weird, but--oh. The old Rarity.
Talk about a big ball of misery. Even your skin has turned all blue in despair.
Show your face, honey! Or are you trying to hide that weird blue skin? Don't worry, it suits your miserable demeanor.
I guess I'd be miserable, too, if I had the complexion of a grapefruit.
I should bring Meia over here for some counseling. Even she's not as miserable as Miss Blueberry here.
I don't think your complexion quite matches anymore, dear. You've really lightened up!
So much for Miss Blueberry. I mean, you're bluer than ever, but showing all that skin's really warmed you up!
I knew stripping always makes a girl feel sexy and confident! There's a reason I invited my mopey squadron leader here, you know.
Hey, Miss Doom-and-Gloom, you're starting to look like you're having fun. That's perfect--I bet Meia will lighten up once she's naked, too!
Hey there, kiddo. Maybe you didn't notice, but this is strip poker--not a place for little girls in their Halloween costumes.
I like the wings, Remilia, darling! And your friend's dressed as a maid. Still, don't you think you're a little young for strip poker?
Run along now, dearies! Halloween costumes are fun and all, but this is a game for adults...where we take clothes off.
Ohhh, Remilia, those vampire and maid costumes are so adorable! But really, strip poker's not a game for little girls.
Hey, now, girlies, this game is adults only. Someone give them candy for their costumes and a headpat for the road.
Hey there, Miss Gunslinger! You're not gonna fire those things, are you? My girlfriend collects those sorts of guns.
Omigosh, are those antique men's kinetic weapons? My girlfriend collects them! You should meet her.
Always good to see an armed woman! My girlfriend, Barnette, is totally obsessed with men's mechanical guns like yours.
Hey, Miss Gunslinger! You should lighten up a little and show those men's kinetic guns to my girlfriend. She's a total connoisseur.
I like the grace of Mejarian laser rings myself, but you want some serious interest on those men's guns of yours? Talk to my girlfriend.
Hmph. Normally I'd do a little flirting with the loser, but I'd rather just ignore Miss Powderkeg over here.
You know, I would flirt with you, Revy--except you're liable to start shooting at me.
I guess I should've brought my laser ring like Meia said. Gunslinger over here might get offended I don't want to flirt with her.

I've never met such a ferocious woman, even among Mejarian imperials. Is this the result of dating a man?
Sleeping with men isn't what made you so aggressive, is it? I might have to rethink this whole seed-collection thing...
Even the woman soldiers I've fought aren't so brutish and intimidating. Did men make you this way, Revy? Are you seeing one?

Ooh, maybe I need a title like Ribbon Girl here. The Red Claw! Dread Pirate Elden!
Well! I may not have springloaded mecha-arms, but I do have a fantastic Dread ship. I need a title, too.
Second-in-command of the Nirvana's Dread squadron isn't as elegant a title as Ribbon Girl. I need something snappy...
Shouldn't you be called Spring-Arms or something? People don't call me Boots Pilot...hey, I could use a title.
Ooh, a tribal-looking woman! You'd turn heads, Miss Animal. But the rest of your outfit would fit right in--by not covering much.
Talk about a fierce look in your eye--and even skimpier clothing than me! But you make it work, Miss Primal.
Hey there, cutie! Between that fierce look and light dress, you'd be a real steal where I'm from!
You're already a model Mejarian with that much skin showing. The primal look is cute, as long as you don't actually get sweaty or dirty.

Don't feel bad about your unearned title, Miss Princess. I hear you can perform magic--and alongside blonde hair, I'd say you're alright in my book.
Little Miss Magician is a princess, as well? Well, against my pirate nature, I think I'll let a fellow blonde be on her way.

Hey, cutie! You look a little wide-eyed and naive to be here...but those bullets suggest otherwise.
I've got my eye on you, Miss Ruby-Red. I know better than to trust a cute girl with ammo clips on her belt.
You know who else is a cute girl with a little ammo on the side? My girlfriend, Barnette. And if you're anything like her, I better not get you angry.
The black-and-red outfit is a winner, honey--very intimidating! So's that ammo. Guess you need to balance out your cute face.
My, honey, we're all just trying to have a good time here, stripping naked together. You remind me of how mad my girlfriend gets...
You're a fiery one, Miss Red-Eyed-Uniform. A lot like my darling Barnette! So I don't mind.

So angry! But as a fellow woman of the sword, you're cute--my girlfriend Barnette gets huffy sometimes, too!
Come now, ~player~, this Ryuko is so 2017. My leader Meia knocked her to offline forever ago.

My, that's not the Ryuko I expected! You've been here even longer than I have--and it shows.

Boo! The nasty pirate woman's going to kill you!

I'm a big fan of the bodysuit look, cutie. So's a certain crewmate of mine I wish were here...space just makes it so much easier.
Ooh, a blonde! And she travels around in space, too. If only you had the sense to wear my dress instead of that suit, we'd be twins.
A shapely little specimen, zipping around space in that provocative bodysuit? You're a model Mejarian--if only Meia were here!
You OK there, Little Miss School-dress? You look like you've never worn it before, with how you're squirming.

Ohh, aren't you an adorable little schoolgirl! So nervous, you're fidgeting like you're not used to the uniform.
I thought schoolgirls loved their uniforms like their own bodies--you look a little uncomfortable. I mean, I liked mine as a girl.
"Magical girl," hm? That's not the kind of thing you can introduce yourself with and then fade away, dearie. Let me see.
Now, now, Sayaka, you can't just call yourself a magical girl and expect me not to get curious. Show me.
Why, hello there, cutie! I hear you're a magical girl--won't you please show me a little magic?

What planet are you from, Miss Starshine? Your fabulous blonde hair is winning me over as we speak.
Guess I can't learn about Earth girls from you--but hey, it's nice to know there's other gorgeous spacefarers out there. Who like stripping.
Ooh, you cut your hair short like Meia does. But it's wonderful blonde like mine--space is so vast in its variety!
What's up, Schoolgirl? You seem way too excited to be here--I don't think you know I pirate for a living.
What a naive little thing! Still in her school uniform, blissfully unaware of the pirate next to her.
Hey, cutie. You look a little lost--you playing hooky from school? That's how I became a pirate.
I think you're lost, Little Miss--you're cute and all, but this isn't a classroom. It's a nasty bar where pirates like me come to strip.
I make fun, but you really are the most adorably naive little girl, Sayori. I have a crewmate named Dita who's just as cute!
Being a bit of an airhead just makes you cuter, Miss Hair-Bow. One of our pilots, Dita, is as cute as a button, and she's like you!
Oh, your adorable naivety reminds me of Dita! She's another pilot on our crew, and she's a total ditz--but in a cute way!
Such a wide-eyed, naive, lovable face! My crewmate Dita is just like you--and her ditziness hasn't gotten anyone killed yet.
What's your fascination with ~player~, huh, Bowtie? You should just ask them out already before you stammer any more.
You really are like Dita. Hopelessly in love with ~player~, but you'd rather fumble your words instead of spitting it out.
So naive and clueless. Look, Sayori, when you want someone, you march right up and flirt with them! I'll take ~player~ if you don't.
Look, darling, everyone can tell you want ~player~ bad. When I met Barnette, I made my feelings clear from the start!
Totally devoted to scarlet, eh? It certainly gets the heart racing...and my appetite stirred.
Maybe I should get a fanciful nickname like Scarlet Witch...but not if it means restricting myself to one measly color.
What do you think would be a good nickname for me, dear? The Black Pirate? I can't pull off all-red like you do.
I wonder if all-red would look good on me. I'm a pirate--I don't exactly have my pick of the litter with clothes!
Ooh, Sei, you're such a cutie! You look just like my squadron leader, Meia--that short blue hair is to die for!
Short blue hair and shoulder armor? You're the spitting image of my boss, Sei--too bad she's at another table!
Short blue hair? Omigosh, Sei, my boss Meia looks just like you! And she could really use a girlfriend.
Sei! That's your name, right? You look like my boss Meia with that short-cut blue hair. Your eyes are a lot softer, though.
Seems bodysuits are more popular among spacegoers than even I figured. Works for me--I like your figure.
My, my, honey! You've got some interesting decorations, but that suit is making me fall in love already.
I really ought to try out one of those bodysuits myself...or maybe stuff Barnette in one. They're just so revealing!
Those jumpsuits really are the best, especially when you're in low gravity. The enemy should know how beautiful you are!
Ooh, I think that belly-dancing routine is exotic--so do most Mejarians. Send my regards to your online half, OK?
So what's a "genie," anyway? Does that mean "cute belly-dancing girl"? Because I think I like genies, then--well, ones who are online.
I like your style, Miss Genie! You're as revealing as my girlfriend Barnette--but, of course, Barnette is in the online game!
Ooh, the way you move your hips is exquisite, Miss Genie! Such a shame you've been replaced, but not everyone can be an online superstar.
it's a good thing you're a medic, because that cute face is making my heart beat ever faster.
Miss Medic, are you sure you can handle the problems a big girl like might come down with? Pilots get hurt, you know, and you're so tiny.
Oh, Miss Medic? I think I'm coming down with something--love for your adorable little face! Look how small you are!
You dress pretty casually for a medic, but that adorable size is helping me overlook your shoddy sense of professionalism.
Quite the interesting accent you've got there. I can't quite call it refined, but then again, I am a filthy pirate.
I guess when I lead a life of crime, I can't get away with calling you uncivilized-sounding. Actions mean so much more!
Interesting dialect you have on Planet Australia. Don't you ever get tired of misunderstanding each other?
This Australia planet certainly has a way with words...mostly for making them incomprehensible.
Ooh, an assassin. I hope there's no bounty on my head!
Forgive this pirate for being a little on edge around an assassin. There's a reward for my head, no doubt!
You assassins always act so tough on the ground. Let's see you take me in a dogfight!
You're a cute little thing, Miss Assassin. I guess that helps in your line of work--people lower their guards.
...Did you click the wrong Sheena, ~player~? I know you yearn for the good old days, but the new one is better.
Hm? Oh, hello there, Sheena Classic. I didn't realize this was an offline game--and to think I wore my best makeup!
Hey, ~player~, why can't I be with the newer, cuter Sheena? I deserve better and you know it!
Sheena Classic, hm? I sure hope I don't end up as Jura Classic...but I'll never be abandoned, right?
You OK there, Miss Jumpsuit? You're looking a little green-around-the-frills.
Is all the stripping and teasing making you nauseous, dearie? Just trying to grin and bear it?
I'm liking the style on the bodysuit, honey--it helps obscure your sickly green hue.
Mejarians have some say in their skin tone from genetic engineering...I don't think we can do green, but then I doubt it'd be too popular.
Ooh, an armed woman. You're like an extreme version of my tan little gun-nut girlfriend.
I'm not sure what's most intimidating--that height or that huge mechanical firearm!
If only I brought my cute little Barnette here. She'd be head-over-heels for a woman with a man's gun!
You might be even taller than me, Miss Nighttime. But what's with the big mechanical gun? That's my girlfriend's thing.
Come now, honey. You can't waltz in waving that huge kinetic weapon around and expect to make any friends.
Heeheehee! Settle down, honey--you might catch fire at that speed!
There aren't any fire hazards around, right? Because Miss Submarine here is positively blazing around.
Talk about energy! Just look at Little Miss Shimakaze go--she's bound to leave a fire trail!
Ohh, Shimakaze, you're just the cutest little girl! Slow down and let me squeeze you--you're going to overheat at this rate.
...I'm so confused. Are you some kind of ship soul? ...Ooh, the Nirvana has a soul, too!
Omigosh, Shimakaze! If you're some kind of ship soul, then maybe the Nirvana's soul could be a cutie like you!
Oh, the Paksis is kind of like the Nirvana's soul! Maybe we could get a cute soul girl like you for it!
...So you're the soul of a ship? Like, any ship? I wonder if the Paksis could make a cute girl to hold the Nirvana's soul...
Oh, all this technobabble and status reports! I feel like I'm right back on the Nirvana, fighting for survival!
Damage to the stern! Oh, it's like I'm back on the Nirvana. Shimakaze, darling, you're cute and you remind me of home!
Our bridge girls are so cute, always reporting damage like you do. I feel so heroic when I pilot and save them...this is nostalgic.
I fly all the way to Earth, and I meet a girl who's got the whole Nirvana experience packed into her little frame! With all your reports, it's like I never left.
Obsessed with speed, are you? Sleek as my Dread is, I'm a lover, not a fighter...I prefer defense.
As my Vandread proves, I'm more of a defensive fighter. Your piddly little speed is no match for a shield.
Just as beauty needs to be defended, Jura Basil Elden emphasizes defense in her Vandread. Your little obsession with speed is of no concern to me.
We may have to agree to disagree on tactics, Shimakaze, dear. You like speed--I protect myself.
I'm afraid I've always been a defensive pilot rather than your speed business. My beauty isn't to be gambled, you know.
Hi there, dearie! That's an absolutely adorable hat you have on--do you have any others that match that uniform?
Ohh, tiny little things like you always make my heart melt! Is the schoolgirl look a style where you live?
A student's uniform is always the most adorable thing. As you might imagine from my piracy, I wasn't the best student.
School was always so dreadfully boring, the way they prattled on about men. But you make the outfit look pretty cute, Miss Magician!
I can appreciate military women--they're always so very fit. Try not to wring my neck for my horrible pirate crimes.
Please don't hurt me, O fearsome woman soldier. I have a girlfriend waiting for me back home!
Looking pretty muscular, Miss Militia. Please try to see this beautiful pirate's point of view before sticking your knee in her back.
I imagine you're not too fond of my line of work, Miss Militia. It's OK--I'm pretty fond of that short blonde hair.
...You OK, honey? You look a little...dead.
...OK. So. You're a ghost. I can work with this...but please put down the knife.
Guess there's no stabbing you if things get hairy, is there? ...Not that I was planning on doing that to anyone else.
A...ghost. OK. Well, at least this means I can still annoy Meia if I get shot down and killed.
...Well, I do appreciate learning that there's an afterlife, but it's not why I came to Earth.
Omigosh, are you filming this? Look this way--over here! Get every angle you can!
You're broadcasting this? To a live audience? This is a dream come true--now all of Earth will witness my beauty!
Omigosh! Omigosh! You're broadcasting this to people all around Earth? Maybe I'll finally become a model!
You're filming this? Omigosh--normally I have to get Barnette to capture my beauty on camera! You're so sweet!
I hope you don't think that camera is going to scare me away. I may be a wanted criminal, but I'm also beautiful!
You picked a good table to film, honey. The only thing that loves me more than Barnette is a camera!
Ohoho. A martial artist, honey? Well, I can certainly see where all your momentum comes from.
With a figure like that, I imagine you've developed your own style of martial arts...centered around counterweights.
My, my! Those things outdo even mine, sweetie...but I don't pretend I'm some sort of athlete.
Bigger breasts and martial arts skill? Jeez, you're outmaneuvering me left and right. Good thing you're such a cutie!
Planet America, hm? Never heard of it--but it seems to have produced as least one knockout!
Britain, Japan, and now your America. I'm starting to think these aren't actually planets...and Earth people are just very splintered.

Oh, dear. Lazy eyes, and an unusual skin color...this must be an Earth experiment gone wrong, cast out into the streets. My apologies.
...Hello? Oh, I always get so uncomfortable around girls who're a bit...slow. And that's not a healthy pigment.
Desu this, desu that. I wonder what it means? I suppose it's a bit fun to say, but it feels so childish...
"Default-chan"? Well, I guess you have an excuse for not exactly stealing the spotlight! Desu.
You've got such sweet eyes, honey, and you're so overdressed! Are you just a bit intimidated by the tall pirate woman in black?
Now, why would such a cute young girl pile so much clothing on top of her body? If you're worried for your safety, I'm not the worst pirate around.
My, you're so feisty! And you're part of a biker gang, are you? It's like a pint-sized version of our own crew!
Hahahaha! Long blonde hair and a fighting spirit--it's nice to see an Earth girl leading a little pirate crew of her own, on bikes instead of Dreads!
And who might you be? A darling young girl with a lovely singing voice? If I'm in the presence of an Earth celebrity...you should be honored.
Oh, an idol? I loved seeing those cute singers onstage as a girl...how lucky that a celebrity gets to meet me.
Rock n' roll music has always been too much for me...it messes up my hair with all the vibrations and heat. Play somewhere else.
Oh, you're one of those punk rocker types, aren't you? Why would anyone want to listen to screaming? It gives me headaches.
Well. You've got a cute face, but a stocky, stubby body isn't exactly the feminine ideal, now is it?
Pfft. Well, I guess I shouldn't have expected Earth women to compare to Mejarian beauty, but...this is just embarrassing.
Oh, honey. I'm so used to having to steal the spotlight away from other gorgeous, slender women...this planet is just too easy.
Do Earth women really have to overcomplicate everything? That outfit is so conservative--and even that stick is decorated!
Well, I can't say you're not elegant, but don't you think you're wearing a little much? Earth girls can't even carry a stick without covering it.
...Erm...w-well, hello. Do you need something? You obviously can't play if you can't hold the cards.
...O-oh, ew. I'm sorry if you had some kind of accident...but you need arms to play, you know. Don't hang around and stare at us.
A-are you...a real animal? I thought you were some girl in a woolly suit, but...those are actual hooves! Ugh, don't touch me.
...Ew. Why is there a walking, talking sheep girl here? It's not a costume--I see dirt in her fur! Animals are so disgusting!
Hmph. You've got a pretty face and a shapely figure, but it's sullied by sloppy drinking and your sloppier speech.
I've been all across the galaxy with our lovely crew, and we've only encountered humans. Is this spiky-haired girl in sweatpants really the alien life we've missed?
H-hey, don't jerk me around, honey. I happen to be an experienced space traveler--you look like a runt in a tube top, not an alien.
"Leafy"...huh. I can't say I'm a fan of going that natural with fashion...maybe this is what happens when your whole planet has trees.
Ooh. A pretty face, voluptuous body, and long, vibrant locks--I have myself some competition. If only you were dressed nicer.
Hello there, Nami. You're the kind of feminine beauty I expect--gorgeous hair and a full bust. All you need is a dress.
Oh, do we have a wealthy heiress here? It's sad to watch your type spend so much money and still be outdone by natural beauty.
What do we have here? A runty blue-blood dressed in white, and a lowly pirate in a black dress she had to steal. At least I can fill mine out.
Well, what an adorable little girl, still in her school uniform! But everyone has something special about them, no? Don't keep yours a secret.
Misaka, yes? Oh, I remember my school uniform...and how I started to fill it out. What girlish secrets are you hiding?
...Ugh. I've only seen girls so chubby in movies, where men were fattening them up for slaughter. Men don't actually like that, right?
...My God, don't you have any respect for your own beauty? Munching down on junk food while your gut expands...is that what men like?
Ew. What compelled you to come here and display your gross, flabby, fatty body? Don't tell me men like women your size!
God, how can you even move around in all that heavy armor? You need to let your body express itself, with all its lovely curves.
You're going to hurt yourself lugging all that weight, you know. Women are too delicate to smash into each other like men do.
Well, hello there! Blonde hair and a black dress--I see my aesthetic exists on Earth. But you don't fill it out quite as well.
Hahahaha! Well, aren't you my mirror image, if a little smaller! I'm glad Earth appreciates long blonde hair and a longer black dress!
Oh, are you a model? I can believe it with those lovely legs--you should just hope your boss doesn't spot me!
Fortunately for you, Miss Model, I'm too busy fighting enemy forces to supplant you on the runway. Just watch your back.
Now, who's this darling little pipsqueak? She's even got a witch's hat to make herself look bigger! Oh, it's so adorable!
Run along now, little girl--we're playing an adult's game. I'm sure your parents are very proud of your Halloween costume.
Ohhh, you're so cute. I'd love to play this game with you when you're a bit older, honey. Still running around in costumes...
What a crass, shameless girl. You could do to tone down your libido a bit, honey--blondes get a bad rap sometimes.
Ugh, can't you stop swearing and talking about sex so bluntly? You're giving blondes a bad name...
...You know, Miss Angel, elegance is a woman's best trait. I hope I'm not lumped in with you as some oversexed blonde...
Ugh...is this behavior what men like? All that cursing and swearing and orgy nonsense...so unbefitting of blonde beauty.
O-oh my God, a real alien? Not a man, but an orange-skinned, floating, glowing-eyed woman! Are there others on this planet?
A-a real alien? You can't be serious! Y-you're even floating--has Earth been hogging all the alien species for itself? We've never seen any!
People often say I'm a wondrous woman myself. But I've never thought to make it such an on-the-nose nickname.
Sporty and competitve, hm? I always annoyed your type as a girl since I was athletic and shapely. And look at me now--a fighter pilot!
Are you sporty types so competitive because you're short? Women can hardly believe a girl of my size and beauty is a skilled pilot.
I hope I don't make you too envious, Shorty. The sporty types in school called me a brainless bimbo--but can they pilot a Dread?
Ugh. I'm glad Parfet's not so pushy about her beloved machines as you are...she'd probably chew me out for scratching my Dread.
Are machines all you care about? I never appreciated how our engineer just keeps to herself on these sorts of things...
Uh...well, hello, honey. You could've done to spruce yourself up a bit before coming here and stripping, you know.
...Ew. Would it have killed you to brush your hair first, honey? Or wash it? Or get some sleep?
Is this how low Earth's standards have fallen for feminine beauty? Why is an unwashed runt of a girl here playing strip poker?
Ugh, I was wondering what that smell was. Can't you put the least bit effort into your appearance? I feel insulted as a woman.
Butterflies are the only insect I like, with their lovely, colorful wings...why can't the rest do something besides crawl around?
Oh, butterflies...the one insect that understands the value of beauty. The others just disgust me...
I'm glad you're not a talking cockroach. Butterflies are the most beautiful, graceful insect, taking to the skies...just like me.
You're the nerdy computer type, yes? Even our chief engineer has a nice figure under her jumpsuit... Mejarians are so much more feminine.
I see computer fascination carries a certain stigma on Earth of a flat, petite little girl. Even the nerdy girls on Mejare are well-endowed.
Oh, dorky little schoolgirls like you just melt my heart! I remember my time in school, before I became a fearsome criminal...
You really ought to ditch those glasses and let your hair down, Amy. Part of being a woman is trading cute for sexy.
How charming--a young girl into music! Our crew has occasionally formed a makeshift choir--and I have solo parts, of course.
Er...well then. I see your spacefaring has left you a bit maimed. I've broken my arms before, but losing them...
Oh, God, I can't even imagine losing a limb. My beauty being left all asymmetrical...and yet I risk it every day. Broken arms, concussions...
Oh my God, is that an artificial limb? Not to say I've never sustained injuries as a pilot, but something so disfiguring...
I wonder if I should learn to bellydance myself. This dress does show my midriff, and I could use a bit more flexibility in my hips.
Ooh, I like the way your bellydancing unwinds your whole body. I should try it myself and loosen up my hips.
So what's this "Fairy Tail" guild all about? Our own Magno Family is a guild... crewed by the most beautiful pirates on Mejare.
Hahahaha! Oh, you're so adorable, Komi! You're not the first girl to be left speechless by my beauty!
Oh, you have the most adorably flustered expression, honey! It's OK, I don't bite--there's no shame in feeling a bit inferior.
Ohhh, it's OK to say something in my presence, Miss Komi. You're quite pretty yourself--you shouldn't expect to match me.
Hahahaha! Well, I've never left a girl so literally speechless! Don't feel bad, honey--my girlfriend's not as pretty as me, either!
My, what a business-focused girl. All about the mission, is it? My squadron leader is every bit the no-nonsense stoic type you are.
What mission could possibly bring you here to play strip poker? Honestly. My squadron leader is a killjoy like you.
I suppose you're bringing up your scar to prepare us all for it later? Ugh, if I had any scars on my forehead after what that mothership did to me...
Ugh, don't talk about scars, even if you'll be showing yours off later. Piloting is a constant risk to my beauty, and I've had several close calls...
...I don't suppose you can act out what it's like to have sex with a man, can you? That was my goal in coming here, you know.
It's alright, Miss Mime--I'll talk enough for the both of us. If you want to do me a favor, play a little man-on-woman charade.
Hey, honey, why're you so clammed up half the time? Fidgeting, eyes darting about--I'm not making you feel jealous, am I?
Oh, the telltale signs of a nervous, jealous girl. My beauty doesn't bite, honey--stop glancing around and stand up straight.
Oh, do we have another layered-up blue-blood? That's the kind of thing a woman wears when her legs and backside can't make the dress.
It doesn't speak much to your legs or your rear end if you wear a dress hiding both. Can we at least see your face, Miss Mansion?
U-ugh, what's this supposed to be? Some psychedelic light show from the bar? I feel a headache coming on just from looking at you...
Ugh, can someone tell the owner to stop with the creepy black strobe lights over there? I hear voices in my head whenever I look over there...
Oh, hello, Ochako! Are you a cheerleader at your school? I just couldn't bear to sit on the sidelines like that...
Girls in school always thought I had the body and charm of a cheerleader. But I'm a woman of action, despite my buxom figure.
Oh, are you a teacher? My schoolteachers were always nasty old ladies, warning us about men's fangs. I never did pay them much attention.
An Earth schoolteacher...young girls can be such a pain, can't they? I know I had a rebellious streak in school.
Hey, if you're a swordswoman like I've heard about, how come you didn't bring yours? What if you ran into a nasty space pirate and her rapier?
You're looking awfully unarmed for a supposed "swordswoman." You must just be a hobbyist--I carry my rapier everywhere, because it's seen battle.
Eugh, why's this little creep got a knife? And the look in her eyes is even sharper. Stay away from me!
Ew, what's your problem? What kind of security lets creepy mop-tops run around with knives? She's staring at me!
Oh, what have we here? Is royalty gracing us with her presence? You ought to move to Mejare where it's warm, Ice Princess--if you're OK with being a commoner.
This place sure seems popular with the upper-class types. And this one's from a wintery place? I'd hate to not be able to wear this dress.
Um...are you OK, honey? I don't how sick you have to be to turn gray. It's ruining that lovely dress you're wearing.
Is living on Earth really so stressful? You seem to have premature gray hair...and skin. At least your dress has color.
Oh, that's a nice dress. I figured I'd get the compliment out of the way to focus on your, uh...sickly skin color. Zombie, even.
I'm afraid you won't be squeezing any money from me, Miss Pursestrings. I'm not from this planet, you see...actually, can I see what Earth money looks like?
Whatever you're selling, honey, I can't buy it. I haven't even seen Earth money. We might have some Mejarian credits on the ship--how about we make a cultural exchange?
Oh, how cute, she's pretending to be a robot! I used to play that game when I was a girl, too. You need more beeps and boops to sell it!
Aren't you a little old to be playing robot? Well, I guess times change--we've got a navi robot on our ship who's playing human.
Oh, you are the most adorably shy little thing, Bernie! You're going to some fancy school, right? Who bullied you into being this way?
Who's this floofy-haired, shy little squirt? I hear you're a student at some hotshot academy, but it looks like the other girls pick on you, don't they?
Ugh. I hope you don't think that weird mask is charming. And why do you have a machete? Hey!
This place has its fair share of creeps, doesn't it? At least that mask lets us see where you're looking. And put that machete down!
H-hey, can someone escort this creepy machete girl out of here before she hurts someone? I'd do it myself, but she's all dirty.
What's that clunky codename about, anyway? "PA-15" sounds like something from my girlfriend's gun collection. Do you have a friend named Calico, too?
I guess "PA-15" is that gun you're carrying? I wonder if my girlfriend has one...I know she's got a Calico M-something. That's your sister's name, isn't it?
PA-15...why can't guns be given more elegant names? Barnette's always going on about her AUG, or SPAS, or Calico M950. Do you know a girl named Calico, honey?
Er...are you alright, honey? Honestly, I thought Celtic was enough of a head case with her bear costume, and here's an Earth girl in a box.
...I hope you don't think I'll just ignore the box thing. At least put some effort into your anti-germ costumes, or whatever this is about. A girl on our bridge team did that.
H-hey, don't think I didn't notice that portal business with you earlier. What are you, some kind of enemy?
Hey, you're the girl who came out of a glowing hole in space. Why's this little twerp got her own personal portals? Is that how Earth is transferring all its attack fleets?
Now, who's this adorable little thing? It looks like our magician girl's got a case of stage fright!
I hear you're a magician, honey--but you keep stumbling over your words. Unless you develop a better stage presence, you might want to focus on your other assets.
What a hyperactive young thing. I find you airhead types exhausting, whether it's you and your "SP Neptune games" or our trainee and her "aliens."
Can't you settle down a bit, honey? We've barely met, and every breath out of you is "Planet Neptune" and "video games." We have a trainee who's just as ditzy, except it's UFOs.
My God, are you really supposed to fight with all that metal wrapped around your waist? I wear a dress with a slit just to keep my legs free.
Don't you think you're a little overencumbered, General Princess? I could barely walk with all that armor clanging around on my hips.
...Well, whatever you are, I'll admit your creators had a good sense of beauty. That's a gorgeous dress, and I love the way your hair is done up.
I'm still not sure what you're supposed to be, but at least you know how to look good. I credit your creators for designing a statue-robot with such a lovely figure.
Whatever twisted experiments gave rise to you, at least they had the decency to place a nice face over top of it. Feminine beauty smooths over everything.
Seriously, honey, why the ridiculous outfit? A cape, an oversized hat--surely you could practice magic in something more suited for combat.
Not that I buy into this magic business just yet, but is there a reason you dress up in such a silly costume for it? You've got to think about combat practicality here.
Is it true there's a man in this adventure party of yours, Megumin? I don't suppose you've managed to make advances on him.
I didn't think I'd have much to learn from such a shrimpy girl, but apparently there's a male member of your little party. Do you happen to have any experience with him?
My, my, another blonde in a black dress. You could do with a hairbrush, though--and why are your teeth so sharp?
I was going to comment on royalty from this planet stealing my blonde-hair, black-dress look, but why are you all disheveled? And--are your teeth all jagged?
Is it true this Planeptune of yours doesn't have any men, either? I was starting to think little blue Mejare was the only female-only culture of its kind.
It's actually pretty encouraging to hear Mejare isn't the only planet that's done away with men. Your homeworld is the same way, right?
I keep hearing--well, seeing you bring up all these different crushes of yours. A man named Tadano, a girl named Manbagi? Just how did a mute get so popular?
Would you mind sorting out all these lovers of yours for us? Tadano, Manbagi--I wonder if I'd be as popular myself if I couldn't speak.
You've got a lot of lovers from what I can tell, Komi. A boy and a girl? That's impressive when you only have your looks--and your handwriting, I suppose.
Oh, Jessie, tell me about this little family of yours. How long have you been married? I don't know a lot of women who've settled down.
Our crew is so full of young girls--only our communications officer comes to mind as being married with children. What's it like for you?
You know, I'm actually pretty old myself compared to most girls on our crew, just for being out of my teens. But I feel young next to a woman in her married life! How is it?
Did you really have to be eating while we're playing? At least have some dignity--I can see crumbs on your cheek.
Ugh, are you just wearing a white shirt so we can't see the salt sprinkle onto it? How about you get food after the game?
Oh, good, we'll get to see even more fat on display. The least you could do is not shovel more fries in your face while it happens.
...Say, you wouldn't happen to know a girl called M1911, would you? Barnette's always dreamed of having one, from what I can pick up when she starts gushing.
So, does this little gun-cult of yours have an M1911, perhaps a girl giving them away? I know it's some antique my girlfriend wants--it'd make a nice birthday present.
As far as I'm concerned, you can ditch guns once they've served their duty. But my girlfriend has always gone on about some M1911 she wants. Is there a girl named after that?
You know, you're going to need to get over this little speech problem of yours eventually. It's cute in a schoolgirl, but I can't see you doing many jobs on our ship, for instance.
...You're really a lovely girl, Komi, and so smart. But romance isn't the only thing a speech issue will hold you back from. What could you even do on our ship, lift crates in reg?
Shouldn't your school have gotten you talking by your age? Imagine being a pirate--no one's going to wait for you to scrawl something down while an alarm's blaring.
...I don't mean to be rude, Komi, but your muteness is starting to lose its charm. Maybe your school wants you to work a desk job, but I didn't think I'd end up as a pirate, either.
On and on about these computer games of yours. Is this something the tech-girls got exposed to in school? My family signed me up for fencing.
I should ask Parfet in engineering if she played all these computer games you mention when she was a girl. I got pushed into fencing and other athletic things since I was tall.
I took a lot of fencing classes in school. Wealthy family and all that. I'm guessing you spent that time playing computer games?
I hear you're really very accomplished in your career, Cynthia. I'm a high-ranked pilot myself, but I still make time for romance. Isn't there a woman in your life?
You still look very beautiful, Miss, but I can tell you're getting older. You'd best find a girl to settle down with before you become one of these relics you study.
You can cover half your face, Miss Cynthia, but even your hair will gray soon enough. This champion business needs to take a backseat to finding a girlfriend.
All these abandoned caves you go exploring in, and you're forgetting the one between your legs. You should find a girl to go with you, like Barnette flies out with me.
So, Earth schools have their share of bookworms, too, do they? I never really hung out with those types. I was the big girl in the gym, for the most part.
You spend your schooltime in the library, I take it. I was usually pushed into sports on account of my size.
I was in school just a few years ago, and it feels like such distant memories. All the bookwork was just so dull--I don't know how you read so much.
...Well, if you're not hostile, then I'd hate to keep arguing with you. Did your creator include every piece of the female form?
I don't enjoy sniping at a beautiful woman, you know, even if she's a bit mechanical. Were you made to be beautiful...down to the last detail?
I've really never heard of these Pokmon things you raise, Miss Cynthia. They're little animals, right? Can you show me a cute one?
I'm glad even the animal trainers of this world know how to dress well. Do you have any cute "Pokmon" creatures I can come pet?
...Just so we're clear, you work in adult films? That's maybe more experience with men than I bargained for.
