...You're a pornographic actress, right, Miss Jessie? Just one of those men's rods must be enough on its own, but they're--what, passing you around?

state.text: Oh, no. Is Earth nothing but you crazy floating types? Don't you float over this way until you start acting friendly!
Oh, I'd hoped to meet some normal Earthlings, not another psychic one! So full of herself that she floats off the ground. What is with this planet?

case.state: I see blonde beauty is alive and well on this planet. That said, you could really stand to brush all that hair into something resembling a style.
Yang, right? You're very pretty, but you're doing your beautiful blonde hair a disservice--it looks like you've never even seen a brush.
How can you walk around with your hair in such a mess? Normally I wouldn't care, but when I see tussed-up blonde hair--well, I feel mine fraying from exposure.
Are you--made of slime? Ugh! That, or you're some flickering ghost of a girls' night gone wrong. What's the matter with you?
Ew, what are you supposed to be? Some kind of ghost girl? You look like you're all gooey, and who knows what's in all these drugs you're pushing!
We Mejarians need Dreads to shoot and fly around. I suppose Earth has a whole fleet of fighting robots, but nothing so human-looking. Are you really a machine?
If you're not just some girl playing robot, Penny, I'd love to see you in action. We don't have anything that advanced on Mejare.
Well, I didn't know we'd have an older woman joining us, and a very wealthy one, I hear. And if you're married to a man, that makes things doubly interesting.
I see this place welcomes women that are on the mature side, as well. You've got to tell me what it's like having a man in your home--quite the expensive home, I hear.
More runs like that, and you'd have a spot on our pilot team. You're always scouting for new recruits, right, Meia?
You've got the ferocity of Mejarian soldiers. Too bad I know how to handle them.
Hey, keep it up. Meia loves women that can put up a fight.
Don't give out on us now, dear! I was starting to come around on Earth women.
Good work, not getting all distracted by my beauty. Bit of a blow to the ego, though.
You had a streak going. You're one step closer to streaking yourself, though.
Nice little lucky run. Luck's a good trait in a pilot...and in a lover.
This Earth girl's got some skill, lasting so long. Do we have any piloting spots open, Meia?
What incredible poker skills to last so long. Only problem: this is strip poker, and the objective is to masturbate and have fun.
Yeah, yeah, ~name~, enjoy your little lucky poker runs. I'm going to roll over and think of my darling Barnette, fully at peace.
Nice job maintaining your poker face despite my little masturbation session. I've always worn my heart on my sleeve, and it's brought so many wonderful women into my life!
Streaks like that might earn you a spot on our crew. You know, if you could pull them off consistently, and knew how to pilot.
Would you like me to loan some layers? It looks like you're going to need them, honey.
Tough luck, ~name~. But any good woman bounces back from a loss or two!
Poor little Earth girl. Don't worry, I won't make fun of your body too much.
Back-to-back shots always sting the most.
I see the old Mejarian charm to starting to get to you.
Can't take your eyes off me, can you, ~name~? Especially with my sword out of the picture.
Rotten old Lady Luck is such a nasty mistress. I, however, can treat you right.
So many losses...want to talk about it? You're such a cutie.
I live in artificial gravity...so I can understand your situation, so to speak.
Put your back into it, ~name~. What self-respecting woman is no good at cards?
Come on, don't they have cards on Earth? It's Gascogne's favorite way to get to know you.
What's wrong? Have you realized how many trinkets I have and are just throwing in the towel?
Come on, ~name~, Mejarians like a challenge. What would the Earthlings back home think?
Don't let your jealousy just make you throw in the towel, ~name~. All women can be beautiful!
Hey, you can still win...against everyone but me.
Don't just drop the ball. A pilot demands excellence of herself at all times!
What kind of self-respecting woman drops the ball with her opponent so close to being shamed? Earth girls...
Trying to beat me to the punch with all the glorious reveals? Or did you just forget how cards work?
What's up, ~name~? Too preoccupied with thoughts of male tubes to focus on the cards?
I know Earth girls are scared of each others' bodies, but come on, don't you want to see me out of this dress?
Come on, ~name~. I expect a man to get all distracted by my breasts, but a woman should have better presence of mind!
You seem a little distracted, ~name~. Has something caught your eye?
Shall I move my hair aside for a better view, ~name~? You know, since you're staring at them instead of your cards anyway.
I hope you're distracted by my breasts out of lust rather than jealousy. Envy makes your body ugly to match your heart.
It's OK to stare, ~name~--I'm very beautiful. Sure you don't want to pay more attention to the cards, though?
I have lots of secret weapons. My Vandread, my breasts...and my fabulous golden hair.
Thought I was all out of tricks? I'm out of interest, but not tricks.
I just knew flipping my hair back would finally draw your eye. Leave these foul Earth men behind and be with women!
Oh, ~name~, you're embarrassing me with your lustful gazes. Earth women don't love each other the way Mejarians do!
What's with this sudden spell of losses, ~name~? Could it be...you're feeling a certain attraction you hadn't before?
Ah, a wandering eye and a miserable poker streak. Classic signs of a woman in love.
I know that lustful, distracted look, ~name~...it's the same one Barnette and I gave each other when we first met.
Ready to join me, ~name~? Women are always better off sticking together in this big universe of ours.
You're stripping so fast, ~name~! I like women's bodies...and I don't think I can keep up with this!
Don't get complacent, now! A Mejarian leaves her mark on a scene long after she leaves.
Tsk, tsk. The Mejarian woman finishes, and the Earth woman thinks it's safe to play it fast and loose.
Was it worth it, ~name~? Wasting all this effort trying to win, when I'm the one who's relaxed and comfortable now?
And it all comes tumbling down. If it's not life-or-death--why worry so much about winning in the first place?
Looks like Earth girls have some fight in them after all. But of course, the Mejarian is still on top.
Pretty good streak, ~name~. Fancy using some of that luck to beat me for a change?
We have ourselves a loser! But you did hold out for a while.
Nice little run, ~name~. Let's see if you've got smarts down the stretch.
Couldn't hold out against Mejarian wits forever, could you?
Just when you needed your streak most.
Hey, don't give up, ~name~. I don't like women who just roll over and take the abuse.
Quite the poker face you were running. You'd make those stonefaces on Anpathos proud.
More runs like that, and you'd have a spot on our pilot team. Meia's always scouting out recruits, you know.
You've got the ferocity of Mejarian soldiers. Too bad I know how to handle them.
Hey, keep it up. And if you see her, Meia loves women that can put up a fight.
Don't give out on us now, dear! I was starting to come around on Earth women.
Can't get complacent, ~name~. I've got quite a few layers left.
Nothing like breaking those streaks. Stun the enemy and go for the kill!
Not feeling so confident anymore? Women have to keep their composure if they want to keep up with those bestial men.
Don't let the loss of your streak rattle you, dear. Got to grab Lady Luck by the arm and twist!
For a second there, I thought I'd actually lose to an Earth woman. But you just couldn't keep it together.
Yeah, yeah. We always outlast your little Harvest-bots, too, so no surprise.
Don't you want to see me show off the good stuff? Well then, I hope you have another streak like that left in you!
Oh, ~name~? That lucky run wasn't lucky enough. Too bad!
Keep it up. I like women with a little fight in them...like Barnette.
Good work, not getting all distracted by my beauty. Bit of a blow to the ego, though.
You had a streak going. You're one step closer to streaking yourself, though.
Nice little lucky run. Luck's a good trait in a pilot...and in a lover.
If Meia were here, she'd be going on and on about your impressive strategical skill. You'd have to get her naked enough to loosen up, though.
Just couldn't keep your streak together when I'm like this? Yeah, I understand. Just take it easy and ogle away!
Finally broke that lucky run with my exquisite figure. Now do you understand the appeal of your own sex?
Knew I'd finally distract you long enough to lose. If you think I'm beautiful, there's a whole pirate crew full of women almost as gorgeous...
Don't fight your lust, ~name~. I know that look in a woman's eye...a burgeoning love of curves and smoothness.
Broke your focus, did I? Maybe a little? Come on, ~name~, stroke my ego here.
I can't fault a lucky run. Every victory over the Harvest we have takes some luck in the end...and a whole lot of love.
You go, girlie. Keep up those winning streaks, since you're so obsessed with winning for some reason.
You've got more fighting spirit down the stretch than I do. Me, a pirate! I can't help but root for you a little.
What incredible poker skills to last so long. Only problem: this is strip poker, and the objective is to masturbate and have fun.
Yeah, yeah, ~name~, enjoy your little lucky poker runs. I'm going to roll over and think of my darling Barnette, fully at peace.
Nice job maintaining your poker face despite my little masturbation session. I've always worn my heart on my sleeve, and it's brought so many wonderful women into my life!
Streaks like that would probably impress Meia. She's utterly convinced you can win this game consistently because Gascogne keeps psyching her out.
Streaks like that might earn you a spot on our crew. You know, if you could pull them off consistently, and knew how to pilot.
I won with that? This is going to be a breeze.
I know damn well I shouldn't have won with that...you Earth people are never gonna see me naked.
Oh, wow. A high card is enough to beat you people? You'd better enjoy the way I look now.
...Yeah, listen. I've got more layers than it seems, so you'd better hope me winning with a high card was a fluke.
Thanks for getting me out of that jam, sweetheart. Here's a little leg for your trouble.
Close shave for me. Thanks for taking the hit, honey.
Too close for comfort. But now I'm quite comfortable...too bad for you.
Seems you can always count on Earthlings to screw up their cards worse than you did.
That was a high card I had, so you really did me a favor, darling.
Did I ever tell you how sweet I've found Earthlings to be? Going and losing for me when I had such a bad hand...
Hah! And I had a high card. Dealer, you're just messing with me.
Yeah, yeah, I'll get started--wait, I didn't lose? I had a high card!
Damn it, I--wait, how did someone have worse than me? Oh, wow.
...I'm just not sure what to make of you anymore, Dealer. You give me trash, and the rest of them burning trash.
You just pissed away your best chance to get me out of my dress...or did you?
To think that for a second there, I was actually worried...actually, I shouldn't have been regardless.
Damn, do I have any accessories left? ...Wait, I won?
Good thing I still have my ch--wait, what?
Bad news, ~name~...that was the best chance you had for getting me out of this thing! Did you see my hand?
Oh, my! You threw the hand to let me keep my modesty? You are just the sweetest thing, ~name~!
Just when I thought the dress had to go, ~name~ comes to my rescue. You're so sweet!
The moment you've all been waiting f--oh. Well, uh, I won, but I guess I spoiled how I'm down to my dress now.
It's sweet of you to be saving me from my awful high-card hands, ~name~, but it's too little, too late.
Good to know someone on this table is still looking out for me, as I stand here in just my tiny thong.
I'd call you stupid for losing to my high card, but you did get me out of my dress...so it was probably a fluke.
Oh, ~name~...you saved me from removing my thong, but as you can see, my modesty is already in tatters.
Winning with a high card is certainly more reassuring than this tiny bit of fabric I've got around my hips.
Hoo...my life flashed before my eyes for a moment there. My sex life, that is.
I was actually worried for a second there. But then I remembered I could actually stand to relieve some tension...and now I'm all pent-up.
All I had was a high card...but apparently it was high enough.
Come on, all I had was a high card! Aren't you going to finish me off, ~name~?
Come on, ~name~, you can do better than that.
And a layer comes off! How exciting.
Just what could Earth women be hiding? The battle scars of having sex with men?
Now you've got me trying to count how many layers all my crewmates wear.
Don't make me mad, dear. I do have a rapier.
Get to it, girlie. I haven't got all day.
Wasn't even trying.
I mean, I'm a pilot. This is hardly a demanding mental task.
Too easy, ~name~. Take it off.
Sword or not, I still pack a wallop.
Expect more losses, ~name~. We Mejarians are clever women.
There's more where that came from. I've handled Mejarian soldiers, you know.
Don't get nervous, ~name~. I know, I'm tall, beautiful, and intelligent.
Oh, good. Fashion tips and more time to think about how many pieces my outfit is.
Something got you down, ~name~? Chin up.
I'm trying to picture what my crewmates' outfits consist of, but they're not always easy to undress by sight.
Just stay cool and collected, ~name~. That's how the Anpathos women were--right up to their spines being harvested.
It's not your fault. Just blame Lady Luck, that miserable old hag.
Never mind the cards, ~name~--think of my body, and you'll be more beautiful.
Look this way while you do it, ~name~. I won't judge...not out loud, anyway.
Hey, ~name~. Might be weird to you, but I grew up learning to love women...
Hey, if you find yourself up against Meia, watch out--that zipper's in front.
Just luck, all luck. No use getting all bent out of shape in this game.
Look this way while you do it, ~name~. I won't judge...not out loud, anyway.
Hey, ~name~. Might be weird to you, but I grew up learning to love women...
Just luck, all luck. No use getting all bent out of shape in this game.
Hey hey, ~name~. Your turn, and make it count while you're at it.
Don't be jealous, ~name~. You're beautiful, too!
Now, now, ~name~. Don't get yourself down by comparing your body to mine. I'm a once-in-a-generation woman.
Meia would be a lot more comfortable in that suit of hers if she ditched the underwear...or at least tried mine instead.
Now, now, don't let your jealousy distract you from the game, ~name~.
Trying to match me, ~name~? It's a little late for you to make a splash.
You really should have stripped naked before me if you wanted to shock people.
Being nude is more fun. Don't tell me Earth girls are big prudes or something.
So common of a sight for me. But I can still masturbate to it just fine.
As mundane as this is to a Mejarian, you're pretty enough for me to work with it.
Keep on losing, ~name~. This is much more fun.
Your turn, ~name~, and my benefit.
I understand, ~name~. You saw what my fingers could do and wanted to skip to the fun.
That's it, honey. Forget this silly card game and get to the real fun.
What a warm feeling...like Christmas with my Barnette.
What's a Mejarian to do, all tapped out like this while Earth women lord over you with their poker skills?
Ahahaha! This is fun! Come on, let's not keep these poor Earthlings waiting!
Oh, wow. All my talk about inferior Earthlings, and we go and prove it--look at the two Mejarians just toy with each other!
Hmph. I bet we'd draw in a dogfight, too--you underestimate how close I am to you.
...This really is just a game for Mejarians, isn't it? A tie...
Oho. A tie to punctuate our little friendly showdown. You really are tough to beat, Meia.
...Is that a tie? Let it never be said that you're easy to put down, Meia--but that's why you're our leader.
My, my. Who better to tie with you, Meia? I keep you sharp in piloting, too--becuase we're best friends.
A--a tie? This showdown is getting to be too much for me...
Oho. We might as well be in a clash of Dreads, tying in a showdown like this--but I'd win that no problem.
Ooh, a tie. It's almost romantic, isn't it? Just the two of us, locked in a climactic struggle...
Well, what'll it be--huh? Wow...I wasn't sure ties could even happen in poker, and there it goes in a one-on-one.
...What happened? Shouldn't someone be--what do you mean, a tie?
Well, isn't this an interesting turn of events? A tie...
A tie? Even in all my games with Meia, that's never happened--truly, this is a monumental night.
Well, now! You don't see a tie every day--what a perfect way to mark the visit to Earth of Mejare's crown jewel.
...Oh, is there a rule for a tie? It seems like they'd be awfully rare--perhaps we should all strip in celebration.
...Hello? What's the holdup? ...Oh, a tie. Big deal...
...Oh, ties are super rare, aren't they? Well, it's hard to care when you're not even playing...
...Well, don't I look foolish? All that talk about being a rare beauty, and I'm out by the time a rare tie comes along...
Oh, just get on with it. Everyone should strip if it's a tie--what do I care at this point?
...Wait, one of you is a man? But--you--I...wow.
...Wait, I'm confused. Men and women don't look that close. Are you sure you're a man?
...Oh. I really thought I was getting good at telling men and women apart...
...Wait, you're a man? I mean, Duero wears his hair long, and Meia's is short, so I don't assume anything there...
...Are you sure, Meia? I mean, B.C. fooled you, too.
...Wait, really? Well, wouldn't be the first time, although poor Corrin here seems to have fooled us by accident.
...Uh...good eye, Meia. Well, this is awkward. Sorry, Miss--Mister. You're still pretty cute...for a man.
...Meia, don't mess with me. Are you sure? I mean, look at her--him.
And how would you put it? An adventurous rogue, or just a lowly bandit?
What's this "Matt" look like? Do you think he'd have any objections to making a baby with me?
Well, I'm just frustrated. I've been searching for a man who might impregnate me, and we barely meet any in the first place.
...Really? You should, uh... probably sort that out first. I'd rather chat with someone who knows the planet they're on.
...What? This doesn't seem like the kind of place you stumble into and then stay in. If you're just making fun of me, I really do want to learn about this planet.
Oh, I see. It's thin enough to see through, and you just like messing with people?
Ah, I see--it's thin fabric. Men and their deceitful ways, thinking they could pull one over on me!
Could've fooled me, with that hand you were rocking. Still, I guess the fabric's thin enough to see, and you just like playing pretend.
So you're just a fan of the dungeon look, and the blindfold's thin enough to see through? Nice try fooling Jura Basil Elden.
There you go. Fully sighted like the rest of us! I don't buy that nonsense about it being a visor...can I see it?
If that thing's really a visor, toss it over here. If you get to cheat, why can't I see how?
You're not afraid to let a simple human woman see what advantages you had, right? Give it here.
I'm calling your bluff on that thing being a visor. I think you're some weird fetish-man who's been peeking at the cards underneath it. Can I see?
Something the matter, Mr. Muscle? You look so dreadfully uncomfortable.
Am I being distracting, Mr. Muscle? Well, you're guilty of it yourself, with that hunky body of yours.
Am I drawing your eyes, honey? Well you started it--how can I not stare at all those muscles of yours?
See something you like, dearie? You seem so uncomfortable around women for an Earth man--I guess you've never seen one like me!
...Wait, you're a man? Aren't men...tall? And, you know, masculine?
...Oh, you're a man. Well, that's disappointing. What's the word for this? Han-droggo-niss or something?
...Huh. You're a man. I guess I can work with this, but wow. You really had me fooled...
...Oh. Well, this wouldn't be the first time a man fooled me into thinking he's a woman, but that was on purpose...
Oh, weapons count, do they? You've just given me an excellent idea, Handsome.
Nice sword you've got there, Trigger Finger. Even better, it's revealed to me what counts as "clothing" in this place.
Do weapons really count? That seems too easy...but I guess this place plays fast and loose with the rules. Interesting...
Would you look at that? Jin is very kindly setting the precedent for weapons counting. I'll keep that in mind.
Eep! I--I thought men liked having sex! And w-what's the flashing about?
...You're not into it? I thought men loved women's attention here--w-why are you flashing?
Ohhhh, you too? Why can't I get a man to like me? I thought Earth men were all over women--oh, and now he's putting on a light show!

state.text: What? Aren't men into that sort of thing? I wouldn't--eek! D-don't--flash at me! What happened?

case.state: Of course you are, sweetie. Have you considered that might not be the right career choice for a shorty like you?
Oh, dear, are you serious? No wonder a gang of pirates can fend off Earth's assaults--its soldiers are pint-sized scaredy-cats.
And quite a coddled soldier at that, clearly. Hey, I'm a pirate--and that's because I'm a big girl, Mr. Shorty.
Are you sure about that, honey? I've seen bigger, buffer men than you running around--you're better off as a woman's plaything.
Hmm...I never thought about what to actually ask. Well, Mr. Angel, what do you like in your women?
Ooh, thanks for the opportunity. Well, then--since I have a tiny little man in front of me, how do you like your girls, dear?
Oh, Pit, you're so sweet! You know, I have a hard time seducing men--what're the traits a woman should have, would you say?
Oh, a question? Well, you're a man, so what kind of woman do you like, hm? What makes that tube of yours stand up?
Oho. So when I take off my sword, it's a lame first impression. But not lame enough to not copy.
Oh. Mm-hm. Taking off your weapon--I wonder where he got that idea?
I didn't realize men were such fabulous hypocrites, Trigger Finger. But at least you're not too scared to be disarmed around me.
Removing a sword, eh? And here I thought men were the honorable sex. But no, you're content to emulate what you criticize.
I'm just teasing you. I'm sure you'll prove quite an interesting male specimen...oh, is the mask coming off already?
I see you're the type to take every little comment to heart! A sensitive man is a fascinating one--hey, are you dropping the mask so soon?
You really think so? But women always like it when I flirt with them!
Seriously? Men are a strange species. Girls love it when I come over and play around!
Men don't like being teased so much? But I always tease girls! What am I supposed to do, just wait around for them?
What, so I just have to wait for a man to tease me? That's boring! Women always like it when I approach them!
Come on, ~name~, where's that male bravery I always hear about?
For shame. Little old Hibiki's got a bigger spine than you, ~name~.
That's all you've got for me? So much for the courage of men.
Wow, really? Men wear that? What, to keep lecherous women at bay?
Wouldn't you rather take off something exciting? It'd certainly excite me.
How could a man be boring to me? Just do some jumping jacks, I'll learn something.
You're so boring, ~name~. The three men in my life are much more exciting.
You've still got all that left? Guess I'll have to get creative.
Trinkets on a man? Like a license plate on my Dread.
A man dolling himself up is so cute. Leave that to women--we're more beautiful.
Is this revenge for my accessories? Well, I hope you have some more.
Can I still complain about this? For now...yes.
Exactly what I deserve, I guess...
Are you still going on with your little trinkets?
Come on, I'm actually excited to see your body, ~name~.
Still removing trinkets? Hey Dealer, how about you and I hold this man down and strip him some more?
Oh, give me a break already.
I'm sure Tarak's proud of your devotion to strategy.
Men wear that? Really? Is it for your job or something?
Definitely have no right to complain now. Except that I'm from a planet of all women and I'm very curious about you.
Never thought a man would doll himself up this much. Bad time to learn that.
Hey, ~name~, if you want an accessory, take my thong. Covers about as much.
Ugh! Even now, you won't show me something good?
I can't believe men can even count as high as the layers you have.
Oh, give it a rest!
You're such a pain, ~name~. Is it too much to ask for to see your tube? Maybe collect some seed while I'm at it?
I was planning on seeing a man's tube...I was not planning on men being any good at cards.
I don't need to come back to this place. Maybe I'll just show you what I can do with that rapier.
Oh, come on! Let me see something good! I'm sorry I teased you!
Really? You won't let me see your tube, even when I'm like this?
...Unyielding to the end. Lighten up, for goodness' sake.
...Should I spread my legs wider or something?
Honestly. I knew men were stupid, but boring, too?
I think I'm just gonna leave. Even after all that, the men still don't want to show me any tubes.
What is with Earth men? I thought the sight of a nude woman just turned you into raging beasts.
Oh, the indignity of it all, being humiliated by a man this way. Awful!
Ohhh, you're no fun, Nayru! You convinced him not to take more off! I want to learn about men!
Can't you pipe down? I'm trying to seduce men here to learn about them, and you're telling them to be smart!
Hey, this is my one big chance to see a man's tube! Why'd you have to go and tell him not go slow, Nayru?
Buzz off, would you, Songstress? It's not exactly easy for a Mejarian to seduce a man, and I have a lot to learn about them!
...~player~, you're making me look bad in front of Nayru. Couldn't you have taken off something bigger?
...Well, I know I started with little things, but I was supposed to be seducing you, ~player~. Now Nayru's making fun of me.
...Oh, come on, ~player~! I mean, I started small, but now Nayru's teasing me!
Well, that's a blow to the ego. Men aren't so easily seduced, just as Nayru here claims...or you're mad about my accessories.
So why do you two look the same? ...You're the same person? But--how's that possible?
W-wait, you're the male version of her? Where's the male version of me? I bet he's handsome!
Oh, wow, you're the same person, but the opposite sex? Where's the male me? Tall, gorgeous--and blond!
T-this is really incredible. Are there male versions of every woman I know? I wonder if male Barnette is handsome...
Hmph. I hope I'm not still stuck being a lowly pirate fifteen years from now. I have to start my modeling career while I'm young!
"Mira"? ...Oh, right, men marry women on this planet. My girlfriend is the clingy jealous type, too.
That won't work--I can get my girlfriend to donate an egg whenever I want. You see, if I have a baby with a man the natural way, I'll be famous on my homeworld!
...Hank? The su--I saw this planet's sun on my way here. I don't appreciate being made a fool of, you know!
Who--what are you talking about? This planet's sun looked perfectly healthy from orbit. Stop talking in your little friends' lingo and help me out here!
Hey, what that supposed to mean, Gearbox? What Barnette and I do in private is none of your business.
Oh, please. I'm the giver in my relationship...Barnette would get to wear the blindfold.
Oho! And Little Dungeon Bot shows some spunk. You're getting more human all the time...maybe we could use that blindfold.
Ha! About time you manned up and talked back to me. But to be honest, Barnette's usually wearing the blindfold.
Well then, don't think I won't tease you! It'll just be in a different sort of way...
A man who looks like a woman might be exactly the kind of seed I need...wouldn't want my children all hairy and gross.
OK. Well, nothing I can't work with! Now you're cute in a completely different sort of way, Mister Corrin.
Don't feel too bad about it, then. Women's bodies are so much smoother and luscious anyway...you should strive to emulate us.
..."Stand"? I have a Dread ship, not...whatever that was. Come on, don't scare me like that!
"Stand"? Hey, who's the one saying nonsense now? I flirt a little and you start scaring me!
I'm a woman on a faraway planet, and you start yelling at me and making light flashes! I don't know any "Stands"!
..."Stand"? "Possess"? Hey, I know you don't like me, but that was freaky, Jotaro! What are you on about?
We'll see if you can keep that up against Mejare's finest.
Well, since you're not being interesting with your stripping...ever slept with a woman?
I think there's quite a lot you could teach me about men tonight, ~name~. Consider yourself a fine male specimen?
You could be very enlightening for me, ~name~...but not with stuff like that.
Makes sense, I guess. Men from Tarak don't know how to have fun, either.
If only Duero were here. He could help treat your no-fun-itis.
Is that some kind of rank insignia?
A man wearing accessories...you're just trying to make me curious, aren't you?
Slow down there, ~name~. Your manly accessories might push me over the edge.
You're a regular Bart for this sense of fashion. He dressed as a woman once.
Stripping decisions like this should be punished. You know what to do, Dealer.
Funny. I consider men accessories.
I knew Tarakkians were no fun, but you'd think an Earth man would be. Sheesh.
I should've played this with Duero instead. He's handsomer and doesn't wear much.
So, uh, is this because of the game, or do men actually wear that on Earth?
Guess living around women doesn't loosen Earth men up at all.
What is it with men and accessories? Women love fashion, men love...military badges?
Hey, B.C. has a lot of trinkets...but for some very good reasons.
Be glad I don't still have my sword, ~name~. I'm feeling a little incensed.
What's a Mejarian to do with an uncooperative man? Try to sway him with a little skin? Or just gobble him up and be done with it?
I wonder if Hibiki would count his dogtag. Why's he got that thing, anyway?
How could a man manage to bore me? I know, like, three of them.
Men can grow hair on their faces, right? Why would you ever want that?
This isn't fun anymore. Now I'm just a bimbo who got outwitted by a man.
Ah, jeez. The men I know are from Tarak, and they'd still throw me a bone.
You would think living around women would teach Earth men how to have fun. But no, apparently not.
Wouldn't you rather strip nude and masturbate to me? I mean, really.
Men really are competitive. I'm right here, who cares about the cards anymore?
It's nothing but competition with you men, honestly. Work together for once.
This is more annoying than when Pyoro is talking but doesn't want my opinion.
Men can be so cruel. I'm at my most vulnerable, you know...
Let me see your tube already. Look how much I'm showing you!
Guess I should've taken this game seriously if I wanted to see any men's secrets.
Never thought I'd get outplayed by a man this badly. I figured you didn't know what cards were.
I mean, come on, ~name~. You think I teased you like that to watch you remove your ~clothing~?
I don't give a damn about men's fashion. Let me see your body already!
Ugh, men are the worst.
Hey, listen, ~name~. I know a doctor who's more handsome and wears less. So get stripping.
Heeheehee! I see right through your embarrassment, Chun! You two make a cute couple, being so polar-opposite!
Oh, you don't have to deny it, darling! Juri is so intense, and you're so serious! Opposites attract.
Don't feel bad about your old flames, honey! Barnette's much more serious than I am, too--opposites attract!
I know a thing or two about womanly love, Miss Li, and there's no reason for embarrassment. Girls are always drawn to those unlike them!
M-Meia? What's this all about, taking your eyepiece off? Is it because the sweater girl is looking at you?
H-hey, what's going on? The Meia I know doesn't part with her eyepiece so quickly! Is Haru staring at you? Should I go threaten her?
Hey, Miss Sweater-stock, what are you staring at--M-Meia? Your eyepiece, so quickly?
...L-Leader? There's no need for that...h-hey, Sweater-skirt, don't stare at her!
Ooh, and she's into it! Meia, we can't take a woman-loving Earth girl lightly!
Look at that, she's a fun-loving drinking type. And an Earth woman who's into girls is not a given.
Ooh, a party animal! A cute blue-haired Earth girl who understands womanly love? You two are soulmates!
I honestly didn't think Earth girls appreciated each other at all. Good on you, Sei--and since opposites attract, you're a good fit for sourpuss here.
It's a miracle that we even found a cute Earth girl who's into women. Sei, you're the perfect sugar for Meia's ice!
Well, she's definitely a little miserable, but soldiers strike a nerve with her. And Meia, don't be so vindictive!
Oh, you are impossible! I'm sorry, Sei, she's usually not this wound up. It's because you're military.
Oh, you being military personnel definitely switched her from cold to acidic, honey. Seriously, Meia, give her a chance.
I'm telling you, Leader, you'd be a lot happier if you weren't so judgmental! It's because you're a soldier, Sei--she's normally just icy.
We're pirates, Sei, darling, so none of us like the military. Meia just holds onto grudges...sourpuss.
Hey, what's with the stereotyping? I've met fun-loving blue-haired girls--you're just not one of them.
I'm sure there's a blonde out there somewhere that's as miserable as you, Leader. You can have miserable babies together and die bored.
Ooh, I never took Meia Gisborn for a bigot, stereotyping blondes. Besides, I'm not going to pretend friendliness is a bad thing.
I think it's great Yang is so friendly! You could stand to learn a thing or two from us boisterous, fun-loving blondes.
M-Meia? Oh, come on, not the eyepiece! Now you're just making it look like I hate you in front of Zizou!
Wha--hey, I didn't tell you to remove your eyepiece! I have plenty of respect for you--you're making this worse on yourself!
Just because I'm fun doesn't mean I don't respect you. Come on, keep your eyepiece on!
Oh, don't start with the eyepiece just to make it look like I'm torturing you! I respect you! You could've told me no!
W-what? I don't even know what that means! You look fine! Besides the smoking...and the tattoo.
Uh...w-well, you might look cuter in a dress, but you're not ugly! Stop assuming the worst all the time!
Oh, low self-esteem, hm? I don't know what you just called yourself, honey, but you'd be much cuter if you weren't always grimacing.
...Women are a lot cuter when they smile, Revy. That goes for you, too, Meia, by the way.
See? I say one thing, and now you're blowing up again! You're cute--it's your personality that's ugly.
Heeheehee! Oh, you're hopelessly in love now! This is so cute!
I knew we'd meet a girl here who was your type--and with all these hormones flowing, you'd have to break your stoicism eventually.
Do you hear that, Chunners? It's the sound of ice melting nearby. You've lit a fire in her heart.
Go on, Meia, ask her out. You both know how an exercise session is going to end.
Of course she does, honey! She just refuses to show it, which is why I drag her to places like this. She only ever smiles with Ezra's baby.
Why do you think I brought her here, Miss Polka-dot? You need steam to melt all that ice of hers...or a baby.
Oh, my Leader is an absolute sweetheart, Miss Accent. You should see her with Ezra's little baby!
Meia's the sweetest girl you'll ever meet, Miss Ladybug...but she only shows it when she's making our crewmate's baby laugh.
Meia just doesn't like crowds or strangers, that's all. She thinks she's got to be all dignified. But see how she acts with a baby!
Y-your eyepiece? ...Hey, Glasses Girl, leave her alone!
Eek! Y-your eyepiece? ...Hey, listen up, Four-eyes, don't tease Meia about her eyepiece!
...You're taking your eyepiece off? ...Oh, ignore Daria, Leader, she's just being rude as usual.
Y-your eyepiece? You don't have to, Meia! ...Zip it, you little four-eyed squirt! That thing means a lot to her!
M-Meia? You're taking that off? Is it because there's a man here?
Wha--what's this all about? Your eyepiece? Don't take off your eyepiece because this man might make fun of you!
...Is this because there's a man around? Come on, Meia, don't take that off if you don't want to!
Your eyepiece? Oh, don't do that, Meia, you're making me feel bad! Are you letting the man here mess with your head?
U-uh...please don't start fighting. You two are cute together.
Oh, here we go. You made her mad. You two would make such a cute couple, and you ruined it!
Oh, perfect, now she's angry. You could've landed yourself an adorable girlfriend, but no, it's a matter of principle.
...Meia, if you leave this place with a broken nose instead of a cute girlfriend, I'm telling the captain.
P-please don't hit me. Or Meia. I know she's rude, but you two are so c-cute...
Ah, youthful ignorance. Everyone gets hit eventually, darling--like you are right now.
Am I wrong, or have you been getting hit this entire time? You might have all your clothes on with a shield or two.
I think your current dodging performance is providing some evidence against your strategy, dear. Life's all about taking hits, not dodging them.
Says the girl who's been taking shells head-on more and more. Lots of rookie pilots think they'll never get hit--then they panic when they do.
Oh, Shimakaze...so naive. You're getting hit right now! Hey, Meia, you like speed, too--take a look where it gets you.
You opulent types are always so defensive. You can make fun of my dress if you want--I have self-esteem!
Figures Princess would get all huffy when I make fun! Surely you have something mean to say about my wardrobe.
All that money, and yet such thin skin. You won't see a pirate like myself get so defensive about her clothing.
Ohhh, Weiss, don't be so indignant! You're a lot cuter when you're happy--come on, you can poke fun at my dress.
You going to throw up, sweetie? Looks like it...well, don't face me when it happens.
Can we get a janitor over here? This girl's about to pee herself.
Jeez, this girl's gonna spend the evening sobbing. Can't we just tell her to leave?
You're no fun. You're such a head case that I can't even tease you.
...Well, that's one down.
...I really thought Earth girls handled men better than anyone. I wanted to see her naked, too.
...That girl really needed some time on Mejare to toughen her up. Men are giant pushovers.
Sigh...I should've known we wouldn't all make it through this without someone bailing.
Well, I mean, if anyone was going to chicken out, it was going to be her.
Oh, dear. It seems I've been wooed by a siren, who's come to steal my beauty away from Barnette.
Shut every eye? I never thought you'd try to seduce me, darling! You're so disarmingly pretty--and my girlfriend's armed.
Oh, my. The forest songstress has lured me into her little trap--now she's going to put me asleep and ravish me, unbeknownst to Barnette dearest.
Are you sure you want to put me to sleep, Nayru? Try anything funny, and my girlfriend will get violent!
...You just made that whole Oracle business up to get me interested, didn't you?
...Oh. Well, thanks for nothing. Can't you predict someone else's, just so I know you're not lying to me?
...Spectacular. Really. Truly you're an Oracle for the ages.
...I could've said that. You know, when I talk about my piloting skills, I can actually back it up.
...That's a little vague, don't you think? I was hoping you could get it down to the color of the flowers.
...Hm. So they're those kinds of predictions. I could've said something that vague myself, Nayru.
Hey, I asked for my future, not my horoscope. Trust me, I spend a lot of time in space, and the stars are just as vague as you're being.
...That's it? Come on, honey, I thought you were cute, and you're holding out on me! What's a good place to steal wedding dresses?
...I wanted details, Nayru. I already know we'll go through challenges--we do that for a living. We fell in love in an asteroid field!
Really? Oh, I was worried we were moving too fast! Soon I'll be a Fama--what does our daughter look like?
Ooh, are you sure? Any more details? What's she look like in her dress? How do our kids look? I can't wait to have a daughter!
Perfect! I'll propose tomorrow--she'll be so excited! Oh, what'll our little girl look like?
Ohhh, that's great! I'm always afraid we'll get into a fight--how do our daughters look? Beautiful?
W-what? That doesn't sound good! I could die any given battle, you know!
What? What kind of answer is that? You know what a bad future could be to me? Getting shot down!
...I--uh--that bad? Is one of us going to die? Because that's what a bad future is to a pilot!
What? Why'd you get all evasive? You think we garden for a living? You don't just tell a pilot her future is bad!
W-what? What's a dyke? Why are you so mad?
Eek! I--I, uh...what's a dyke? Among other questions.
...Dyke? What's that mean? Other than something rude, judging by your tone.
...I don't know what dyke means. Besides being an insult. And what's with the attitude?
W-what? I don't even know what that means! You look fine! Besides the smoking...and the tattoo.
Uh...w-well, you might look cuter in a dress, but you're not ugly! Stop assuming the worst all the time!
Oh, low self-esteem, hm? I don't know what you just called yourself, honey, but you'd be much cuter if you weren't always grimacing.
...I tell Meia all the time she's much cuter when she smiles, Revy. I think that advice could go a long way for you, too.
See? I say one thing, and now you're blowing up again! You're cute--it's your personality that's ugly.
Oh, don't get yourself down about it. Maybe you need a girlfriend--Barnette's serious and handles guns, and I love her.
Clearly you need the woman's touch for a confidence boost. After all, Barnette's a gun nut--and she has me!
Revy, dear, men are overrated! Be with a woman instead--a dead-serious gun nut like Barnette found me, after all.
Men must be very judgmental, then. Try women for a change--I said you were cute, and Barnette's kind of like you! Just less vulgar.
Hmph! I never thought an Earth woman would get under my skin like this. I miss Barnette...
Ohhh, how'd I get stuck with this awful woman? Those metal men's guns...she's like a vulgar, classless version of my Barnette.
Now I want to go home and hug Barnette, just to prove you wrong. I knew living around men might make Earth girls vulgar, but you're just awful!
Oh, just shut up! I come here to learn about Earth, and I get a foul-mouthed bitch! Barnette, I'm sorry I even came here... having to strip near this woman.
...Uh...what's a grandfather? Like a grand-Fama? It's mostly the "father" part I'm confused over.
That's, uh, a lot of family history. You lost me at "father," whatever that means.
...OK, I know what "grand" means, but what's a "father"? Is that some weird Earth term for Omas?
Wait, wait, stop, forget the makeup. Now I'm confused as to what a "father" is, though apparently they're grand.
Oh, come on, honey, don't be like that! Come on, give details! Put on a light show!
Now, is that any way to treat a guest? I'd show you the fabulous things my Dread could do if you asked.
You'd really refuse the pleas of a beautiful, exotic alien woman? All I want is a little demonstration!
Don't brush me off like that! You're a shrimpy little cutie, but I know plenty of those--dazzle me with magic!
And what is "Planeptune," exactly? You rave about it like it's some kind of paradise.
Are you? I am a twenty-year-old beauty in the prime of my life. I guess you just stopped growing around twelve.
Ew, stay away from me. Even your weapon is creepy and inelegant. I don't want you looking at me, either.
Well, why do you have a mask? Don't play dumb with me, you weirdo! And don't talk about killing!
That would be nice. The least you could do to put us at ease is not look like a crazy homeless woman.
I'd appreciate that, thank you. Did you really have to show up to strip poker looking like a deranged slob who couldn't wash herself?
Eugh. You certainly don't have a cute personality. What's your immense power, to make your breasts shrink?
Eugh, you don't have to yell. If you're so powerful, why can't you make yourself grow to an adult?
Oh, this isn't what I wear for protection. We have spacesuits that make us look like chubby demons--but really, what's so protective about a short skirt?
Tripping, when this dress is cut for me to make full sprints in it. I suppose you're "protected" because attackers can't find your head underneath that floppy thing.
Well, what do you know? We have something in common. Even when I ask men to give me some of their seed, they just get all flustered and make excuses.
Men haven't responded well to my requests, either. What's so scary about asking them to make a baby with me? I've been so direct about it.
Men do seem to chicken out when girls ask them for anything concrete. We have some shared experience-- have you been asking him for his seed, too?
No, I wouldn't. Don't descrate this dress's style with your flabby fat folds.
I'd prefer if you were thin, because then you could make anything look good. A dress like this deserves a lithe body within it.
And I'm disgusted right now, but I'm holding my vomit back for everyone's sake. You could learn something about holding back.
I can tell. I guess exercising self-restraint isn't how you got to this point.
I'm jealous of Barnette back on the ship, getting to change with girls who are in shape. I've got to have her cook for me less.
No, I'm doing just fine, thank you. In fact, I don't think I'll ever eat anything again.
Oh, sure, go ahead and savor them. If you came here to find your one true love, I think you already have.
Ugh. Why don't you make out with them while you're at it? I haven't embraced Barnette the way you "savor" those things.
It'd be totally clean. Why don't you do us a favor and pull up a chair? You could chomp away as you watch your striptease--no undressing needed on your part.
I guess some girls are born to be in the audience rather than the spotlight. The least you could do is excuse yourself and just watch us, then.
Perhaps we have different definitions of shoveling food, much like we have different definitions of beauty. Why don't you speed up for my sake?
I guess so, with how long I've had to watch you munch on them. Have you tried going faster? Perhaps swallowing them all in one go?
...Oh, God, you're serious. Earth has more horrifying cases on its home ground than we ever saw it inflict on others.
...You really mean that, don't you? And I thought the Harvest was the worst Earth had to offer.
...Oh, did I let that slip already? Well, this didn't look like the Earth I know when I arrived! So watch your mouth, and that knife!
...You know that? Oh, I probably mentioned it already--Earth shouldn't be my enemy in this time! So back off!
That doesn't mean it's OK for you to get all stabby with me! The Earth that's after us is a gear-covered acid planet, anyway--don't make assumptions based on passing comments!
Oh, come on, do you Earth girls really consider men marriage material? Like I said, I'm busy with all our scrambling, and I still make time!
Oh, don't give me the "busy" excuse. I'm stuck on a ship that's always getting attacked, and I'm still in love. And I really wouldn't marry a man--they don't seem too reliable.
You sound like an instructor. Of course, they were always very interested in what exactly we were reading, as if there things we shouldn't have been.
Are you a student or the librarian? I remember looking for books on Earth history once, and they got all quiet before saying those were "by request." Not worth my time.
Oh, I've gained plenty of knowledge firsthand at this point. Our instructors always told us to read like you just did--read from a very specific list of approved books.
Perhaps on Earth, the world of books is wide. On my homeworld, they said the same thing, but so much of it was about the glory of our women's empire.
Is that what your teachers have told you? Just make sure that wide world of books you're reading isn't all from the same publisher...like on Mejare.
Not allowed to leave? Like, since you were a child? Oh, that just tugs at this free-spirited pirate's heart!
Oh, you poor thing! Cooped up in a house all those years...my pilot's heart yearns for adventure!
Who was making you stay inside, honey? You're an even bigger girl than me--just force your way out! I love adventure...
The universe is a vast place, Aella...take it from a star pilot. How rude of...whoever it was that imprisoned you.
Oh, good, a magic trick. Still not very monstrous, you know.
Well, I can't say the Monster Lord isn't one for showiness. Nice smoke job.
Heeheehee! It's certainly a lord's job to entertain, so whatever this is, I'm up for it!
Oh, she's trying to surprise us one last time. Let's see just how monstrous the Monster Lord gets, shall we?
Well, dear, let's just say Mejare's government is a little...wasteful with our resources. Hence my piracy.
I'm a pirate for a reason, dearie. The reason being that "Mejare" and "efficiency" are enemies.
It's not really a matter of space travel, dear. Mejare just goes through resources in a way that makes pirates out of its most beautiful citizens.
Oh, don't worry about the space travel--that's the Paksis's job. Mejare is just so very wasteful...it made pirates out of me and my family.
So long, Ang--oh. Well, I guess that counts.
Awww! And here I thought I had beaten you. But no, you proved too wily for me.
Damn Earth girls and their tricks. Who would do that, bring a bunch of accessories to a strip poker game?
My pilot's eyes should've spotted that, but you snuck right past me--and yourself, even.
Eeeek! Not the face! Or the hair! Or the dress! Don't hit me anywhere!
Aaack! Stay back! I'll use my sword, you hear? I mean it!
...Are these your friends, Cammy? I think I should leave now.
Nooo! Don't tear up my dress! It's all I have! I'll stab you, I swear!
Aaack--oh, it's just Cammy's ex-girlfriends again. You really get around, don't you?
More disgruntled ex-lovers? How old are you to have broken all these hearts, Cammy, honey?
It's really bizarre seeing this fistfight--normally I'm at the center of fights, being a pirate and all. I guess sleeping around makes even more enemies.
My, so many angry exes! I think you might want to stop cheating on them, Cammy--I'm nothing if not honest to my Barnette.
Ooh, dropping your sword, are we? That gives me an idea...for later.
Swords count in this dinky little place? How lawless...and fortunate for me.
Well, as long we're counting swords...I happen to have one, as well. Thanks for the tip, dear.
Oh, good, lovely Miss Pegasus is setting the precedent for counting weapons. Now I have an excuse...
Teehee! What's got you so tired, anyway? Is there a girlfriend I should know about?
Seriously, dear, why so sleepy? You know that's no good for your looks!
Awww, you can use me as a pillow, honey. But why are you so tired in the first place?
Sleeping is even more important than eating, Chiaki! But before you pass out, fill me in on what's made you so exhausted.
And at last the trumped-up girlie removes the only thing maintaining her arrogance.
Hey, Princess...you can't strip what makes me beautiful.
Royals...talk about jewelry for jewelry's sake. It's supposed to improve your looks, not create them.
Thaaaank you! Now the property of Magno Vivan's pirates, little Miss Princess! So sorry.
Heeheehee! Such a tease, Miss Valentine! You can deny it all you want, but I see myself written all over you.
It's OK to want to distance yourself from me, dear. I am, after all, taller and more beautiful.
Why deny the similarities, darling? Women across Mejare wish they could be mentioned alongside Jura Basil Elden.
What, too proud to admit we're alike? Afraid I do your image better than you?
Wha--oh, goddamnit! Just take things off in a proper order!
Hey, I came here to see some Earth nudity! I don't appreciate being toyed around with!
Yeah, yeah, hotshot. Real clever. You definitely played this game and didn't want people to see you naked.
This must be how people feel around me. Clinging to accessories...at least I have a body worth teasing.
I hate it when people bounce around with the importance of what they take off. Let the audience know what to expect!
Ooh, have a little fight in you, do we? But once you've signed up for this game, it's all up to chance.
Oh, don't start pretending the idea of being nude doesn't excite you, darling. You came here...and now you've left it up to fate.
When you're ready, hm? Sorry, Haru, but this is strip poker--and you show your body when the cards say so.
Are you sure you want to talk to a pirate that way, honey? Besides--whether you reveal anything is a matter of luck now.
Oh, my! Adorable and polite! Jenetta, any woman would be lucky to have you!
Just pretty? Don't you think I'm beautiful, too? Oh, I'm just teasing--you're so polite, a girl should snap you up soon!
Oh, how flattering, Miss Bunnyhop! With those sorts of people skills, I bet you've got a girlfriend--or will soon.
Heeheehee! Are you single, Rabbit-ears? Because you'll find a woman quickly with that sort of flattery.
Oh, that commitment to your costume is so adorable! ...Wait, you're serious?
...What? T-that's ridiculous--women don't have rabbit ears! This is an act you're doing, right?
Oh, just stop it, Jenetta! I've sniffed you out like the bunny you claim to be! ...Right?
Oh, darling, don't insult my intelligence. Even on Earth, girls don't have...did those things just t-twitch?
Ooh, you are mean. Don't be that way--I like your colorful sense of style!
Ohh, don't be so rude, Jolyne! You're cute, and your fashion sense is making me dizzy with excitement!
Well, I was on the money there. What a shame such a fashionable, adorably cute girl is so nasty.
Ouch. Even with that cool outfit, dear, anger makes a woman look ugly--you're much cuter when you smile!
I sure hope I age as gracefully as you do, Kitty-cat. Of course, I hear that's easier for shorties...
Oh, you're reminding me we all grow old! Even I won't remain the pinnacle of beauty forever...plus, being tall is taxing.
I'm sure you were quite the looker back in the day, dearie. One day I'll be in your shoes, and being big is hard on the body.
So, Short Stuff, what's it like being old? I'm worried that being so big means I won't age well...
...Wow, I was just kidding. You really are a sex fairy, just presenting like that.
Honey, you can't just present like that right from the get-go. The audience can't get what they want until the grand finale.
Seems Earth girls overdo it as usual. What kind of tease would I be if just spread my legs right here and now?
Easy there, hot stuff. You're already wearing so little--no need to spoil what surprises you have.
And a Bless You to--to...where'd Launch go?
...That's, uh, a pretty hard sneeze. Didn't realize it could turn your hair blue.
...Uh...is this an Earth thing, or would my hair turn blue if I sneezed too hard?
...Launch? Where'd the blonde girl go?
Losing your sword, hm? Not a bad idea...I wasn't aware this place counted weapons.
Maybe you're smarter than I thought, Swordswoman. Why bend the rules when you can slice right through them?
Is that your sword you're throwing out? I guess that makes me the leading blade-wielder at this table.
Oh, dear. And your sword was actually quite stylish. Perhaps I should strip my rapier, too?
Oooh! That sounded so cute, honey, whatever it was! What does that mean?
Teeheehee! I don't know what you said, but your home language sounds so silky smooth and romantic! What's it mean?
Ooh, what's that mean, dear? Because it sounded like the most romantic thing I've ever heard!
Omigosh, that's so romantic-sounding! What does it mean? I want to talk like that!
Anyway, I--your eyepiece? Really?
O-oh wow, your eyepiece. I...didn't think you'd even take that off.
Huh. I thought you might save that for the end, if you took it off at all.
Wow. Your eyepiece? You're taking this pretty seriously.
Y-your eyepiece? It's OK, Meia, you don't have to...
Awww, c'mon, you can tell me! I'm not even from this planet--how's the secret going to get out?
What kind of organization is this where you won't even tell an alien? I pirate and fight organ-harvesters--there, I told you!
It's OK, dear, I'm from Mejare--no one here is going to know! You can tell me anything.
Really? You won't tell me, the alien? I'd gladly give you a tour of the Nirvana! I could show you my Dread!
Does this establishment frown upon you bringing your own beer, Miss Katsuragi? You seem like you're here to have fun, but it's a bit rude to the owners.
Would you look at Miss Military? She's chugging down beer she brought herself. Mejarian bars usually prefer to sell booze to their patrons.
I hope you brought enough booze for everyone, Misato. I'm sure the proprietors would prefer if you sold it and gave them the proceeds.
Did you really bring cans of beer here, Misato? I don't know much about Earth money, so maybe the prices are a bit much.
Management? What is up with this girl?
...I'm totally lost. There's rules about what you can strip? They didn't tell me any rules.
...Honey, did the bouncer clock you upside the head before you came in? I'm not teasing, I'm dead serious.
I...what? Management? Yeah, you could use a little management, that's for sure.
...Did I miss something? Can't we take off whatever we want?
...Is there really a nebulous management that's got guns to our heads if we don't strip how they want?
...Who exactly is holding a gun to your head and making you do this? Hey, are you listening?
...Why do you have to take off your shoes next? I mean, you should, but apparently you have to?
It's refreshing to know you won't acknowledge anything I say. Real liberating.
...Look, I know I tease a lot, but I'm just having fun. Nothing about this is fun.
Talk about a lost cause. She won't even acknowledge me.
Hey, Ocean Girl. If you're being held against your will, blink twice. I'm a pirate, I understand.
Sounds like the words of a woman with only a cursory understanding. How do you make them twitch? Or get the seed out?
That's all there is to it, hm? Come on, Mr. Man--where's the seed come from? How can I get some?
Blood isn't the only part of that equation, honey. I know men's seed is made of something else, and I want some.
Oh, but I'm not satisfied with that explanation, dear. I want men's seed--how can I make it spurt out? Or just cut it from them directly?
And those fantastic pointy ears! And your flowing dress! Ooh, you're so cute!
That flowing blue dress is almost as delightful as your hair! Oh, I wish I had something like that!
Oh, I just want to wrap myself in those azure locks of yours! Or maybe slip inside that magnificent dress! I'd really fill it out.
This is the only fancy dress I have! Yours is so bright and lively--I love the way it hugs your little frame!
Dominion? Well, now...I guess we know which one of us is the kinky goddess.
What do you mean, dominion? I treat my partners like equals, because I'm a selfless lover.
Ooh, getting into your sex life already, Miss Goddess? You like to dress up and exercise your dominion?
Er...dominion isn't exactly my style. I'm beautiful, so I like to be ravished, you know?
Sure you don't want to cling to that, dearie? It is what marks as you as better than the rest of us.
I guess I can understand losing that, even as a princess. It'll let your blonde hair flow free and unencumbered!
Miss Princess dropping her overinflated jewelry? Oh, I forgot--you're blonde, so you're not so bad.
That's it, honey. Lower yourself to the level of us dirty commoners.
Ohhhh, she even learned how to speak like an adult! You're so cute...hey, where'd your hat go?
Heeheehee! You must come from money to speak so refined at such a young age...wait, didn't you have a hat?
Oooh, Miss Remilia, you just ooze class, don't you, darling? Even as you...make your hat...disappear?
Awww, am I really so old already that kids are calling me a hag? Oh, well...wait, what'd you strip? I thought you had a hat.
O-oh, are you putting the guns down? I-I promise I won't touch them...Mejarians use laser rings anyway!
Er, Revy, good choice there. Women are more suited for laser rings, you know? They're elegant.
Hey, uh, now that you're disarmed, try to relax a little, would you? I can let you see a Mejarian laser ring if you want.
Th-the guns? I thought you were going to cling to those things all game...I like our laser rings.
Oh, am I being too forward? My apologies. Just know you'd have your pick of the bunch over there.
Oh, sorry, I got carried away there. But you're still a beautiful, musclebound woman! That's a plus anywhere.
Maybe that was a little forward of me. But Mejarians would love you! I wonder if men feel the same.
Well, just know how in-demand you are on Mejare...if these bumbling Earth men start giving you the cold shoulder.
Dear, dear. Removing your fancy jewelry so readily? Don't you care about that precious ttle of yours?
Blonde women are always favorites of mine...even better, you're removing that ridiculous crown early. Come have some fun with us commoners.
No sense keeping it on long, right? You're already lowering yourself by playing this, anyway.
Make the gown next to go, Miss Princess. I think you'll find how fun we dirty common folk can be.
Hey, what's with the shocked look on your face, honey? Is it not a thing on Earth for two women to be in love?
Your horrified expression is an insult to my planet's culture, Miss Matoi. Don't they teach girls to love each other on Earth?
Hey, what's with the weird look on your face, Schoolie? Is it not acceptable to love a woman as beautiful as yourself on Planet Earth?
Oh, gosh, is that a faux pas on Earth, dear? Well, I love Barnette no matter what, and you should love other girls, too!
Just a little nervous? Damn...I guess I'm too gorgeous to be scary.
Nervous? I was really trying to scare you--I guess you're already falling in love with me.
I was hoping for a better reaction than that. Maybe you're tougher than you look--or I'm just that lovable!
Just trying to break you in, dear. You look positively miserable--I wanted to scare you into having fun!
...I wasn't serious about the fire thing.
Eeeek! I-I wasn't serious! Fire!
Aack! Fire! I came here to relax, not deal with more ship fires!
Eeeeek! No! Please! M-my dress can't catch fire--it's the only one I have!
...Speaking of which, you've, uh...caught fire.
The Nirvana has to sink to be a ship-girl? Oh, boo. Well, our crew memebers are beautiful, anyway.
...Yeah, I'm not sure being shot down is worth getting a cute girl out of the Nirvana. We already have plenty aboard.
Hm. Being destroyed doesn't sound like a worthy tradeoff for a little ship-girl. All my crew members are cute, after all--it'd be a net loss.
We have to be sunk to get a ship-girl? Damn...oh, well, at least our crew is beautiful. Maybe we could give Pyoro a female body...
Ah, youthful ignorance. Everyone gets hit eventually, darling--like you are right now.
Am I wrong, or have you been getting hit this entire time? You might have all your clothes on with a shield or two.
I think your current dodging performance is providing some evidence against your strategy, dear. Life's all about taking hits, not dodging them.
Says the girl who's been taking shells head-on more and more. Lots of rookie pilots think they'll never get hit--then they panic when they do.
Oh, Shimakaze...so naive. Meia's obsessed with speed, too, but she knows when to retreat. You're getting hit right now!
Come now, Sola, I don't bite! Tell me all about your fantastical magic school!
Hey now, I flew all this way to Earth, and now I meet a girl in a uniform from a magic school! What's it like there?
Hey, Miss Magic-Hat, you can't just let it slip that you've got crazy powers from a school and leave us hanging.
Can you teach me some magic, Sola? Maybe tell me about your crazy school for it or whatever? Earth is so cool!
...What, is there a requirement? Why are you a ghost, then?
...I'm afraid to ask what happened if you earned the right to be a ghost.
I came to Earth to learn about men, but ghosts are worthwhile, too. So what made you special?
Ooh, there's more to the story than simply dying, is there? Well, do share. Jura Basil Elden isn't afraid of new developments.
Heeheehee! Oh, so you are the embarrassed type! I was just calling you sexy, honey. Relax.
Hey, when a woman compliments your figure, you say "Thanks, you too." Talk about rude.
I call you sexy enough to rock a bodysuit, and you get all flustered and offended. Earth woman are so scared of each other.
What? That was complimentary, silly! That suit is doing all sorts of favors for your hips.
There you go! Take off that helmet and show the world the cute face to match your sexy figure. I wasn't teasing you before.
...So, uh, Ochako. You're floating. ...Are you going to explain that? Because it's incredible!
Wait--are you--omigosh, Ochako, you can float? That's so cool! How are you doing that?
Ooh, Ochako! You can just float like that? I'd have been doing it all game if I could float!
...OK. Ochako. You're...levitating. And that is so cool! What's your secret? Can I learn to float?
You're, uh, a little on display there, honey. Unless that sort of thing excites you.
Oh, please. You're flashing us on purpose, aren't you?
Don't act like that flash was an accident, dearie. I know your type...nerdy little Parfet is a freak, too.
Showing off the underwear early? Should've pegged you as the falsely-modest type.

state.text: Aaack! No! Wait! I'm too young to die! Too beautiful!
Eek! Noooo! Wait! I'll give you whatever you want!
Ack! The Harvest! I should've known this was a trap!
Eeeeek! No! Please! I have a girlfriend!

case.state: Yes! Yes! Go for it! Roll that die! Can I have one?
You are so cool, Vriska! Where can I get one of those things?
So it's that die that does it for you? Can I have one? I want to switch my outfit on the fly!
Where'd you get that die? I don't want to have to steal yours, you know!
Atta girl! Now show me something magical! ...Besides this.
These vortices are pretty fantastic, but it's the end result I care about.
You really are something else. I've already grown accustomed to your magic vortices!
All that magic, but all I care about is the outfit waiting for me. I never thought I'd meet someone like you!
...Seriously, do you have any control over this? Even a little? Or is it all luck?
...Talk about living life up to chance, by the way. This is so weird...and I'm a pilot. I've seen weird.
There she goes with another vortex. Life is just a game of luck to our little fashionista here.
Too bad this isn't the spectacle it used to be. But the random chance does keep it interesting!
My, my! What a bad attitude you have, Princess. I was just poking fun!
Figures the obscenely wealthy take offense to the most innocent of banter. Lighten up, Coinstacks.
Oh, come on, I wasn't serious! You're too cute to rob! And absolutely zero fun, just as I would expect from a rich girl.
What a surprise--I open with an affable joke, and Little Miss Moneybags gets all huffy.
Oh, give me a break, Cash-or-Credit. One joke and you come at me with a bad attitude.
And what do we have here? Miserable old Miss Brunette is admitting she's no better than the rest of us?
Hey, Miss Princess. You don't mind if this pirate holds onto that tiara, do you? Just for a little inspection?
Don't stop there, Miss Princess. Nothing satisfies a pirate quite like watching nobles stripped down to nothing at all.
Take away her tiara and she's a brunette in a dress. Take away her dress...and I hope her butt is cute.
Are you really some sort of goddess? Like, with magic? Show me some, it'll be so cool!
If you're really as magical as you say, then let me see some! Otherwise you're just a stuck-up Earth girl!
I think I'm a tad more beautiful, so you better wow us all with a display of that magic of yours.
So are you going to show us some magic or not? I heard you were capable of that, and I like calling bluffs.
Oh, look, now Catria's removing a weapon. I guess we know which gorgeous blonde woman she has to thank for that.
As usual, women follow the trails I've blazed for them--in this case, Miss Pegasus counting her weapon as a layer.
Counting your sword, are we? Is that a trick your sisters taught you, or are you simply following my lead?
Hm? Seems I've set a precedent for stripping blades...I set a precedent for beauty, so it only makes sense.
You got that idea from me, you little cheat! Once again the crafty Mejarian paves the way for the rest of womankind.
My, my, Lyn. Bending the rules by removing a weapon? The audacity.
You're just copying what I came up with before...but you've got Barnette's cute green hair, so I'll let it slide.
I'd teach you a thing or two with my rapier for copying me like this, but, well, I threw it away.
Wait, your eyepiece? I...OK, then.
Uh...OK. I--I didn't think...you'd take that off.
O-oh wow, your eyepiece. I mean, they'll think it's nothing, but...
...Meia, are you--f-feeling alright? Did you hit your head last battle? Meia Gisborn doesn't take her eyepiece off!
Y-your eyepiece? You're not serious?
Your eyepiece? Are you...feeling alright, Meia?
O-oh, wow. That's...unexpected. OK.
So what's fir--uh, really? Uh...uh...
So now that you're finally playing along, what'll it--be...uh...
Y-your eyepiece? I mean, first? At all?
Oh...well, that's a...downer. Worried about awkward questions?
...I'm sorry I said anything. You're really in it to win it...and to avoid weird questions, I guess.
...You don't have to take this game so seriously, Meia. Or are you worried people would ask questions if you saved it for later?
Now I really feel bad about all those trinkets. Didn't think you'd take any off...I guess you'd rather avoid pressing questions.
...OK. That's a fair trade. Yeah.
I--I wasn't serious, Meia.
M-Meia? You know that's your eyepiece, right? You're gonna...really?
Uh...you, uh...didn't have to match my embarrassment.
...I was kidding about being embarrassed. You don't have to do that...
...Who are you, and what have you done with Meia?
...Uh...we're supposed to be having fun, Meia. Not dredging up painful memories.
I...I...why? You don't have to, Meia...
...Hey, listen, I know I'm naked, but I'm not saying you should have to take that off.
...I was just teasing. That's way more than my whole outfit...even if they don't know it.
Um...are you trying to shock me out of masturbating?
...Uh...I can't masturbate to that. And not for the reason these Earth people are thinking.
...Well, this is awkward. Are you OK, Meia?
I may have lost, but...now I feel bad for you.
Well, that stunts my libido. Why are you doing this to yourself?
...OK. I agree. You don't want to have fun.
...Point taken. No fun for you. Got it.
...OK, now you're just actively trying to make this awful for yourself.
W-wha--but...why? You should be having fun, not torturing yourself!
...You'd still look sexy with that on. It's not what I meant by stripping...or fun.
Well, how should I put this...? It's sexy, but there just isn't any class. Perhaps Barnette and I can give you a Mejarian makeover!
Well, it's thoughtless sexiness. Just wantonly flaunting your skin, your hips...oh, Barnette and I should dress you up!
Well, you're dressed for the beach. All the sexiness is in your body, not the outfit...oh, Barnette and I should find an outfit for you!
You...do? That was a joke! What are you, some kind of cult of gun-worshippers? I know Barnette loves that CZ 75 of hers...
I...I wasn't serious. I better keep Barnette away from you before she joins your little cult and calls herself CZ 75.
...What? Oh, and I'm made of porcelain, myself. You mean to tell me you're some kind of living statue?
M-marble? Hey, I'm not from this planet--don't try to tell me some tall tale! I suppose you're a statue who walked right off her pedestal?
...What? You seem like the type to stay in your palace and hold tea parties. What are you doing hanging out with pirates?
Younger than me? What is she, a little kid? And just what kind of princess are you, running around with little kid pirates?
Ugh, forget I said anything. Just keep your twenty fingers to yourself.
Well, whatever your problem is, keep it away from me, and yourself along with it. That includes your extra limbs!
Oh, forget it. How can the beautiful symmetry of the female body break down with a few extra arms? Maybe it's how you look like a spider.
Ew. You're not much better on the inside. Maybe your brain has extra limbs, too.
Where do you get the nerve to climb out of these portals and then start asking questions? I was hoping to meet some normal Earth girls.
I'm the one who deserves to have her questions answered! Don't tell me every Earth girl is running around with a portal-necklace like it's no big deal.
Hahahaha! Well, I've never played a stripping game, either, but I'm quite enjoying my first. Now, what do you have to nervous about?
Well, then, you should want to make this Crimson Demon Clan proud. What's got you so nervous? I'm no stripping veteran myself, you know.
...It was Halloween that sparked this change, right? I noticed you don't have beer this time, and it might be...affecting you.
...No beer cans tonight, Misato? I hope this skeletal look isn't withdrawal symptoms.

state.text: Ugh. It's just the arrogance of it all. How many other psychic ghost girls are wandering Earth after what I assume are twisted genetic experiments?
I suppose there's even more of you? Do the authorities kidnap random children and pick at their brains to create superhuman freaks?

case.state: That's it, huh? Earth women are awfully boring.
Just that? Why, you won't see me taking off something that small. No way.
I didn't expect any different. Was sure hoping for it, though.
Just what I expected, nothing like I hoped for. Try not to let us down tonight.
Don't be like that, ~name~! I just met you--excite me!
Kinda cute. Where can I get something like your ~clothing~?
That's it, huh? Well, I have no right to complain about it.
Way to get into the spirit of things, ~name~. I'd never take off something so frivolous.
Have you been giving lessons on fun to this girl, Meia? Jeez.
I'm slacking on Dread maintenance by being here, you know. ...Hey, Boss, forget I said that.
Seriously? Why do Earth girls wear so much?
Take a fashion tip from a Mejarian. Less is more.
I've half a mind to borrow one of Barnette's guns.
Aren't you furious with her, Meia? I know how much losing gets to you.
That's it, huh? Earth women are awfully boring.
Just that? Why, you won't see me taking off something that small. No way.
Boring and perfectly sensible. You'd be good friends with Meia--you know, if Meia wanted any friends.
I didn't expect any different. Was sure hoping for it, though.
Don't be like that, ~name~! I just met you--excite me!
Fine, fine. Let's get this one over with.
I see you're taking my approach to stripping.
Bold choice, dear. I can see why you'd come to a place like this.
What a brutal blow to your modesty. Women all over Earth shroud themselves in shame!
...Is this because I counted my rapier? I was just having a little fun, ~name~.
Kind of cute. Where can I get something like your ~clothing~?
That's it, huh? Well, I have no right to complain about it.
Way to get into the spirit of things, ~name~. I'd never take off something so frivolous.
Jeez, did you take fun lessons from Meia or what?
Hey, I'm slacking on Dread maintenance by being here, you know.
Earth women are so boring.
Hey, at least I'm making a show of it.
Still miffed about those armbands?
Oh, come on, don't be so vindictive about all my accessories.
Good thing I'd never remove something so inconsequential. I've already revealed my gorgeous bare arms!
Hey, I have a body worth teasing for a while. Yours is just passable.
Is this what I've been doing the whole time? It is annoying.
Just an accessory? Why, I'd never take off something that small! The audacity!
I hope that meant a lot to you, because it didn't really bring the outfit together.
Oh, hurry up already! You're such a bore.
This is really making me feel guilty about all the accessories I took off first.
Really? Is this because of what I did?
...I know I was like this, but come on, be the bigger woman here.
Looks like I've got to do the stripping for everyone around here.
Oh, come on already! Look at how I am!
Hey, I'm already naked. You're not topping that reveal.
Maybe I should remind you that I'm a pirate, and operate outside the law. Give me a reason to still follow it.
Earth women's accessories are not worth this frustration.
...You suck, ~name~.
Give me a break here! Is this because of how I taunted you before?
Look, I'm sorry about the teasing, alright? You beat me already!
This is giving me a headache...good thing finishing up should cure that.
Seriously? Why do Earth girls wear so much?
Take a fashion tip from a Mejarian. Less is more.
I've half a mind to borrow one of Barnette's guns.
Meia hates losing a lot more than I do. She'd be furious with you!
Hey, I show a little genuine concern, and I get swatted away! How do we know Sweater-vest here doesn't have a sadistic side?
Well, excuse me for actually being worried about you. For all we know, Haru's some kind of weird sadist who gets off on women's pain.
You're being awfully trusting of strangers' intentions over your own second-in-command's! This girl could turn out to be crazy, you know!
Hmph! I just wanted to make sure you're alright. Instead you'd rather reassure the sweatered schoolgirl--who may or may not have something to hide.
Talk about a terrestial booze-a-thon. Oh, well, I've got the height to drink with the best of them!
I get that this place is a bar, but damn, ladies, at least pretend you're trying to win.
So I get this place has a no-touching rule, but you two aren't really disguising how you're planning to take some of us home afterward.
I do love drinking, but I don't think I could keep up with you two. I guess living around men forces you to drown your sorrows.
Hm? Oh, we're fighter pilots! I'm actually second-in-command--Meia here is our leader.
As if I'm just some brainless flirt! I happen to be second-ranked on our Dread pilot team...behind Meia, of course.
I'm so glad you asked--Barnette and I are expert Dread fighter pilots! Only Meia here is ranked higher.
Hey, Barnette and I are two of our highest-ranked fighter pilots! ...Meia here being the leader, of course, but she's a workaholic.
Ouch. I hope you don't think I'm as snotty as Miss Goddess here, Leader.
And you say we have a tense relationship. I would never talk to my dear leader like that!
...See how ratty girls can get with each other, Meia? We're friends deep down! You're my steadfast boss!
Eep. I hope you don't think I talk like this behind your back, Meia. I care what you think!
Ugh, can you believe this little imp? We ought to hop in our Dreads and show her what Mejare is capable of.

state.text: Hey, can't you see Meia's sensitive about that thing? I can show you how real our planet is, Miss Biker-girl!
