case.state: Hmph! For a girl with a gas bike, she sure likes to play with fire. How about I rattle her bones overhead if she thinks Mejare is a joke?
Are you listening to this little punk, Meia? She thinks we're just playing dress-up. I wonder what she'd think of Vandread firepower.
Don't ask questions you don't want the answer to, Meia.
This is why I mostly stick to asking about men and fashion. See what happens?
See, Meia? Don't encourage people to discuss things you don't care about.
Oh, this ought to be a treat. Have fun, Leader!

state.text: H-hey, shut your mouth, freak! Meia's Oma gave it to her!
Hey, don't you dare talk to her like that! That's a gift from her Oma, which you might realize if you had feelings!
Hey, that was a gift from her parents! You know what a parent is, Gearbox?
Watch it, Needle-arm! That's a gift from Meia's parents, and I'll slice that syringe off before you talk to her like that!

case.state: U-uh...sorry. Should I not have said anything?
You little runt! I--ugh. Sorry for losing my temper...
...That's not true, is it? I-I was just defending you!
Stupid little twerp, talking to you that way...sorry, I'm making a fool of us, aren't I?
H-hey, don't worry about trying to explain Mejare to him! Are you feeling OK?
You don't have to be a tour guide right now, especially to some man! You're OK, right? Not feeling weird?
I...I've never seen you take it off in public like that. And now you're fine explaining Omas to a man?
W-what's gotten into you? Taking off your eyepiece so quickly? Talking to men about Mejare? Or to men at all?
She's even taking an interest in your eyepiece! It's very dear to her, Sei, darling--be polite.
Aww, Sei likes our tech, Leader! Listen, honey, complimenting Meia's eyepiece will really tug at her heartstrings.
If you want to get on Meia's good side in a hurry, Sei, that eyepiece was a gift from her Oma. Compliment how it looks.
Word of advice, Sei, dear--Meia loves that eyepiece. Tell her you like it, and the ice'll melt a little.
Oh, please. All this titilating nudity is enough excitement for one evening.
As if I need to drink to have fun when there's full-blown Earth nudity in our midst! I resent your implication.
Hey, Misato can drink alone. I only drink when I know my darling Barnette is there to take care of me.
Hey now, I'm tall! I can handle at least...uh...a few beers, give or take.
Oh, dear. Now you've done it, Rinkah...Meia loves women with muscles.
Just try to ride this out, honey. Meia acts icy, but those muscles melt her right down like nobody's business.
Don't believe her cover stories, Rinkah. Meia doesn't want your muscles...she wants you.
Heehee! Meia tends to get like this around particularly fit women, if you follow. Don't mind her desperate advances.
Oh, a medic? Now we should get her aboard just to have a woman operating on us.
Hear that, Meia? Get in this girl's pants and we could get a woman doctor on the ship.
Our only doctor's a man. Even if you don't want to get all cuddly with Meia, could you maybe join us anyway?
A medic, hm? OK, Meia, forget the girlfriend situation--now you need her so we have a woman doctor on board. Think of the ship!
Oh, you're back. Try not to make a habit of that, dearie...it's not very intimidating.
...Well, at least you came back. Seriously, did a man kill your family or something?
Listen, honey, you ought to come my my home planet sometime. It's nothing but women...and we make a habit of shooting nasty men.
You have nothing to be scared of, honey. I've fought the toughest, burliest men around and come out on top!
...That's it? I come from a planet of all women! There's no special word for two girls dating.
...I'm from planet Mejare, Revy. There's no men to date--so there's no word for two women dating.
Earth has an insult for women in love? My home planet is nothing but women--that's all love is to me.
What, it means two girls dating? How can you even insult that? There aren't even any men on planet Mejare to date!
Why can't you just accept a compliment? I mean it! You even remind me of Barnette a little with those guns...
Tch! Sounds like you're convinced you're ugly, not me. Barnette loves guns, too...she's just sweeter.
...I know I tease about Mejarians being more beautiful, honey, but self-deprecation isn't healthy. The way you love guns actually reminds me of Barnette...
God, who hurt you? I call you cute, and you respond by insulting me! I miss Barnette...she loves guns like you do.
Hm? Oh, we're fighter pilots! I'm actually second-in-command--and Barnette's third.
As if I'm just some brainless flirt! I happen to be second-ranked on our Dread pilot team. And Barnette's a sub-leader!
I'm so glad you asked--Barnette and I are expert Dread fighter pilots! I'm second-ranked, in fact.
Hey, Barnette and I are two of our highest-ranked fighter pilots! We're downright indispensable on the Nirvana.
Uh...ew. That's kind of ratty, actually. But you've got more, right?
...Now you kind of smell salty. Don't you have something else? Something nicer?
...I have no clue what that is. Kind of looks like men's clothing...all tattered and gross.
...That's certainly a lot of extra stuff. But somehow it just ends up looking like rags, whatever it is.
Ohhh, that's cute! Now you're all dressed up like a maid--which Mejare frowns upon, but not as much as it does pirates.
Maid outfits are so adorable! I'd dress up my girlfriend in one...if I could afford one.
Ohh, I wish I had something as cute as that! Barnette and I could do a little roleplay, you know, pretend we have money.
Life's tough for a Mejarian pirate...but the alternative is to be a maid for some rich old hag. No thanks!
Oh, I see! These must be Earth women's street clothes, right? You're so considerate!
Starting off simple, huh? Just basic Earth street clothes on display? I get it.
Jacket and jeans? Seen it--but I guess street clothes on Earth don't have to be all that different.
Earth's street clothes sticking to the familiars, eh? Mejarians tend to aim a little tighter.
Ooh, a sexy red-and-black! I like your style, Vriska--and it clashes with your skin!
Nothing like blood-red and shadow-black to get the heart beating. Plus, those bullets get it going even faster!
Talk about making my heart jump. Red, black, and bullets on the side!
I wish I owned something red...and this dress is the closest thing to black. A pirate's problems!
You're getting sexier all the time, cutie! I like leaving my shoulders bare, too...
Now you're speaking my language! A woman's shoulders should be as free as space is vast.
As long as the universe is expanding, a woman's shoulders should be unmasked to see it happen.
Exactly what I would go for, with those uncovered shoulders. I feel like you already know me so well, Vriska!
Oh, I see! These must be Earth women's street clothes, right? You're so considerate!
Going for something simple, huh? Just basic Earth street clothes on display? I get it.
Jacket and jeans? Seen it--but I guess street clothes on Earth don't have to be all that different.
Earth's street clothes sticking to the familiars, eh? Mejarians tend to aim a little tighter.
Oho! I knew you weren't so above it all! And what a shift--bodysuits are pretty sexy.
Heeheehee! I think the die was getting annoyed at you hiding your figure! Go on, show off your hips!
Going to do a little dance, Vriska? Show off that figure a little? Because that adorable polka-dotted suit is giving you a head start.
That's positively adorable, Vriska! Polka-dots and a revealing shape. Now it's Mejarian fashion!
Bare midriff? My dress brings me pretty close to that...but Dita's the girl who wears it best!
Ooh, my crewmate Dita dresses like that! She's such a naive little thing, even with her midriff exposed all sexy-like.
I know a sweet young girl who dresses like that! Dita's her name--she's so naive. Barely even notices her exposed belly.
Yeah, Dita shows off her belly too. I can't tell if she's just too naive to know how sexy she's being or just doesn't care.
Hah! Going for my look, are you? Yeah, cleavage tends to get people to do what you want.
Feeling a little breezy, honey? Don't worry, you'll get used to it--I did.
Pfft! How do you like my style, then? I'm flattered you had this on the backburner, sweetie.
Doesn't the breeze feel good between your breasts? It always perks me up when I'm down.
Would you stop making assumptions about me? I don't have any money--I'm a pirate, for God's sake!
Who're you calling rich? I'm in a pirate band--this dress is the only good one I have!
Pampered? Spoiled? I stole my dress--I pirate for a living! I've hardly seen a credit since I was a girl!
Barnette and I are pirates, you whore! Everything we have, we share with the ship! I'm not rich!
Swords? Regenerating? That isn't flashy to you? What a spoiled little girl--where's my magic?
Hmph. I can't believe that doesn't sound flashy to Miss Magic here--my Vandread is fantastic, but I acknowledge that.
Ugh, now you're threatening me over it? Summoning swords and healing yourself sounds pretty flashy to me.
Not flashy? Honey, I've shielded whole planets with my Vandread, and that still sounds impressive. C'mon!
Universe? Anything beyond another planet was more than I bargained for in coming here.
I had the same attitude about myself on this planet before you opened up a tear in reality. I hate being upstaged.
...I see. Goddesses must come in all shapes and sizes--such as mine. What does the great and powerful Neptune preside over?
I'm something of a goddess myself, but even I admit I'll age one day. What might you be the goddess of, exactly?
"Nation"? Only the most backwater planets are still split up into countries. But if you still have "goddesses," then I guess that makes sense.
...Oh, dear. I shouldn't be surprised a little squirt is hailed as "goddess" on your planet if it's still primitive enough to have different nations.
I'll stop playing fancy-girl when you stop playing crazed murderer. And when you manage to leave that thing in its sheathe for five minutes.
Oh, of course, I'm so fancy and entitled for wanting you to keep your sword sheathed and your murder-fantasies to yourself. Just stay over there!
And you appear to be the prime example of that. Well, I'll defend myself if need be!
You almost seem to be rooting for Earthlings to turn into violent murderers. I guess you'll have more friends that way!
Oh, believe me, suddenly the Earthlings of this time seem much more capable of creepy, horrible violence.
Aaaack! Ew! Ew! Ew, ew, ew, ew, ew, ew!
Eeeew! Was this supposed to excite us? You're all scaly and slimy and eeeewww!
Wha--ew! W-what is this? Now you're not cute at all! Go back to the old look!
Eeeek! OK, you're the Monster Lord, I get it! Now go back to being fleshy!
Me-ow! Heeheehee--wait, you're serious? Like, the animal, a cat?
...Earth girls can have cat ears? Like, the cats I see in zoos? How?
...You, uh, going to explain this to me? I'm still shaky on what a cat is, much less a "Faunus."
...Listen, I'm not from Earth. You can't expect me to understand why you have cat ears...or why you've been hiding them.
Eek--o-oh, you won. Who was that, your feisty ex-girlfriend? You need better taste in girls.
Ah! Y-you--oh, she's down. If this is some bizarre ex-girlfriend revenge, you've got to date an accountant or something.
...I guess that's the peril of dating your fellow muscle-girls. They try to beat your face in after a breakup.
Was that some gym girl you broke up with, Cammy? ...I better hope Barnette and I stay together, or she might shoot me.
Seeing you pummel girls like this really makes me think I ought to practice my sword skills...or bring a laser ring next time.
I really need to get better with my rapier--you're doing a better job taking these girls out with your fists. Of course, you could just use a laser ring.
Why even let them get close to your pretty face? I could train with my sword and repel them better...or just use a laser ring.
Want to borrow my rapier for the next time they show up? I could stand to get better with it...actually, if I were you, I'd use a trusty laser ring.
A laser ring would be quicker, you know--and they wouldn't get up again. Still, I should get better with my rapier, since you're so good unarmed...
What do you mean, not fun? The fun is starting off with some teasing and then revealing your beautiful body!
Hmph. It would seem I'm the only proper seductress around here, properly building up to nudity like a lady.
There's a right way and a wrong way to strip, and you're starting to fall into the wrong way. It needs to escalate!
Well. I'd never make it as a model if I deflated the excitement like you do.
What do you mean? Oh, right, you Earth girls date men...really, no love for each other?
Hm? Oh, yes, dating men is the norm on Earth. Don't you ever flirt with girls?
Oh, of course, Earth girls only love men. I think you're missing out--have you really never saw a woman you fell in love with?
Oh, don't start going on about men. Sure, they're beastly, but even an Earth girl has to appreciate shapely curves, no?
...W-what? "Poppy"? "...Mom"?
...I'm so confused. Mom? Papa? Are these Earth words or just a clown thing?
The...guy who did my...what? What's a mom? Stop confusing me!
What? Is this another gag? What's a mom? Or a papa?
I've got my eye on you, Miss Pixie...because my ears are totally confused when you talk.
Little Miss Pixie must think she's clever, saying all these things that go over my poor foreigner head.
Have some sympathy for this poor alien woman, Kyu. You're always saying things only an Earth woman would understand.
Feel free to start making sense for everyone, Miss Pixie. Think of the poor aliens in your presence when you speak.
Seriously, what just happened? You can't just shapeshift like that and act like nothing happened!
Are you even a woman? Or an Earthling? Are you some kind of alien shapeshifter?
I'm so confused. Are you a shapeshifting alien? Is this what Earth women are capable of?
I had no idea Earth genetics were so...advanced. Just changing your hair color on a whim.
Ooh, what's that thing? A men's gun fused with a woman's? Not as unlikely as you might think.
Is that a men's gun that shoots lasers? Listen, honey...combining male and female weapons is par for the course on the Nirvana.
Ohoho. So your sword is divine, is it? I guess that blows my silly little fashion item out of the water.
If that thing's really so divine, maybe you should keep it on. Who knows what could happen here?
Seems a little silly bringing a divine sword to this seedy little dump. Does it know its owner is dirtying herself?
Divine, hm? I like your style, honey...sword, green hair, and the favor of the gods. If it's true.
Oh, you flatter me, dear! But this is the only good dress I have. I'm a Mejarian pirate, so I have to steal these things!
"French"? We on Mejare only speak the common language. And you're too kind about this stolen dress of mine.
Oh, there's no need for flattery, Marinette! This dress is the only fancy one I've managed to pirate on Mejare.
Oh, no, dear, I'm from Mejare! We only speak the common language there. But thanks for complimenting my stolen dress.
I--I'm sorry. You didn't have to do that.
I hardly ever see you without that thing...this is weird.
You, uh, want my sword? You shouldn't have had to count that...
You OK, Meia? I don't want to antagonize you over that...
Knowing what I do about Earth, you do have plenty of reasons to drink. So get to it, Miss Military.
Isn't Earth devastated where you come from? Same here, honey...bottoms up, drink it all away.
The world's a terrifying place...especially where you come from, I hear. So don't feel bad about your little booze habit.
What's all the beer for, honey? Depressed about losing your boots, or about this "Second Impact" I keep hearing of?
...Er, did I miss something? It just vanished...you know what, you kind of skeeve me out in general, honey.
...Wait, where'd your blazer go? H-hey, don't mess with me! I already get a weird feeling in my stomach when I look at you.
...OK, I was ignoring the sinking feeling your eyes give me, honey, but your blazer just vanished. What's your deal, huh?
Eep! W-what was that just now? I have a pilot's eyes, and you made that disappear! Actually, you've been giving me butterflies this whole time!
Not to be rude, but, uh...you've totally got a screw loose.
...Is this what I sound like? I just think flirting is fun...this girl's nuts.
...Maybe I should stop flirting so much. If this girl is the end result, that is.
...Does sex with men do this to you? Because this girl's really starting to freak me out.
Am I getting through to you? Jura to Ocean Girl! Hello?
Hey, Ocean Girl! I'm talking to you!
What's your name, floozy? Moon? Yeah, you're a lunatic, alright! Say something to me!
Hel-looo? Am I breaking up? Have we achieved first contact? God...
For how excited you are to strip...I'm not sure I want to see what lies underneath.
As if we want to see your nasty little twig body. You keep going on about how you're just a public plaything!
Oh, good, you're almost out. Maybe then you can lose and leave and stop freaking me out.
Whatever ocean you're swimming in, I bet the fish are all dead.
Ooh, Ping! You're so forward--I have a girlfriend, you know. And she's taller than you.
Oh, you horrible man, trying to steal me away from my girlfriend! My girlfriend...who's taller than you. A man. How sad.
I'm right here, darling. If you're man enough to come and steal me away from Barnette, well...you don't have the physicality for that.
Well, I doooo have a girlfriend...but if you can prove you're better than her, Ping, I might consider. You're starting off smaller, though.
Aren't men usually bigger than women? My little girlfriend's got more of a presence than you do, Mr. Soldier...so do try harder to win me over.
Hey, you little shrimp, I have a pilot's sharpness! You pulled some kind of trick on me!
Ugh! What a horrid little gremlin. I thought she was cute, and she just keeps calling me old...as she plays tricks with her hat.
...I don't know what kind of prank you're pulling, Miss-Six-Century, but it's not funny. And stop calling me old!
Honestly! Every little Earth kid I meet is a punk. How are they raising you, playing tricks on adults like that?
You're quite the fit little specimen, Rinkah. I know a certain squadron leader who'd fall head-over-heels for you...
I know a woman who loves muscles very much, Rinkah...you'd put her in a tizzy. Do Earth women like each other in that way?
Mind if I play a little matchmaker? I brought my boss here...and she loves muscles on a woman, even if she won't admit it.
You into women, sweetheart? Because I know a certain blue-haired ice queen who would totally fall for those abs of yours.
Didn't I mention it, honey? I'm from the beautiful planet Mejare--the world of women! And--w-wait, did your uniform just look at me?
Barnette and I are from Mejare, the woman planet, honey! And we...uh...we don't have uniforms who look at our guests. Is that thing alive?
Oh, stop shouting, Red-Streak. Mejare, my home planet, has no men at all--u-uh, did your uniform's eye just look around?
Didn't I mention how I'm from the all-female planet of Mejare yet, dearie? Why don't you--eek! Y-your uniform just looked at me!
Getting all liquored up, then? Can't say you have the height for it. Is this how you pick up men?
So is this how Earth girls spend a weekend? Getting sloppy-drunk and falling on top of strange men?
Oh, Sei, you're so cute! Don't tell me you're just going to get sloshed and let some beastly man ravish you this evening.
Is this really what you Earth women do? Get drunk and fondle strange men? Mejarians are hopeless romantics.
Finally shedding all your little things. That's good...women are much cuter unencumbered.
I can't get over how cute you are...especially without all that extra padding! Just a tiny little thing with gorgeous blue hair on top.
I wonder if you could pull off a dress like mine, Sei. You're so preoccupied with all that silly armor and padding...why wear it?
What is it you do again that requires all this nonsense on your person? You should wear something sexy!
Sh-Shimakaze! Are you OK? You're too cute to have burn scars!
Nooo! Shimakaze--are you alright? I can't have the cute little bunny girl all burnt up!
Fire! Fire--why's it over already? Are you OK, Shimakaze? Still cute? No scars?
Shimakaze! I don't know how the fire stopped, but you need to see Paiway! No cutie like you deserves burn wounds!
Oh, good, the knife. Wasn't sure what you were doing with that thing...
Why'd you even bring that thing? Just to scare us to death?
Phew...for a second there, I thought you brought that thing so you'd make some ghost friends.
Phew...OK. Everyone calm down, the dead woman is unarmed now.
OK, sure. Just drop all pretenses. why don't you? You're moving too fast with this.
You're a bigger tease than I am. Hey, make them work for it.
Hey, that little peek was enough. You're going to ruin the surprise!
Come now, Velma, drag it out a bit! You just got started...leave a little to the imagination.
No! Please! I--I--what? Omigosh, that's fantastic! Sorry I teased you!
...Oh my God! You just changed your whole outfit? That's spectacular! Sorry about those skin comments.
Omigosh! How--how'd you do that? Do it again! I want to see more outfits! Who cares if your skin's blue?
Wha--what'd you just do? How? Tell me everything! I'm sorry I made fun of your skin color!
Wha--omigosh! Butterflies and everything! It's so adorable!
Ooooh! I didn't believe you for a second, but I'm happy to be wrong! Those butterflies are so cute!
Eek! Omigosh! Omigosh! Zizou, that's so cool! I love butterflies!
Oooh, are those butterflies? That was so cool! Show me some more!
Swordbelt? Ooh, good eye, darling. You're right--my choker and harness are still attached!
Well, I've never heard anyone call it a swordbelt, dear, but you're right--I'm more resourceful. Please notice that my harness is still on my person.
Heehee! Oh, don't go back on it now, honey! It's not my fault Mejarians are resourceful enough to strip the weapon but leave the harness.
Hey, when I said I'd only drop my rapier, I meant it. Why count the weapon and harness all in one? Just foolish.
Er...as long as you're OK with it. I mean, I don't want you to think you had to.
That's...brave of you, Meia. Really. Sorry.
I mean, I dragged you here, but...I figured you'd leave that on.
I...I really didn't think that was going to come off. Not so soon, anyway.
I-I'm sorry. Shouldn't have teased you...
Meia...
A-are you OK, Meia? You feeling alright? Thought that thing wasn't going anywhere...
Did the Harvest get a hold of you or something? I thought that thing was staying on the whole game.
Um...well, the others don't know any better, but this is kind of awkward. Didn't think you'd take that off.
Swordbelt? Ooh, good memory, darling. You're right--I counted my harness and choker afterward!
Well, I've never heard anyone call it a swordbelt, dear, but you're right--I'm more resourceful. I parted with my harness well afterward.
Heehee! Oh, don't go back on it now, honey! It's not my fault Mejarians are resourceful enough to strip the weapon but leave the harness for later.
Hey, when I said I'd only drop my rapier, I meant it. Why count the weapon and harness all in one? ...Of course, it seems I needed that.
I guess that's understandable. Wouldn't want people prying...they don't know any better. I'll hold it if you want...
OK...makes sense. Want me to hold onto it?
Makes sense...they don't know what it is. Here, let me hold it.
I-I don't even know what to say. You are Meia, right?
You're Meia, right? I didn't lose her in the crowd for some blue-haired Earth woman with no attachment to her eyepiece?
Meia, I...this is so unlike you. They don't know it, but that does match me.
I...I'm sorry, Meia. You can put it back on.
I'm serious, don't take that off. You don't have to.
Where's this coming from, Meia? You can leave it on, really.
I know these Earth people will ask questions, but you can leave that on. They don't know any better.
You're making this really uncomfortable, Meia...mostly for yourself.
Believe me, I don't like seeing you all shaken like this. Definitely don't want to masturbate to it, either.
Hey, everyone leave her alone. That thing means a lot to her.
This is hard to watch...and impossible to get off to. Why'd you take that off, Meia?
...Never thought you'd do that just to spite me.
That wasn't fun, least of all for you. Why would you do that?
...I'm sorry I dragged you here. But please try to embrace it a little, OK?
So you're annoyed I dragged you here. Don't make it worse for yourself.
...Now you're just guilt-tripping me.
Wait, you--you--oh, wow. You weren't kidding. Uh...so, uh, what's it like using magic?
...OK. Yes. You're a real witch. I believe it. Excellent job.
Wait, where'd they go? Did you just make them--vanish? And I thought what the Paksis did was impressive...
...OK. I thought our technology was pretty impressive...but I can't tell what you just did. That thing looks like a stick!
I don't know what you think about yourself, frankly. This seems akin to calling myself Dread, or perhaps Red Claw.
I'm just going off the crazy names you're giving yourself. What if I were to waltz in here and call myself Dread Fighter Mk IV? Honestly.
B-brought to life by what, exactly? Are those Earthlings using our organs to make their museums move?
Brought to life by--harvested organs, perhaps? I suppose Earthlings turn their younger victims into walking dolls!
Yes, and I'll take your word for it. Is this what living with men does? Build up women's tolerance for monstrous freaks to roam the streets?
Yes, I'm sure it does. What kind of horrible planet lets sharp-toothed monsters run about the place? The same one that lets women mix with men, I suppose.
And why's that? You're a cute little thing with a nice figure. It sounds like something shot your self-esteem.
Well, if a girl's determined to not make a name for herself, then no amount of good looks can fix that. What happened to crush your confidence like this?
Are you still a bit shaky on the game's rules, Miss Pixie? You don't have to jump straight to the big-name items.
Jeez, Kyu, settle down. What kind of awful tease would jump straight to nudity? You've got to keep them guessing.
Hey, I know you're not shy about it, but do try to understand why these poor Earth people might be ashamed.
I don't get it either, Kyu, but don't get all mad. Earth people just tend to hate their own bodies.
Pretty stylish. What are the clothing stores like on Earth?
I've been a pirate for so long now. I kind of miss shopping, even if it did all go to the state.
...Yeah, listen. I'm a pirate. I don't need this to get excitement in my life.
...You know, I call you boring, Meia, but now I know better.
Not impressed with my strips so far, huh?
This is what makes my Barnette so wonderful. She barely wears anything!
You're like those horrid Mejarian soldiers with all your accessories. Or me.
Why wear what has no meaning to you? That's your M.O., right, Meia? Bless you, so laser-focused.
I see you have an eye for fashion. Just not sure its sight is 20/20.
Now that I think about it, Dita has a little necklace to remove...and so do I.
You're as boring as Meia. Tell them, Meia, they're just as boring as you.
Apparently some people just refuse to take off the good stuff.
Good thing pirates don't have uniforms. I'd have to ruin my outfit with a bunch of meaningless accessories!
Hey, Mejarians actually value their accessories...right, Meia?
Sorry I said anything, Meia. You're a party animal next to these Earth women.
You'd think the sight of Mejare's most beautiful woman would inspire some bolder stripping. Apparently not.
My dress is off, OK? I'm done teasing. Live a little.
Oh, ~name~...you're breaking my heart.
Hey, Meia, feel like teaching these Earth girls how to have fun? You're better at it than they are.
Hey, ~name~, I have a girlfriend. You're gonna have to work harder to hold my attention.
...Hit me, Dealer. Not with cards, I mean actually hit me.
Good thing I've done my part to put the "strip" in this game.
Guess I'll just have to beat you the hard way.
Hey, girlie, want to guess what I'll take off first?
Is that how you attract Earth men? Playing hard-to-get?
Earth women should be more proud of their bodies...unless you're just teasing me.
You're going to be a while, aren't you, dear? You're as cruel as you are cute.
How many little trinkets can you spot on my outfit? It's OK--I don't mind when women stare.
I guess I can't complain when I own just as many little things. But you make it so dull.
Hey, my accessories are a lot more fashionable. I have an excuse to wear them.
Hey, I lost my sword. Now that's exciting.
Guess I'll just go over the formations practice for tomorrow. You know, since you can't hold my attention.
Hm. That is annoying...but accessories are my whole plan!
Pretty stylish. What are the clothing stores like on Earth?
I've been a pirate for so long now. I kind of miss shopping, even if it did all go to the state.
...Yeah, listen. I'm a pirate. I don't need this to get excitement in my life.
...You know, I call Meia boring, but she only wears one accessory.
Not impressed with my strips so far, huh?
This is what makes my Barnette so wonderful. She barely wears anything!
You're like those horrid Mejarian soldiers with all your accessories. Or me.
Why wear what has no meaning to you? That's Meia's M.O. Bless that girl, so laser-focused.
I see you have an eye for fashion. Just not sure its sight is 20/20.
Now that I think about it, Dita has a little necklace to remove...and so do I.
You're as boring as Meia. Actually, you're worse, since Meia barely wears anything.
Apparently some people just refuse to take off the good stuff.
Good thing pirates don't have uniforms. I'd have to ruin my outfit with a bunch of meaningless accessories!
Meia only has one thing you might call an "accessory"...and she might not even want to take it off.
I've gotta say, compared to you, Meia's a party animal.
You'd think the sight of Mejare's most beautiful woman would inspire some bolder stripping. Apparently not.
My dress is off, OK? I'm done teasing. Live a little.
Oh, ~name~...you're breaking my heart.
Jeez, at this rate, I'll have to invite Meia over here to bring some fun to the evening.
Hey, ~name~, I have a girlfriend. You're gonna have to work harder to hold my attention.
...Hit me, Dealer. Not with cards, I mean actually hit me.
Good thing I've done my part to put the "strip" in this game.
Hey, I don't need to take this. I have a girlfriend, you know!
Maybe I'll just masturbate with my legs closed. We'll see how you like it!
This isn't how women should treat each other, ~name~.
I thought I was a tease. At least I don't wear much to begin with.
I expected to learn something about Earth women from this game. You know what I learned? They're boring.
At least tease me about it. You know, get the shame going a little.
Wow, did I lose bad. This is hard to bear.
Hey, I'm all done masturbating. Now there's nothing left but feelings of stupidity.
Heeheehee! I think your terrified expression says it all, Mister Blond! This isn't your first date with our little bombshell here!
Oh, give me a break, honey! Clearly you've been going steady with Miss Teen Model over here--hell, I wouldn't take Barnette here even now.
As if you're not eating out of each other's hands. Two teenagers willing to strip in public, testing their love in the ultimate trust exercise? So romantic!
Do you really expect me to believe that? I mean, I don't know much about men, but teens are teens--this can't be your first date.
Ouch. Shot down, Short Stuff. Mister Blond wants nothing to do with you.
Oof. I don't think he likes tiny girls with glasses, honey. But it's OK--our four-eyed engineer Parfet found a man for herself.
Jeez, I knew men could be tactless, but at least try to let Pint-size down easy. Women's hearts are delicate things.
Oh. Did I ruin the night for you already, Miss Glasses? I didn't think your teammate would be so callous to denounce you like that.
My, Mister Schoolboy, give her a chance! I know she's a little puny, but maybe she'll build you a sex robot or something.
Are you, now? Well, if you're truly an angel, why don't you use those wings to pick me up and fly?
An angel from the heavens? Well, I can fly--with a ship. Pick me up with those wings of yours.
You can't just say that without proving it, Mr. Angel. Treat a woman right--lift me up, give me an airborne tour.
Oh, just the heavens, is that all? I'm used to exploring the galaxy, dear--but if you could lift me up, I might believe you.
Dyed? Why? Ohhh, I wanted to see a blonde man! Bart's too much of a goofball.
...Oh. Why'd you do that? Shame on you for leading on a beautiful woman like me!
What? Oh, right, Earth people dye their hair for some reason. Care to share why, so I can take some solace in this?
...You know, you being a man is bad enough. Now you're dashing my hopes of a beautiful blonde child? Why'd you dye it anyway?
...Of course it's dyed. For a second there I thought a man might be useful to me. Please share why you're willing to deceive beautiful blonde women.
You really think so? But women always like it when I flirt with them!
Seriously? Men are a strange species. Girls love it when I come over and play around!
Men don't like being teased so much? But I always tease girls! What am I supposed to do, just wait around for them?
What, so I just have to wait for a man to tease me? That's boring! Women always like it when I approach them!
Hey, ~name~...ever seen an alien?
Is this a chink in the armor? You've yet to dent me, ~name~.
What's a man to do with a Mejarian taunting him? Take off something boring, apparently.
Men have proved to be nuisances in the past, but they've never proved to be dull.
I see you're not so easily seduced by my womanly charms. You'd make a good Tarakkian soldier.
Surprised to find a man wearing so many clothes. Tarak's all about efficiency--no style at all!
Why do men wear any clothes? Worried about your tubes catching a stray laser?
There were some men on that one outpost Miss Liz ran. But they were pretty grouchy, so I didn't mess with them.
Out of all the men on Earth, I get one who dresses more than a woman.
Yawn. How can a man manage to bore me?
Is that the best you can do? Hibiki helps me form my lovely Vandread--now that's exciting.
Sigh...seems I shouldn't have expected much from Earth after all.
Is that male skin I see? Oh, do show more.
Are you giving me yet another illustrative look into men's wardrobes?
Men and women marry on Earth, right? Do you go on dates first? For how long? Are you monogamous? How often do you have sex?
Won't you please take off some more? For sweet little Jura?
Our helmsman Bart's got his uniform to strip, which could be a lot...somehow the Paksis always makes him naked when he pilots, though.
~Clothing~, huh? Solid choice. Am I making you solid at all?
Pretty minor. I expect bold choices from a man, you know.
Guess Tarak didn't invent the whole no-fun-allowed thing for men.
What am I to do with such a boring specimen? I mean, look at all the exciting items I've removed!
Oh, boo. I wanted to see you naked!
That's so minor, I would've preferred something smaller. You're a man, indulge me a little!
What's Duero got under that labcoat of his? Don't know, but at least he'd show me.
That bastard Rabat would probably be pretty good at this game. He's the type to frequent seedy places like this.
Hey, ~name~...you feeling daring?
Take off some more, ~name~. Set my instincts aflame.
Come on, ~name~, I'm a pilot. Stripping is the only way you can thrill me.
Forgive me for not being awed by your bold displays of shoulders or whatever.
Come on, ~name~, can't you help me out a little more than that?
That's pretty insubstantial, ~name~. You're a man--there's a lot you could show me.
Oh, boo. Men are no fun at all, apparently.
...You know, I heard there are men who are only attracted to other men. You must be one of them.
Would you quit it with the game already? It's not like there's a prize!
...You're just gonna keep this up, aren't you?
Are you trying to tell me that my little masturbation show did nothing for you? Men are so weird!
Seriously, though, did I turn you on? I'm still trying to figure out men's sexualities.
Heehee! Not bad for the very first move! We have a better connection than silly little Nayru knows, right, ~player~?
Ooh, that's the way, ~player~! Prove Nayru wrong! I can't expect too much for the first round.
I guess that's about as big as I could hope to seduce out of you for round one. Still, better than nasty old Nayru said, right?
Ooh, not bad, ~player~. Never mind Nayru's warnings--you can trust me.
Hey, I like the looks of that, considering you've just begun. I guess he's got no hard feelings about my accessories, Nayru.
See, Nayru? Men are simple creatures--not petty enough to strip accessories just because I did.
Ohhh, ~player~, you're so sweet to start like that! Nayru, he understands that I'm a delicate, lightly dressed woman, so I started small.
See, Nayru? Men and women don't dress the same, nor do they strip the same. I take off small things, and the brave man goes bigger.
Seriously, honey, what is the deal with the grunting? It was funny for five minutes, but now it's embarrassing.
...So this is your identity, huh? Just going to grunt? Yeah, I think I'll find a man who's capable of telling me I'm beautiful.
I know you're overcome by my beauty, Elf-man, but this yelping thing is no longer endearing. Sheesh.
Maybe you're unaware, Elf-man, but I'm the kind of woman who's into dirty talk...so you're not really being my type at the moment.
"Personal reasons." Well, fair enough, dear, but next time at least wear a sign that says "Fake Blond."
At least you're honest. I didn't expect that kind of humility from the proud warriors men claim to be.
That's some stunning honesty. We could've been a lot more than strangers had you kept up the lie.
Well, aren't you humble. I'm sure there's a woman out there for a sweet little man like you--provided she doesn't mind dyed hair.
You really shriveled up with this, didn't you? Seriously, what is it with men and making statements with their hair? Bart shaved his head for personal reasons...
You can't run from me forever, ~name~.
I'm seeing more of you all the time. And it's all so fascinating!
Show a little skin, ~name~. As a girl I was told it was spiny, but I've got to know for sure.
Give this guy some bad cards, dealer. Show him this isn't funny.
I'm not going to let a prime piece of meat like you escape me unscathed.
Didn't know men were capable of teasing. Congrats.
Slowly but surely, I'm picking away. Waiting for a tube to sprout up from the ground.
I can feel the fires of instinct burning inside me, ~name~.
For those keeping score, I'm outplaying this man, as expected.
How much clothing do men wear? Soon, I'll know the answer.
Hibiki'd be all in a rage by now. I don't think he wears very much, being low-class on Tarak and all.
Earth men just don't seem to have that Tarakkian fire in the belly.
I work myself all up into a tizzy to see a man's sexuality in action, and this is what I get.
Hey, it's your tube I want to see. Men's clothes are tacky.
Please take off some more, ~name~...I'm so curious about men.
Tarakkians are so much more bold than you Earth men. I guess we Mejarians have put them on edge after all these years.
Look, men's fashion just doesn't interest me. Your organs, on the other hand...
Didn't think a man would be a tease...at least, not as much as I am.
I'm very interested in men...won't you take off more for me, please?
Hey. You're trapped in a small room with a gorgeous foreign young woman. She desperately wants you take some more clothes off.
Shame Hibiki's so lousy at cards, or I'd have brought him here. I mean, he's already so insecure about his height--imagine the rest of him!
Aren't my breasts enough to make you want to lose a little more?
Won't you take off a little more? For my sake? Pretty please?
Mr. Earth-man must think he's funny, taunting the Mejarian who just wants to see his tube.
Just because an Earth man has seen women's breasts before doesn't mean you should taunt me about my inexperience. Show something good!
I'm standing here nude. Don't you want to lose a little more?
Come on, ~name~. Let's do a dual anatomy investigation.
You're making this so hard for me, ~name~. I'm burning up inside, and all you do is fan the flames...
Bart's such a goofball, but he has his moments. I wonder if he could muster a poker face if he tried.
Guess I'll stick to women. At least they know how to have a good time.
Am I really asking for that much from you? Do men honestly care about nudity?
How is this not enough to turn you on? I'm so beautiful!
Gonna let me burn up over here, are you? You're just making Barnette's night harder, not mine.
Hey, ~name~. Take off a little more and I'll start up again, just for you.
I knew men were competitive, but sheesh. Give it a rest already.
Duero wouldn't be half bad at this, despite his limited wardrobe. He's got nothing but a poker face.
Gotta hand it to men's poker skills. Guess they have the brainpower to match shapes and count to ten.
Well, it's true--Christmas is a special time. It's so irresponsible for me to be here when the love of my life is back on the ship.
Well, I can agree that this holiday is quite the special occasion. So please show me your aging body in a hurry--I need to get back to my girlfriend while it's still Christmastime.
Heeheehee! Your face betrays you, Rinkah! It makes sense--battle makes emotions run high!
Your blushing says it all, darling. It's OK--a warrior's respect often turns into a lover's romance.
I'm a fighter, too, you know! You two can't fool me--battle gets the heart beating, with your lives on the line!
Warrior's respect becomes woman's passion in time, Rinkah. It's only natural--why wait for love when you could die any given day?
Well, at least you brought your girlfriend to help through this. I hope Barnette wouldn't be so cowardly.
Oh, so you two are lovers? That's so adorable! I've been going steady with Barnette for a while now.
Teeheehee! I didn't know you two were that close! I can tell Florina here is more Fama material, being all demure.
Ohhh, I get it! Lyn's helping you overcome your fears! What an adorable couple you two are, helping each other out!
It's about a 50/50 shot, honey. Sorry I made it a bit of a gamble whether you'd see her smile.
It depends on the day, Miss Policegirl. Sometimes Meia remembers how to laugh, and sometimes she gets all huffy.
I know it seems hopeless, Sei, darling, but I swear Meia can smile. It's all up to chance whether this helps.
Oh, I promise she's got a cute body and a beating heart under that suit. Whether stripping helps with that is split odds, I think.
Throwing out words like cameltoe isn't the way to my boss's heart, darling. It's her butt she's proud of--give that a shoutout!
Oh, Meia's well aware of how revealing her suit is, dear. She's proud of that backside of hers--go on, say something sweet about it.
Oh, come on, Meia, she's just a little tipsy. Well, OK, really tipsy. Quick, Sei--tell her her butt looks nice.
My, what an horny little boozeball. That sort of talk isn't Meia's thing, dear--try complimenting her butt. You know, in a classy way.
Hey, Miss Liquor, your little pick-up lines are off the mark. Meia wears this thing to show off her butt, so compliment that.

condition.saying: nowhere near as interested in men as she is

case.state: Stop reading so deep into things, would you? "We come in peace." Honestly, Earthlings have always been the aggressive ones.
Can't you trust that we mean what we say? Mejarians are a peaceful race, you know. We're always fending off nasty Earthlings these days, in fact.
That we are, Lizzie! I'm glad you're so interested in these boring old alien women.
We are pirates, Elizabeth...but don't worry, you're too much of a sweetheart to kill and rob!
Don't you worry your pretty little head off about it, honey. We may be pirates, but we only attack nasty soldier types.
Pirates we are, Elizabeth...and we've got so many stories of high adventure and death-defying stunts to tell.

...OK, I think we can safely ignore whatever Miss Politics has to say, Leader. Now she's talking about ghosts like it's Halloween.

...This girl's had too much to drink, Leader. I wouldn't take the advice of some Noble-Sword type who's stuck in the dark ages.

Oh, I see. You're a soldier clinging to notions of an honorable duel, aren't you? I'm a pirate, and I'd run you through from behind once my comrades have caused enough commotion.

I think I'm at the perfect level of exposure. A pirate wouldn't want heavy armor thunking around while she sneaks behind for the kill.
Oh, I agree--I'd have to be a fool to challenge you head-on, with your thick sword and thicker armor. But I'm a pirate, and we don't really play by the rules.
It's certainly a fashionable choice, but I'd say skintight clothes are the most popular on Mejare. Girls will be girls, even across the galaxy.

That's even more bizarre. So you keep them around as second-class citizens? Or are they there for you to keep your population up?

Eugh. I should have figured men's simple minds would think bigger is always better. But why?
...This explains quite a lot, unfortunately. Is it because you might last through one of Earth's winters, or something else entirely?
...All my scheming to get men's attention, and it turns out I needed Barnette to feed me her food instead. How could they prefer something so hideous?
I can't get over how cool this is. You should join our crew with aim like that!
...That's never going to get old. It's brilliant to watch!
The skill is one thing, but the daring! You're not scared at all!
This is unreal. I never knew Earth women could be so cool! Or daring! Or spunky!

Absolutely phenomenal! And you even manage to look beautiful as you do it! Could you maybe teach me?
I'd be quite the pirate if I could shoot like you! Can you give me some tips?
Attack from the air? You really are from a darker time--why not just use a lovely fighter ship, like my Dread?
Now, why are you forcing poor animals to fight for you? The wonders of technology have given us machines to fly--like my sleek, glorious Dread fighter.
Hmph! I didn't take you for such a cruel soul, Catria--torturing animals when machines exist! And I bet my Dread is faster, too.
Horses? Like, the animal? That sounds slow, cruel, and inefficient--can't you afford Dread fighters? You know, machines?
Omigosh, Faye, that jacket is so stylish! And the way you let it hang there just screams personality.
I like your style, honey! A scarlet-red jacket, just draped all sexy-like around your delicate frame...exquisite.
Ooh, that jacket is so cool-looking! My dress is the only fancy thing I own...such is the life of a pirate.
Ooh, I barely noticed that thing, the way you draped it around yourself with style! You've got an eye for sex appeal, honey.
Hahahaha! Oh, don't take things so seriously! You're still cute--you're just a little on the short side, that's all!

I'm just teasing, dear! Don't take it personally--I'm quite used to towering over women.
Oh, are you sensitive about your height? Don't worry, dear--I hear short men get much more flack for it.

Hey, Kyoko, you look mortified. Something happen? Bad memories of men resurfacing?
Hey, Miss Pokerface, you're not really living up the nickname anymore. What's wrong?

And is every woman on Planet France as cute-looking and sounding as you? It sounds like heaven, then!
Omigosh, Marinette! You're from planet "France," right? And everyone speaks French there? That's so exciting!
Watch out, folks. That armor can take some abuse...and it takes a while to get it off.
Did you know? Meia wears that armor to show she's our squadron leader. She's a smart cookie!

Ace pilot, sure, but that armor can't seem to deflect aces.
Oho, and here comes your cute--floating...legless...servant woman.
And who's this adorable little servant girl? Who's...floating. With no legs.

...What planet are you from, again? Mejare has a servant class...but those girls have legs. And they walk on the ground.
So what's your story, dear? Don't you keep going on about "Angels" or something like that? I'm curious.
I keep hearing about these "Angel" attacks. Are they bad? Because you came out looking pretty cute.
Don't you fight "Angels" or something, dear? I hope you don't mistake me for one...I could understand doing so.
So you're all about fighting off "Angels"? Hey, you're looking at one...don't shoot, darling.
Should I ask why you wear so much extra stuff when you just want to take it off in a hurry?
I'm trying to be sensual and fun. This girl is advertising her diseases.
...You all know I'm just flirting, right? I'm not like this girl, I swear.
I can't believe what I'm hearing. I was just making jokes about Earth girls being sex fiends thanks to men...and now I meet one.

Seriously? Oh, Palutena, I was thinking about asking Barnette to marry me--could you bless us, maybe?
Omigosh, Palutena, do you mean it? I kind of want to propose to her--do you think you could bless us?
Ooh! Just between the two of us, Miss Goddess--I think I'm popping the question soon. Could we get a blessing and some holy light?
Hahahaha! Come now, Pyrrha, you don't need to deny anything! We're all dirty for coming here.

This is going to be a long evening if you play dumb the whole time. I can admit I just like people ogling me--so can you, cutie.
Hm? Oh, right, you brought your partner along. Why isn't she playing? Or saying anything?

Is that your wrestling partner helping you out? What a loyal friend...even if she doesn't have much on her mind.

Eek! W-what is it with Earthlings and weird mind powers? This isn't fair!
Wha--oh, of course she's got messed-up mind powers! I didn't realize how common this was on Earth!
...And now you're floating. Well, that one Earth boy could pin us down with his mind, so why not do the opposite?
...Another Earthling with freaky mind powers? At least it's a girl this time.

Don't be all embarrassed, Meia. They don't know about your eyepiece...
Well, you'll feel better after this, right? All loose and limber.
Getting out of that armor would certainly cheer me up.
Come on, now. Perk up a bit. Where's that fighting spirit we all look up to?
You're too cute to be this sour, Meia...even though you always are.
OK, I think everyone'll be happy with that one.
That's more along the lines of what I expected. Don't freak me out like that, Meia, OK?
I guess that armor's a little sentimental, too. Gee, your outfit's nothing but personal mementos.
That's what you're going with? Didn't you bring a laser ring or something else small?
This'll cheer you up, right? Or at least free you up. Come on, it's not so bad.

Don't be sour the whole night. What will Earth think of Mejare, besides how it's got a pirate problem?
OK...that's more what I espected. Don't get all weird on me.
That's better. Be the Meia I know and love, why don't you? Just a little sexier.
OK, that I can get behind. Go back to the Meia I'm used to, please.
There's the Meia I know! Already taking off the good stuff, and insisting she isn't sexy.

That's the way! It's all big and clunky. Now you can enjoy yourself in just the bodysuit!
Now with just the bodysuit, you'll be able to stretch out...like me.
That's more like it. Just think how cute you'll look in just the bodysuit, especially to these Earth people!

What a letdown. I should just masturbate already--that'd be fun, at least.

A boring choice for a boring woman.

Does that outfit attract men? Or are they solely focused on what's underneath?
Apparently Earth women subscribe to Meia's idea of fun.
What a letdown. I should just masturbate already--that'd be fun, at least.
Yeah, yeah, we get it. You're a real poker master. Show some skin already.

...Well, back to thinking about Barnette.
I don't masturbate often, you know. I have help the next room over on the ship. So make this good for me!
You're such a bore, ~name~. I guess men suck the fun out of a planet.

Is that in style on Earth? Fashion's the most I can get out of your stripping now...
Earth people really are intense. I mean, I guess the Harvest had taught me that already.

I'm...not sure she'd appreciate that. It's basically telling her I find her so boring that I invited a woman twice her age into bed with us.

Meia might be a pretty dull girlfriend, sure, but that apathetic mood keeps our pilots calm. I always panic when I have to lead...
Hahahaha! Meia might not be very fun, Saki, but that's what makes her such a good leader! I trust my life to that cool head.
Meia is cool and collected, I can tell you that. Nothing rattles her, even when the enemy bears down on us.

Piloting teaches you how cool any girl can be, "Number-Two." Meia's our best one, and she keeps our heads on straight as she does it.
This isn't exactly Meia's idea of fun like it is mine. I mean, she likes feeling sexy, but she'd never admit it.

Don't let Meia fool you into thinking she doesn't like feeling sexy. Just look at that suit she wears--her butt is constantly on display!

Hash browns.

Omigosh, I have to introduce you to Barnette. She's a total gun nut!
My girlfriend loves those old men's weapons. You've just got to meet her!

Heehee! I knew you had a dirty side, Elizabeth! No girl that sweet would come here in that.

You're a spacefarer, and still you cling to old men's guns? You're just like my girlfriend, though she's just a collector.

I don't know, dear. Did you not have your glasses on when you were looking for your sense of humor?
Hey, at least you've got some fighting spirit! Pint-sized Hibiki is the same way, so I guess shortness transcends sex.
Yeah, can't crack a joke about Hibiki's height without him getting all huffy, either. You shorties are such hotheads.
You Earth girls always call my clothes skimpy, like I'm supposed to be ashamed of my body. But then, I have a lot more of it.

Eeek! W-what's wrong with your--u-uh, I'm sorry! It's not so bad, really!

Heeheehee! I knew the alcohol would get you to talk! It's cool how we both fight aliens!
